xG03t4YUBIXKzjInAy-mIA.text: Food was decent.  However, the service was poor, mostly at the end.  I was pulling my wallet out to grab a credit card as the server was leaving the ticket, so it should have been beyond obvious we were ready to go.  However, 10 minutes later we were still sitting there with the credit card on the table and the server had not been back.  My wife went to the restroom, and he still hadn't been back even after that.  I went up to pay at the bar and was told my server had to ring it up.  I told them to get his happy ass over there.  After a couple more minutes I just left some cash and we left.

kMu_T-TWjvyxzoQW7NvOFQ.text: I got the Mos Melt and it didn't even come out as burger, it was a sandwich.. weird..   It wasn't bad. Get it Medium-well, its close to Well-done.   The pickle on the side was terrible, it wasn't juicy, it was dry and old..   I got their firecracker coleslaw on the side, nothing sparking here.. (it was just coleslaw, nothing spicy, or a kick of anything).   Dim environment, if you're into that kind of thing.   They completely forgot someones order until we said something (while everyone was halfway done). Not the waiters fault, it was the kitchen.

ZZr6S6uxoCkfqInMeOw81g.text: Stopped in here for a quick lunch while walking thru the Miracle Mile Shops. WORST food experience in Las Vegas!! Waitress warned us away from several items - should have been our clue to have a beer and go somewhere else for food... Nachos were 12 chips of pasty cardboard and the boneless wings were fried to shoe leather texture. Do yourself a favor - eat somewhere else!

ZUnSnBHFfGins36jR2_tJg.text: Food was alright, it came out cold. Instead of the manager apologizing, he blamed it on the weather and didn't even take care of the bill or give us a free drink, nothing. It took the waitress 30minutes to even acknowledge us. And when I got my money back from the bill, she was $10 short. HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!

y2JU8oDR36sp-YpfhY-FGA.text: This became by favorite BBQ Rib spot. The service was excellent. The pricing is reasonable and the portions are huge. The ribs were cooked to perfection and the street corn rubbed with butter was delicious. The Mac and cheese was good and was better with the green sauce that is available. Will definitely go back

hplOpiR6q-fYUHJKlOtHwg.text: This place gets its stars from me purely based on location! It is great for people watching. The service was good, but the food was ok. I probably will never go here again. Everyone I was with said their food was good, but mine was just ok. I'm not sure if it was 3 days of partying or what, but after eating here I felt horrible. I just was not impressed. The atmosphere is fun though!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken lime avocado sandwich
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge burger with bacon and egg, my boyfriend loved it

lqQteS4oGYhZpwHG68ZF7Q.text: I would love to give this place fewer stars, but I can't... because of an amazing bartender named Emanuel.   We started outside and the outdoor bar, but it started to rain, so we went inside. At the indoor bar, we were ignored for a good 30 minutes. All the while, we were attempting to capture the bartender's attention like we were drowning and she had the life preserver. Nothing. She was literally 2 feet from us and would turn her back to us to serve brand new walk-ups.   After 30 minutes of neglect, we went back to the outdoor bar, despite the rain. I have a feeling it was because we had all-you-can-drink wristbands, but it doesn't matter. As we were walking out, the manager said, "Thank you, ladies!" (Thinking we were leaving.) I stopped and said, "We're not leaving. We just can't get served in there, so we're going outside."   Here's what had me most taken aback - she ROLLED her eyes at me and walked away! No, "I apologize. What can I get for you?..." or anything of the sort. Must be nice to be in a position where you can afford to be blatantly rude to customers!  The experience outside was completely different. The bartenders were far busier outside, but they were conscious, attentive and friendly. The only reason I'm giving a decent rating to this place is because of our experience outside, especially with Emanuel.   Bottom line is we drank 35 drinks between us and tipped more than average per drink, then left an extra larger bill for him at the end.   I'm not even going to blame the indoor bartender because she's obviously being managed by someone with a horrible attitude and zero clue about customer service.  Thank you, Emanuel, for turning our experience around so quickly and for making my birthday VERY special!!!

1hXGWNkoEn3cG6jrnJ-Vcw.text: PBR Rock Bar & Grill is a great place to have a really good drink and people watch right on the Strip.  It's part of the Miracle Mile Shops which are worth your time!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary....-

m-JTEu61zxIJkdJF1VpurQ.text: We had so much fun here! If you can sit in Heather's section. She's the BEST! Super accommodating, friendly, great recommendations, & a blast to talk to! Will definitely come back!

NJWxPYyfj9Q81JIFmv4BpQ.text: My husband and another couple came here for lunch and dinner. This place has delicious food! We ordered the 10 piece buffalo wings. The wings were very meaty and had delicious sauce. Our friends were talked into ordering a 24 piece bbq wings. It was a little too much food for them. The bbq sauce was amazing! I loved it on the wings and pizza. The only downsides were than my pizza was burnt and the food made me feel pretty full and gross afterward   The atmosphere is great to be. They play good music during the day and night. It is was exciting to watch beer pong on the tvs from the other room and the mechanical bull riders.   The service was great. Staff was attentive and helpful while ordering. Great food and good prices for Vegas!

2d6Nns3oEOM1FScsZQcJDA.text: I ate at this place with family when I was in Las Vegas! I had a great time!! The music was great just know it will be on the louder side! I watched people/kids try to ride the bull and that was really funny!! Plenty of TVS to watch while waiting for the food! The food was great!!   The only problem I had was not understanding what the waitress was saying. She talked a little fast..  Over all this place was my favorite restaurant in all the places I ate in Las Vegas!!

1js7y8cHNgnnTIFZKqwVhg.text: This was the worst experience I had in Las Vegas. We waited 45 minutes our server never showed up. A party came in after us and they got waters and served right of way. was it because we were Latinos and the other party white  never coming back.

ZhoM3p-oyX0A7KWwlU0dqA.text: ENVIRONMENT Both indoor and outdoor seating. Western rock and roll theme with a large bar.  MENU Tons of comfort food options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Doritos Mac N' Cheese, corn on the Cobb, chili, everything.   Also there's an all day open bar for $50   APPS Spinach and artichoke dip - served with potato chips. Great for hangovers.a we  ENTREE Grilled Salmon - the corn on the Cobb is my favorite part, it's still on the husk. The salmon is a top a bed of spinach with bacon.

FMknxCvh6173tOslbwOjQw.text: We were welcomed by David out front who was very positive and energy was high we were impressed considering the temperature outside was high. Our food and service.by Jorge in then outside patio was excellent. We stop by in here every vegas trip and will continue.

Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6-f554b4KsQ2GbDFJZkeqw.text: Horrible. Overpriced. Precooked. I really couldn't say it any simpler. I ordered the chicken mac n cheese foolishly expecting actual Mac n cheese. It was a bowl of shells with the runniest liquid cheese, devoid of flavor. No amount of shredded cheese and pepper could save this dish. The food came out so fast it's obvious that it's precooked. If you're looking for a fun loud place to drink, watch a game or the people walking the strip then this might be a good place. If you want a good meal cooked to order then go somewhere else

BPHurHRUePNdZ1TgNgiCXg.text: On first impression, I didn't want to even come into the place just solely on the decor. (Don't kill me for being honest.) I mean, the inside is really dark, there's a bull-riding contraption, and I assumed it would just be a knock off of Cabo Wabo across the hotel.  The service and food were complete opposites!  Workers were really sweet and friendly and super accomodating.  I had their pulled pork burger and baked beans and it was really good. Definitely what I was craving and I'm glad I wasn't afraid of sampsing (sampling) this joint!  They also have good happy hour and twitter specials =)

Sc9mDodV8Gvh4JF4_-po0g.text: We came here for a quick lunch. The food is just average, your typical bar food. The portions are big so it's considerably cheap. Lots of TVs all around the place playing different channels so there's always something to watch, plus our waiter was quick and attentive.  Potato Skins - 6 on a plate, crispy skin, good amount of cheddar and bacon.  Memphis Style BBQ Pork Burger - the burger was huge. LOTS of meat, but a little too salty, we downed alot of water eating this.  Dorito Crusted Mac & Cheese - we got lured in by the name, the mac & cheese was tasteless, and by "Dorito crusted" it means they crush a handful of Doritos and layer it on the mac & cheese. I can make a better version of it myself.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Memphis Style BBQ Pork Burger &amp; Dorito Crusted Mac N Cheese

subzBc-SlYMqiRGioxx5pQ.text: Very bland food. Nothing special. I had to send back a brisket sandwich that was over cooked in microwave it was so dry and chewy.   Good service and friendly but nothing worth coming back for.

-HnTEGg9e-7sEUB1D71Wzg.text: Absolutely worst food I've ever had and the service was just average. My fiance and I came in for our first meal since we arrived in Vegas and was way more than disappointed. What I ordered did not mention anything about having sour cream on it in the menu but it came out with sour cream drizzled all over it. I'm a server myself and didn't want to be that customer that complains so I decided to wipe the sour cream off. It still sucked! Our waitress came with a refill for my fiance while I was trying to wipe off the sour cream with a napkin and didn't even say anything to me about wanting to remake the dish so I didn't have to continue to wipe it off. Other than that it was also not even warm. Again I'm not the complaining type but however I do want to try and warn other Yelp reviewers that this is a place to avoid.

7wL22sReTVLRggo10HqJIQ.text: So far i'm an hour in still waiting on one grilled chicken sandwich! My friend is waiting on a salad! And no explanation from the waitress for the wait.

K0oGh0eCz3nw42NS1qcIVQ.text: I'm here everytime I visit Las Vegas (and I'm here often) I absolutely love it. The bartenders are always friendly the food is awesome I've had wings and burgers here. The atmosphere is amazing highly recommend This place for sure

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watching the cowboys vs redskins

SuwF-82SywRTuNtaMG0OUw.text: Service was very slow and he screwed up our ordered three times cause he wasn't listening. We only had two appetizers so it wasn't that hard to get right.  The food was low quality. We had fries and wing and some how the wings were sweet and sour not buffalo. The fries were some how soft ? I would go way out if my way not to go here again

fYmolE-WF6ABiB2A-x9Esw.text: We had lunch on Saturday, they were celebrating Horny Halloween, but the crowd was gathered for college football. It took us a few minutes to be seated. We looked over the menu and got started with their pepper poppers. They looked unappealing, and they were very greasy. The pepper was very tough, when you tried to cut into it, the filling spilled out.  Next, came our entrees the Big Bossman salad and the Bloomin' Onion burger. The burger is topped with cheese and fried, and then served with grilled onions, tomato and bacon. It was dry, dry, dry. How can that be? After the peppers the grease was too much to bear so I switched with my hubby a few bites in. The salad was wilted. It seemed like a bowl of mush. I was not a fan. The husband asked for their house cornbread muffins. The texture was off, but the flavor was decent, I liked addition of diced jalapeno. They were the highlight of the meal.  Service was average, and overall the place had an odd vibe. It's a great place to watch games, lots of nice TVs, but stick to drinks because the food is weak. PBR makes you think country, but much of the music was rock. I suppose it is a rock bar, but then they threw in pop like Katy Perry. Not sure how that fits. I'd say it has a bit of an identity crisis.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. corn muffins
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bloomin&#39; onion burger
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. big bossman

QSR3OTf86aR3niI2q7MWRw.text: Had lunch on a saturday afternoon. Food was great! We sat outside and enjoyed the people watching. The giant burger my husband had was literally falling apart it was so rare. :( We didn't complain though, he was hungry so he ate the outer edges and the fries. I  had the pulled pork and it was fantastic. The portions were huge. The price was way higher than it should be of course, but comparable to any sports bar/grill restaurant on the strip. Service was good.

VaYaHiXuY31B7qGviV1Q0w.text: I have never been treated so rude by a assistant manager (Jeffery) in my life. My rights to be at a public establishment were violated because a guy who is a regular at the bar or at least he tips the bartender "Cara" well said we were rude.  My buddy and I were "cut off" first of all my buddy was only drinking soda.   The "regular" and the bartender Cara already had thier shot together so he wanted to talk to someone else. He was trying to tell me his life story at the bar.  I was not interested.  Even the bartender Cara told him a few times not to be nosy because he even asked my buddy who happens to work for the same company how much he makes.  He kept talking to me even though he knew because I told him he talked a lot that I had no interest in speaking to him.  So after I  finished my cocktail the restaurant manager Jeffery told us we had to leave. We were not asked any questions by Jeffery but told we were cut off (btw my buddy had not has a alcoholic drink at all). I asked why and Jeffery said because he had a complaint.  If the bartender Cara's only concern is tips then you should not be allowed to over serve a regular then take shots with them. I asked for the General managers card and the Gil and Jeffery would not give it to me it was not until I had to reenter to have one of the other personnel give me Matt Aldrich's card. I have called Matt the GM hopefully I will get a response.  I certainly hope the video and audio is reviewed and I am contacted with the apology.

CLfF9G6CKbS-iF5s_IVdug.text: We stopped here to eat because we wanted something with an outdoor patio so we could people watch- well me more then the husband. The first place we were seated we had to move because there was a table of 4 women and 3 of them were smoking. I thought smoking was against the law at restaurants in Las Vegas? Either way it was gross. We ordered 2 teas, bucking bull potatoes, a Caesar salad, and steak &eggs. The food was just ok. I I wish we had eaten somewhere else honestly. The potatoes were smothered in cheese sauce(sounds great right?) and the bacon was more like bacon bits vs nice crispy bacon. My salad was just blah. All the dressing was at the bottom, the pieces of lettuce were huge and not too fresh looking. The corn bread croutons were not crunchy.  I feel like we wasted $50. We should have eaten at Mon Ami Gabi.

Kx7ymGYcMKZnSOb4K4KOpw.text: Went here around 11:30pm Wednesday night, we had a travel zoo drink voucher that we had purchased at a reduced price. We decided to hit the walk up bar rather than going inside (the music was SO loud and the  inside was packed), the girl at the bar totally ignored us even though we stood in front of her for atleast 3 minutes before she looked up. We handed over the coupon, she looked at it dumbfounded, and then said "Ok, you can only get this cup!" as she showed us the Pilsner cups, we knew this already since it clearly stated it on the voucher. So we told her what flavor frozen drink we wanted, I got the Hurricane and my wife got Coral Crush, mine was down right sour, pretty much undrinkable, and the coral crush was way too sweet. Pretty glad we didn't pay full price for the drinks or the horrible service.

uW1KNEvZsOmoQUC50N1K-A.text: I came here during NYE weekend on a Sunday to watch the football games.  The food was A-OK. It got pretty packed as the day went by the servers are very attentive and the food (which I had the ribs) were OK.  They didn't play any of the games over the speaker just showed them on the TVs which I would have preferred to at least hear the main game.    The bull was used quite a few times which was pretty entertaining. But if you decide to hang out there during Sunday Football I would suggest to get there around 12noon so you get a good seat or you'll be waiting about 30-1hr for a table.

Xs46zyHVMipxPZ0gt1Fb4w.text: I've been to another location on the strip for drinks & had a great time. When entering Planet Hollywood we were handed bogo drink coupons for PBR Rock Bar. We were looking for a quick bite on the way to a comedy show so I stopped here at the bar. I ordered the Bull Shrimp off the appetizer menu & I'm happy to report that it was delicious. The shrimp were plump, juicy, spicy & not over cooked at all. The sauce I could have eaten off the floor it was just the right mix of spices & creamy goodness. I mixed up the shoestring fries in every ounce of leftover sauce & consumed them happily. The bar staff was knowledgeable & kept the drinks flowing which at the bar is a must in my book.

fpfIhTtAM4hAFNOmtylJaA.text: We went to this place late at night around 12:30 and I'm glad we could find a place open and close to our hotel. They had live music and the band was really good! Played country and other chill jams. The only problem was it took a while to get out food and it wasn't busy at all so I'm not sure what took so long. I got a Belgium waffle that was actually really really good!! My roommate got an omelet which she really like. I understand we're in vegas but tI don't think the waitresses need to be wearing such trashy outfits. It kinda made the place seem unprofessional. Anyways good food but long time to receive food.

The benches you sit on were not comfortable. Be prepared. Unless you have a lot of cushion maybe. ?? Staff was friendly mostly. Pricey, everything was good except the fries.

wyFUKohSMf8PmQuuO9UpXA.text: Nice atmosphere, decent food. I ordered the bull shrimp and my friend got the steak and eggs. We also ordered wings.   My dish was good, the sauce was divine. Only issue I found was that my food was lukewarm. I'm a stickler for sizzling hot, fresh off the press food so that was probably the only downside.   Overall the food was average. Something you'd find anywhere.   Casual eatery, lots of blue collar, happy hour folks and baby boomers just wanting to have a good time. I'd say give it a try :)

YK8y-98pE5v44xn8nuj-hQ.text: Odd experience at this place. In summary the food is average, and by average I mean... Not bad, some good things but nothing special. Except for the PBR Bloody Mary... That was really good. Good service inside the restaurant...   But the hostesses, oh my god, a total disaster, that is the young ladies that greet you at the entrances lacked intelligence, were rude, slow, unaware, condescending, argumentative, inefficient, unprofessional and hostile.  I came to the restaurant at 7:30 on July 9th. I was given one price for entry by the outside hostess but at the main entrance I was greeted with outright hostility and condescension by another two hostesses and was told the price was higher and was accused of lying.  Another hostess accused me of inappropriately touching her when my shirt cuff accidentally brushed against her. Finally once inside another hostess wanted to make sure we knew the people we were sitting with and stopped to make sure we weren't lying about knowing our table mates.  I am happy to provide a more detailed account to any member of the management team should they want to contact me.   In conclusion, a decent spot to watch a fight with food and drinks that are not disappointing. But the staff that manages the entrances should not be working in the service industry and are hurting this business with their lack of aptitude, intelligence and basic host skills.

DBxZLc4BzwSguMZtWgc1wQ.text: Not overly busy at lunch hour but the hostesses (3 of them) had to discuss for a couple of minutes where to seat us. Server promptly took our food and drink order but it took about ten minutes and one prompt to get our sodas. Burgers were frozen patties, not hand-pattied, and top of bun was frozen in the middle. Fries arrived cold, second round of fries barely warm. Server was friendly but food was not at all impressive.

IL7-IG0w-Kz8idThYIV6Rw.text: Strolled across this place around noon on Friday.  Our flight landed in Vegas at 7:30am, and we made a pinkie swear that we were going to eat breakfast before we got drunk.  So, lunch it was, at PBR.  And we were kind of drunk already.  Beers weren't too badly priced, we got wings which were REALLY good, very spicy.  Also got the pulled pork sandwich, but since I was planning to hit the pool later, I ditched the bun...don't want to look fat and carb'y.  Where do I get the idea that not eating bread will be a good idea, in Vegas?  Ugh.  Anyway, it's not the sandwiches fault!  Was also good, and came with Sweet Potato Tater Tots, of which I had one...was very tasty!  BF had the rest and concurred. Damn, I should have had more than one!!!  We'd go there again, it was fun to sit on the patio, lots of people watching, shaded tables, food that we had was very good, beers were not a complete "F U we can charge ridiculous prices...it's Vegas".

-pYTKnjX5KFuDr52nE07HA.text: This place was pretty dreadful. In a vacuum, it's mediocre at best but considering the price (my sandwich was $15 and that's probably on the cheaper end here) and what else you can be eating (it's in LV with so many other competitors) I have to make it 2 stars. The mac and cheese honestly tasted like easy mac and the cheese on the nachos gave me Taco Bell flashbacks.  The decor was so tacky and stereotypical and they blasted two sources of music way too loud so you can't talk about how bad your food is to your friends/family.  Tldr: pretty bad. I'd give it another try if it weren't so expensive. Fast food tastes better and is a better value.

hVwFNLtPKpR2XllY-dMOYg.text: We ate here on a Saturday night and the service was not great but not too bad. The bull riding was fun. The fried pickles are not good but the chicken tenders were on point. I would probably not go back or recommend just because they are so many other places that are very similar with above average service.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vEvknliWVLHr_C7nBoTS8A.text: Service great! Fun staff even at 330 am there still friendly and ready to have fun with the customer.  The food is amazing! I tried the blacken cajun fettuccine. . OMG SO FREAKING GOOD !! Season very well , huge portion, and  flavorful

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n8Q1xWEJzBDD64r3Urk10g.text: The tostada nachos with pulled pork were amazing! Great view of the strip if you eat outside. Also highly recommend both the mango and strawberry daiquiri. Our waitress was extremely friendly and gave great service.

VsvYc8KsIRQlbVXXwRVUzg.text: What a fantastic experience! Great food and the service was actually what I can only say was over the top! Sean was incredibly attentive and even laughed at my bad jokes when he was busy! Meant a lot on our first day in Vegas in over 10 years. Andie was serving and she was a doll as well. Highly recommend and ask for Sean :)

fbiDf-r2_Ia8CS2XaRYeoA.text: The food was terrible. The pretzel was burnt and the spinach and artichoke dip was gross. And the service was also terrible. Didn't wait on us for probably 10+ minutes, gave us attitude and messed our order up. Don't waste your money here! Plenty of other options in Planet Hollywood.

lepdbByxlnjaJ-UTl7Q-gQ.text: We went for lunch and ordered two drinks and an order of pulled pork nachos. The food was delicious. The only downside was the guacamole on the nachos. Please take a minute and make your own from fresh avocados. That premade stuff isn't fooling anybody. Otherwise the nachos were awesome! Such a shame to shortcut on what could be a prefect dish. Loved the homemade chips! The Bloody Mary was really peppery but tasty, and the sweetened bacon in it was THE BEST. Hubby enjoyed his beer and we had excellent service. One of my favorite souvenirs is the photo we bought here in black and white. The photographer was really good. We will be back! I really hope y'all will make your own guacamole soon! Enjoyed the experience.

TsL0hcNVuB7VnjycBfJ8sQ.text: I've only been here once, it was an ok experience.  I'd come back for another try as long as I'm staying at PH (convenience).  The steak & eggs breakfast was on point (except for the cold potatoes), that steak is bomb!!  The Bloody Mary was meh tho, maybe less ice and a little lemon would've made it better.  Overall, 3 stars on the vegas strip.

fdHVk1nLC-b8MPDqSamLDA.text: We are currently here celebrating my spouse's birthday and was treated with nothing less than excellent service. Our waitress Joanna was extremely tentative the whole time, while managing a lot of tables at once. She not only served us but went out of her way to find out specific tourist sites we wanted to see. She took our order for drinks, appetizers, entrees and desserts all at once and literally everything came out one after the other. I would recommend anyone stop in to get created as a valued customer.

S7s2y86ZhVoA7cMcQZRrZg.text: Spur of the moment decision to give this place a try and we were so glad we did! The service was amazing and food was even better! I would recommend trying the BBQ chicken pizza if you stop by. We ended up going back the next day for drinks and to ride the mechanical bull which was so much fun.

XVfMoJ1aMVg-4XWzwRJMFw.text: Got a chunk of meat here that was way better than I thought it was going to be. The rest of the table had a mixed experience, some really liking their burgers etc, others not impressed at all with the Mexican food options.   We sat outside and people watched sipping our PBRs, and then headed inside which was a little more boisterous, and bigger than expected.   I was the sucker who rode the bull. Despite asking nicely the lady wouldn't put it on the 'kid' setting for me so I took longer to sign the waiver than I spent on the 'bull'.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wj8THhJrzw6WIbTHG10t_w.text: Buyer beware. We came here for a late lunch and they had a promotion for happy hour from 2-6 on Sunday's. We ordered 2 for 1 cocktails only to be told AFTER we ordered that it wasn't available on football days. When we questioned it, we were told that the marketing department should put an asterisk to clear up confusion. Last time I checked, football has been in season for a few months now. Clearly, they did this on purpose and hope people are dumb or wasted enough not to question. Poor management.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zCc5Mr9EeCCRt6pmlPZShg.text: Fried mac & cheese balls were delicious, buffalo chicken pizza was great but wish I had gone for the BBQ instead. Husband talked for 5 years about their coleslaw with pop rocks, finally got here only to find out they no longer have pop rocks in them. On it's own it was mediocre coleslaw but coleslaw itself is generally very mediocre. Yes it smelled like sewage but so did 99% of Vegas

AdhJNpLGq3Gti5upVI4wJA.text: Hostesses were nice, food was mehhh, the guy who served us our food was nice, but the service by our waitress Heather was absolutely atrocious, ambience was pretty lacking too (we were sat next to the escalator).   I had the brisket sandwich which was quite terrible but would've gotten 3 stars if it weren't for Heather who tipped herself 20% even though her service was a 15% at best. The bottom of the receipt already has the calculated tips and she wrote in pen a total that gave her the 20% suggestion and circled the "total" which also incidentally nearly blacked out the actual printed total pre-tip. We gave her our two cards and told her $69 on one and $23 on the other. Not only was she incompetent and switched the cards (they're not even the same colors) but she charged extra to the one that was supposed to be $23 so that she bumped herself up from a 17% back to 20%.   It wasn't that much of a difference at all, but it's the principle. Especially because she had me reiterate how much each card was supposed to charged. Besides the fact that she forced us to give her a 20%, she was rude to us from the start when taking our orders practically spewing venom. She was clearly having a bad day but geez if you're going to give yourself 20% you can at least be fake nice / pleasant or at a bare minimum indifferent.

cNuB4kBsKx4Nx5u7Bu_XDA.text: Saw this on Facebook. Big disappointment. Food came out cold and waitress acted completely uninterested. If you are short do not sit at the tables. It will be an uncomfortable reach. Food was just OK. I ordered the nachos thinking they would be a plate of nachos but no it was a plate of individual nachos with the ingredients on them. Tasted ok though just came cold. My friends ordered burgers. She requested mayo and they were out which is understandable since it was memorial weekend. Tried to give it a chance but just not impressed.

r4RIq0nG8Rk5GzRCMR-guA.text: Bad bad bad experience. Been here twice, got food poisoning both times. Went there the next day just to let the staff know and they treated me and my family with such disrespect.. as if we were complaining or arguing? Assuming that we wanted free food or a discount. Just wanted to tell the staff what happened. That was all.. weird way to treat a customer I think. Also when I was there, we wanted to talk to the manager and he shook his head and walked away. Maybe he just wasn't having a good day? Not sure. Not a good excuse to be treating customers like that. So rude

TXPXH5C5rb8fgIf58Nnh8g.text: definitely a place to stop for a beer on the strip. The outdoor bar is really nice to sit at and relax after a day of walking. service there is pretty good.

auCfXH7FtUqK5XcV-r2qHA.text: The bucking bull fries are undoubtably the best thing I've ever eaten, EVER! The service was sub-par but the delicious food made up for it. I live in So. Cal but will be coming back solely for the food.

iPDmfedQP2ie0vF649zuXQ.text: Giant portions which makes it a good value. The potatoe skin breakfast was awesome! Get the salsa on the side. The brisket breakfast burrito missed the mark  but overall was ok. Keep your receipt and you can ride the mechanical bull for free!

vxqku_IJBlEezUY5J6esYA.text: Horrible, horrible service!!! Came here on  a Sunday afternoon on my birthday weekend and sat outside which was not overflowing with people in our section.  We were in a party of about 8 so gratuity was already going to be included. Well, they must of took the fact that they were already getting a good tip to give us horrible service. First of, our waiter took forever to get to us. We ordered food and drinks our waters and regular drinks took about 13 minutes to come out the beers took about 20 mins to come out. Our food  took about 45 minutes.  Our group had two orders of wings once they came out with food the wings were dead cold.  We had no water refills for the longest time. We told our waiter about the wings and he took them back. Then another server lady came by and asked us how everything was we told her we didn't have any silverware nor napkins she came by brought us the silverware she also told us she spoke to the manager and the wings would be comped.    Well, I had to ask for water with the girl since we had not seen our original waiter since our food came out. We received our bill and the wings were still included on the bill. When we asked our second waiteress she said "she thought they were gonna be comped but they are not". Well, we are not paying and we didn't wr told her and she said she would talk to the manager. She came back and told us they were taken off the bill and they were.   So was two good burgers entrees worth $50 dollars, Nope!

qRDbuRohzDmgK5NswJwcnQ.text: Not a bad place, we stopped here for dinner on a nice and cozy night on the strip. The waitresses seated and greeted us at the door. It was a nice relative crowd outside the restaurant, but thats what youd have to expect in vegas. I love the big texas beef burgers with fries, the last time i got the barbecue ribs with potato salad, and it was to die for. The drinks are great, margaritas off the rocks are what i would reccommend.My girlfriend i think ordered fish tacos, i cant really remember, but she was happy and i was happy, cant wait to stop by again. I love the vibe and atmosphere at this location.

x1ABBkWS_8iq5kmJTIQm3Q.text: Deceptive 2 for 1 deal only works at their small bar inside the mall?  You've got to be kidding me!  Might want to indicate that on your coupon.  Managers need to  stop this deceptive practice.  It's bad business.  Food was ok.  Good place to people watch on the strip but that's about it.

SxkiXVLR6_jxAx71Mp8nHw.text: i really wanted to hit some of the casino buffets but the group just did a 5k run on 1.5 hours of sleep and wanted food pronto since they were out of juice.  we stopped by here for quickie brekkie and it was pretty much some greasy grub that is off the charts on the jenny craig diet.  they have basics like eggs and bacon to what i ordered which was the pulled pork eggs bennie on buttermilk biscuits.  heavy, fatty, and salty which is great for any hangover cure but you might want to do another 5k after eating it.  looks like happy hour with beer or daiquiris is the better bet here.

eVhwl2cLcaJZR0b9uTc94Q.text: This review is for the bar only.  I can't speak to the food.    My buddy and I had a pretty good time here late one Sunday night.  It's a good place to listen to music, drink, and watch the drunks ride the mechanical bull.  I rode it twice.

hIGS5a2czfQ05JI19n2i4g.text: Very fun and excited atmosphere. The food was great and service was even better. I enjoyed watching people ride the bull. Even my boyfriend got up there and rode it! I highly recommend this place!

zdAlPCqWwh75NqjzfNBAyg.text: I stayed at the Bellagio and always went here for an outdoor meal, people watching on the strip, and reasonably priced meals.  Chantel was my bartender most of the time and she was awesome!  Sweet,  cool,  and helpful for local stuff. She rocks and made me feel like I was back at my local in Boston.  Give this girl a raise!  Hah.

2WOfUvk3_Hj4Rvtc3Dd5kQ.text: Came for the bull. $5 per ride and an employee handles the controls. Yes!

1M_Eow-xRMEDsPP8ln_szA.text: Terrible place. The security and managers in there are so ignorant that they didn't let me in because my passport was foreign which shows the day before the month and they thought my 21st hadn't passed yet but the expiration date says 27/11/2018... So there is no 27th month. The manager didn't even know 1994 was the accurate year for 2015. They were saying stuff like go back to your country and learn your age before you come here when YOU are supposed to be professional and know your facts. There are sooo many foreigners with foreign passports on the strip. Idk I took my time out to write this because I've never been rudely rejected before especially after the fact that I am 21 now lol. You would think workers on the strip would know better anddd I had a Fat Tuesday drink in my hand so hmmm wonder how I got that lol.

zHdw5j8We-QDxesaH2wjSg.text: This place is pretty cool! The food was great! If your just looking for a burger, chip and dip type of place, then this is the right spot for you.  I highly recommend the artichoke dip and chips...AMAZING!!! The drinks are strong and with each meal you get a free pass to ride the bull!  The bull ride is so much fun and i did it about 5xs and the crowd are pretty cool ,fun and nice!

eltgG7qUerH7u7GCzUgnYQ.text: In the day, PBR Rock Bar & Grill is a restaurant in Planet Hollywood. At night it turns into a club. At the restaurant I showed up around 2pm on a Sunday looking for some breakfast after having a late night at their club. I was glad to see breakfast was served all day. There was no wait to be seated which was great as every other place our group of 4 seemed to look into was packed. I ordered the Country Scramble which was basically scrambled eggs with mushrooms, tomato's and ham with gravy on top. It came with toast and tater tots which I love. I also tried the Breakfast Skins which are pretty standard potato skins but add egg. Those were good as well. I probably sound like all I do is eat, but I also tried the Grilled Cheese B.E.T. which is an egg, bacon and cheese sandwich and also liked that. Definitely no complaints with the food. It came probably 10 minutes after we ordered. The atmosphere is also great as there are TV's everywhere with different sports on. Great for someone like me who can't get enough of sports. The bathrooms are labeled "The Can" and have an attendant working in them at all times. It's nice to tip I suppose, but call me crazy... I'm not into tipping guys that drop soap on my hands and hand me a towel. The guy was just as nice to me even when he realized he wasn't getting a tip. The only kind of annoying thing was our server asked if we were ok probably 25 times during our meal... which I find a little excessive. I'd rather have them come around too much than not at all though. Oh ya... this place has a mechanical bull in the restaurant which provides a little entertainment if anyone feels the need to show off their 8 second ride during the day.  The night before, I visited the club at PBR Rock Bar & Grill because my group just had to play some beer pong. There is typically a cover, but we got in for free since it was my girlfriends birthday and we each got buy one get one free vouchers for drinks. Nice to see they cater to birthdays. They had a DJ mixing and a dance floor with a cage you could climb in for you ladies who wanna get freaky. We got some drinks and headed over to the beer pong tables to battle it out. They had 3 tables which all weren't in use, but shortly after we started playing, 2 other groups started using the other tables. It was a nice mix to the bar scene. The thing I found interesting was this place didn't play any country music, and this is the same place which had the mechanical bull. However the bull is outside of the bar section so it seems to only be a day time event. Overall this is a great place if you want something a little more low-key than a club and is open till 3am for you that go to bed when the sun rises.

i_CGniGmKxMxad7MR2rtfg.text: Mediocre food, HORRIBLE service. VERY weak, watered-down drinks. COMPLETELY unimpressed.  Manager is obnoxious. DO NOT waste your time OR your money.  There are FAR better places in Vegas.   The night we were there, during the NFR, we wanted to go watch the event.  The manager was running a "mechanical bull riding" at the same time, would get on the mic and it was cranked up SO LOUD, I had to cover my ears.   Will NEVER return and definitely don't recommend it.

TKgxw8hA1ENp62Ov-MBw_A.text: I'm not sure where to start... The food was horrible, I ordered a burger and it was cold... Fries were soggy too.

2n3MmI8OmyoH1SNndnbvbw.text: You're in Las Vegas, so there are a million other food and drink options to choose from. Only if you're hardcore into PBR, country music, and Bud Light would I recommend coming here.  The mini corndogs we ordered were pretty awesome and started our meal off very well. The shrimp po-boy I ordered made my change my opinion about this place right away.. Enough shrimp, certainly, but the sandwich was hard to eat and there was almost no sauce, so the sandwich was really bready and dry.  I expect bathroom attendants in really nice clubs and restaurants, but PBR Rock bar? What are they thinking? Pet peeve of mine. Probably why this review is 2 stars and not 3.

2N3puNgpt15ymo6HuOANaw.text: Warning for anyone in a wheelchair who wants to eat here..........   I didn't get a chance to eat here because they ran out of the normal, lower dining tables and only had seating at the bar or one of those high top / bar tables. This is NOT good for a person in a wheelchair like myself. I was informed by a hostess that a month ago management decided to remove 1/2 of the dining tables and replace them with the high tops... thus becoming way less wheelchair friendly. I don't want to eat when I can't see my food because the plate would be at eye level or worse depending on the height of one's wheelchair. This is just WRONG.   For just drinking purposes, I suppose it would do.  But , I definitely think they need to do something about this little bit of discrimination and use a little common sense. How can I eat from a high top table when I can barely see what I would be eating? I'd get more ON me than IN me.  I was really looking forward to eating at this place too.  Edited to add : I'm not sure why people are finding this issue FUNNY.

xgo3IppBaPyUaZuJw68C7g.text: Came by real quick because my bf wanted to watch the game. First coming in the hostess was no where to be found. Oh wait their they are outside with a group of guys flirting rather than worrying about helping paying customers.  We ordered the quest con Carne.... How can you mess up on melted fake cheese. Well leave it to them. But initially I wasn't even going to write a review..  But the wait to have to get our bill and change just tipped me over the edge.  I know I shouldn't expect great food coming here but definitely not worth coming here again.

LYla5FcMfqLkmCsv_-jnWA.text: --[ Food ]--- I had the nacho chips and a bacon wrapped hot dog. I know I am a fatty :P   The nacho chips are really good. I think it was the cheese sauce! Either way, I highly suggest it! The hot dog on the other hand was okay, Nothing like the hot dogs you get in the streets of LA after a night of clubbing. Then again, I might just be to drunk to notice that they taste horrible. LoL.   Over all the food here is good. You really can't go wrong with anything...   --[ Service ]---  REALLY BAD. I don't know who to blame. The manager for only having 2 waiters for all of the patio area or the 2 waiters. I am leaning towards the manager O_o.    Who honestly schedules 2 waiters on the 4th of July for all of the patio area? I honestly felt bad for the guy.   --[ Conclusion ]--  We came here on 4th of July because we were assured by the staff at PBR that we would get the best seats to see the fireworks outside.   Well, we got the best seats, BUT THERE WERE NO FIREWORKS!!! If they fixed the service here, this place could be a solid 4.

_mPDJN5WKigEKJusr07gvw.text: Jerry was great . Super attentive and gave really good advice on the food and drinks !

YC9PDECpvnVnQu2Htgcyvg.text: It's so f'Ing bad it's not a joke. Horrible. I do t mind a good 'Ol junk food binge now and again.   None of it was edible. I don't bother sending back or complaining. I just ticked it off to experience.   If you want ribs, or a burger, or anything.......do not go here. Go ask concierge at your hotel.   I appalled this place can be in. Haines with this garbage.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Presentation post picking at cold sausage and fatty ribs with burned French fries

Rmr3yYIrIESVao9imEZeaA.text: Went here for breakfast and loved it!!  I ordered the breakfast pizza with no egg and it was delicious and really large.  I'm a pretty big eater and I could only eat half of it.  It made for a great late night snack that evening. :)  The eggs, sausage and potato plate was a hit, but the breakfast burrito plate was not.  For my drink I ordered hot tea, which tasted like it was made with water that ran through the coffee maker.  Definitely a faint coffee taste - which I do not care for.  Our service was really slow, especially considering they were not busy (8am in Vegas).    Overall the atmosphere is relaxed/country.  We had wanted to sit in a booth, but were told they were all closed because they were going to be removing a speaker from the ceiling in that area.  First, why didn't they do that in off hours? Second, they did not do any construction in the booth area while we were there.  I would come here again for breakfast pizza!!

Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RUDq_zUxX9XT7wEiapx0gQ.text: I had the best time at pbr. The manager Omar was so welcoming. Our server Leo gave us the best service I had while visiting. Super helpful and funny! Would come back again!

R1VC98qxCX2kjM3Zx2GVag.text: PBR rocks ! They have the most delicious food ! The customer service is great! The servers are doing a great job. We were treated like kings . Thank you PBR . Will be back again soon . And they have the best view ,it's right in the heart of Las Vegas boulevard. The atmosphere is nice and I love their county music.

poVQA3Crokv_gSVrZZyM6Q.text: The food and service was amazing. Definitely a place to visit while in Vegas. Most have the meatloaf sandwich.

Gz3kVAKMSsNxaiNSWSFVhw.text: Food's not that great and service is slow, but when Gordon Ramsey has a 2 hour wait and you're with a group of famished hung over 20 somethings who just need to fill there bellies, this will do. The BOGO coupon is a nice touch as well as the free bull ride after getting drunk.  Medium rare here is more like a medium. Burgers are a bit dry. The Double Trouble is HUGE. Make sure your are really hungry or can eat a ton.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A1 burger - pretty dry and flavorless
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Breakfast - medium rare is more like medium to well done

H9tRrG6RQGtRwWIg_SWrQg.text: Great breakfast on the strip! Great prices, great portions,  and our server Valerie was amazing!!!!! Busers were pretty great also

F-wruG06XsILjhzVFdFGCA.text: So first of all this is hidden gem. Just saying the customer service was the best. Me and my sister sat at the bar. I love watching bartenders mixed drinks. We ordered and ordered. The customer service is above amazing . Food was tasty and good.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 805

_UDxJ1pTjS4a9VXslDcQ1Q.text: Stopped by here after walking the strip aimlessly. I happened to arrive for the pre- Cinco de Mayo celebration. Wow, the food and the patio bar  service was great. Will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Cinco de Mayo

imKSfodhEHLXb9E99ImeFg.text: My friends and I came here Saturday to celebrate my 26th birthday. Surprisingly there was no wait for a Saturday night and we were seated immediately.   Our waiter (forgot his name) was pretty cool and offered great customer service. We ordered a porch pounder (the 100 oz drink and the main reason we decided to dine there). I don't know if it was because we ordered the Peach Punch but we were not able to taste any hint of alcohol. Our waiter was kind enough to send our bowl of juice back to the bar. Although the bartender added more alcohol we left perfectly sober.   The food was ok. I ordered the PBR Burger and sweet potato fries. The burger was a decent size and would have been great if not for the dry bun it was served on. My friends enjoyed their meal.   My friends informed our waiter of my birthday and he came back with a free birthday shot. Of course anything free tastes great... so no complaints here. Our waiter was even kind enough to give all three of us a free bull ride (which was the highlight of our time there).   I believe in second chances and would go back one more time to allow this place a chance to redeem itself.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Bull Ride
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PBR Burger
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Punch Porch Pounder

ATNC1qtKCl5xbf4ssWFkxw.text: The food and drinks were great customer service is excellent love this place our waitress cheered us on while we were drinking the 100 oz drink

DYhO1zDu-BIvTmNi7nO8ug.text: The bar inside was nice and I was informed to go outside to have a beverage.. I go outside and I was pushed to wait outside again for a table.. we waited and the young woman overseeing the hostess told us to "just find an empty table" after that we were sitting and our server asked us if we sat ourselves? I said no I just sat where they told me.... we then were ignored for 15 minutes before I had to waive down help..... honestly I work customer service and it is the restaurants fault for no clear communication on seating... to be treated as outcast is absolutely unnecessary... I am extremely offended  and will not come here again

vdcjni3LcABetZCTwfiPLg.text: Bar food at its best. Nothing was great and the service was okay. A ton of cops frequent this establishment too. I was happy that they were open when I stumbled in.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

5uN3fzJPHEVf2waw2YrKlQ.text: Pros: +Open late on Sundays +Free bull ride with drink purchases +On the strip outside Planet Hollywood +Great Services +Accepts Credit Cards  Cons: -Terrible Food  Located on the strip, PBR is a good late night grub stop after all the normal restaurants are closed....if you dont mind the taste. Our group ordered the Mac and Cheese balls which turned out to be lukewarm. The ribs we ordered was VERY tough almost like a dog toy and the sweet potato fries had an unusual taste.   The decor is above average. Loved the heated areas on the patio and the fires on table. Overall ok experience for a late night drunken stop. Food wise I'll have to pass and stick with McDonalds.

xm3ySeqn76S8J9aAbOEsaA.text: The environment was so cool, great Country music and a mechanical bull for entertainment. The bar bites were extremely delicious along with the drinks. Kseniya was our server was very attentive and made sure we were all taken care of.  My opinion this place is a great place to have dinner and drinks.

B6zkk9xkfb5VGSJd9nZi-Q.text: This really just goes out to your Jell-O shot server she was great. We were there on a club crawl. The bartenders didn't care to give us service but she made sure we had drinks, Jell-O shots and that our table was clean. Shout out to her. She the real MVP.

JlhIX8iDZVw9krJyEo0PBA.text: My husbands favorite place when we are in Vegas. No complaints on my end had another fabulous experience for late supper tonight.  They keep heat lamps going so we ate outside in comfort.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos and bbq burger
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9M3H3XzRBu6kPCIdkur89A.text: Rude, condescending bartenders and food is not that good  Burger precooked and French fries burned.   Do not , repeat do not go here unless you want to waste your money

Ev9FT68yNQkVUI9kHTCiVg.text: Great prices and food.  Friendly atmosphere. My son got to ride the mechanical bull cause I couldn't but he had a fun time. We actually went back for their breakfast special the next day because the price was too good to resist. My husband got steak and eggs for $10 and he said it was seasoned perfectly and the taste surprised him for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FHMNOmqB3vRtMo1xU0pm7Q.text: Awesome food, great prices and great service.  You definitely will not leave this place hungry

HtbFISDTvDKUFYohCXoRYQ.text: Made a reservation here because I wanted to watch Game 5 of the Stanley Cup over dinner. For that purpose, it definitely fit the bill -- a ton of televisions all over the restaurant, including one right at our table. An even better viewing environment than a sportsbook.  Service was very slow, though of course it was a pretty packed night. That said, the steak and eggs I ordered was very good -- particularly for ~$10, a steal of a price. I actually don't order steak and eggs that often, but I was glad I did here. The side breakfast potatoes were tasty, though there weren't enough onions mixed in (what ones were on the plate were delicious, which made their relative scarcity all the more tragic).  All in all, I was pleased with the experience. I'd definitely go back in a similar circumstance (a place where I could have a nice casual dinner without missing a big sporting event).

lp5NMSjb2qUUapITN72zGQ.text: I was here for breakfast the morning of 9/3/2017. Although my server (bartender) was very friendly and welcoming, the food was very bland and grossed me out (french toast). It was not warm when it arrived and the bread was soggy/way undercooked. The mimosa I ordered wasn't served in a champagne glass but rather a whisky size glass. It was $14!!! Totally not acceptable. Nope, won't be back.

1RVZOkrHXirD67pzplretA.text: Breakfast was lower quality than expected but it was cheap so you get what you pay for.   Bloody Mary was good, especially since they had a BOGO on a drink through Yelp!  Atmosphere was lively and they have both indoor and outdoor seating, I'd probably return and try lunch or dinner.

W37XChgSHWSHT79VRclpbQ.text: I just had breakfast at PBR... who knew it would be such a great place for a good American breakfast !  Omelets, fried potato's, black coffee and toast. Everything was great. Booth tables are a little tall or maybe the benches were too low, but either way I felt like i was back at the kids table.   Go here for breakfast.

7yk7gRveJAGnawWTvsiRQg.text: Great burgers! Make sure you get a buy one get one drink card outside before going in! Buffalo fries are great! And ride the bull so you don't regret it!

145G4ZjzaVi2nFcEypz3RA.text: Wonderful birthday experience!! Our sever was amazing and the atmosphere was great! Oh and the raspberry mojito was the bomb.com. If you're ever in Vegas be sure to stop by and have a drink or two on the patio!

hAbMbMjp-NY-4XYI2yWg7w.text: Our dinner here was part of a package for the V Theater, so the menu was very limited. The food was goof though. To start we had the choice between a house salad and a soup, for mains we chose the Vegetarian Fajitas and Southwest Steak Salad, and dessert we had the strawberry shortcake and root beer float. The menu was very outdated and most of the beers they had on there they didn't have anymore, but the food was all still the same. I asked for my salad dressings on the side (most places put too much on) and they forgot on the house salad, lucky they got the balance right. And my steak was cooked perfectly. The desserts were so/so but we ate them all so still descent enough.  The beers were a bit expensive, but it's Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Shortcake
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southwest Steak Salad
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Fajitas

i8c-737NMy9C5FO2D2zfcQ.text: I ate at PBR on Monday 3-12-18.  The menu selections is wide open and so is the alcohol choices!  A very fun, festive atmosphere.  I'd go again the next time I'm in town.

P1OWTgacEGabCydwl17kiA.text: We had the best time at this pub. We ate at the outside bar and Meagan was the highlight of our experience. The food was great, big portions. The drinks were perfection and Meagan was the BEST bartender ever!!!!  We will be back!

83Mw9FmbEnvAXkERHu1Tdg.text: Food was great, but the specialty cocktail I got was gross! Others in my group and standard beer and regular cocktails (co. bulldog etc) and they were fine.

RzLDJJ_yPcYiIRta9IIGvw.text: This was our first stop in our plan for a progressive dinner on the Strip,and we stopped because we were really hungry and there was no wait for a table. The tables are huge and high, an uncomfortable combo for a shortie, but that's not what this is about. I ordered the meat pizza, a friend ordered the bacon mac and cheese and we talked our co-worker into trying the "largest burger," on the menu. It boasted to have lots of meat, a fried egg, bacon, cheese and hollandaise sauce. We started off the meal with fried pickles, which had a great crunch and a spicy kick at the end. They were delish. My pizza was not that exciting, or flavorful. It was sufficient, but I like when the cheese is carmelized a little, and this one fell a little short in flavor. The bacon mac and cheese was recommended by our friendly server, and proved to be the best thing that we ordered. The Big burger was reported to having a lack of flavor. He finished most of the burger, but said it didn't impress in flavor. All in all, the service was friendly, the food was sufficient, but not exciting or distinct enough for me to want to go back.

j_fLhemILBpgEQ9eVcaQrw.text: Fabulous breakfast! Fast and friendly service. The prices are so cheap and the food was great! Only $4.95 for eggs, sausage, toast and potatoes. The serving size was large. Plenty to eat. Next time we will try the mimosas that looked great! Wonderful surprise.

sasrJIx_-YcaIXef7W4mIQ.text: Casual as can be in the south end of the strip.  Good menu selection, and a good place to watch Saturday football.  Hustle bustle keeps Service from being great.

TRYyXNKQAneYEPToV5ujvg.text: Went in with a friend and received awesome service from Wanda. We had the buffalo wings ,half buffalo/ half bbq and fries. The food was so tasty. Wanda told us about happy hour and 3 hours later we returned with our friends. The happy hour drink specials were so good. I ended up getting 5 drinks totalling a little over $20.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V1PsxsIELbSV24on1-egqQ.text: Food was okay, service was horrible! So many workers and no one there to help you, get a table or take your order! If the place was packed, I would understand but it wasn't, not even close! When we finaly did go seat our SELVES, we waved down a waitress after 30 mins waiting! UGH! Then we tryed to use the 2 for 1, which they told us, only work at the bar! WHAT! Lame! wont be back!

11bA2PKqJmLonVcCGK8s4w.text: Super chill and friendly place to have a great, down to earth dinner in Vega$. I had the Link Sausage with Mashed Potatoes.  The server was named Woody, who was very knowledgeable and friendly, and helped us with our delicious cocktails.   I would definitely recommend this place to friends and colleagues and will definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. X

SXF93dGjnY5GmeeO3ZVj8w.text: When in Vegas... don't eat here. Don't pick a place when you are hungry either. Ordered an app, drinks and burgers.  Drinks took forever. Explained had to change a keg.  App came with the burgers.  Unfortunately silverware and napkins didn't come with the meal. Asked the guy who delivered the food & he said he'd be right back. Never saw him again. Asked our server and he said he'd be right back. Meanwhile food is getting cold. Asked another server and she said sure. She did come back, with 4x4 cocktail napkins and silverware. Good thing the garlic mashed potatoes were in a crock like container and weren't ice cold. They probably would have been good warm. The app was average and the burger worse.  If I had only walked about another 100 yds I could have had a bacon smokehouse burger from McDonald's which are very good. And for about 1/3 of the cost. Maybe it was a bad day for the server, but for everyone at the place to be having a bad day at the same time? Sad

bddTH_QrPb56akcVaxMgow.text: Not impressed, ordered California burger,  asked for no onions but the Guacamole had onions...... They should toast their buns, it would make the burgers  taste better. I told the waiter but he said I asked for no onions, he should have known the guacamole had them. Also, he didn't know how to redeem a yelp free drink coupon, we also had to ask for our waiter since he never came back to check on us or to take our other drink order. Took almost 10 mins to get a 16oz PBR!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o2OGASzoU5gfA2IKzNzFIw.text: Can't believe what I heard the waiters said to the people in the next booth with a tv  . she told them that if they don't keep ordering drinks that she would kick them out of the Booth .

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tC6wi1GNvXtAct1wwHT8Sg.text: Nice place to hit up if you're looking for good food with generous portions, a lively atmosphere and refreshing drinks.   Reveled in some beer and the most AWESOMEST nachos and potato skins. The nachos consist of cheese (real cheese), sour cream, beans, guacamole and jalepenos layered over a bed of mesquite potato chips. The potato skins were great too! PBR has multiple bars inside and lots of screens for catching all the latest sports action.   I wasn't even too hungry when we sat down and the food still tasted great. Can't wait to go on an empty stomach and try out the other menu items.   American comfort food with a twist. Love this place!

6FdHCE1hf3vGScmd8QXjjw.text: Open bar isn't an open bar. They wouldn't let us drink fireball or Jim beam for the 30 dollar fee. Kinda lame

2ZRH-XPO-GC1yf_oml5ngg.text: Extremely loud, but the food was good and the drinks delicious..  Services was above average but seemed short staffed

rhQjEyeoS8flhNUUyoVOTA.text: Service was very good. I sat at the bar inside and had a pulled pork sandwich with fries and a couple Blue Moons. The beer was cold and the food was hot and reasonable for Vegas.

JlkMAhB_AJdDmDYv3uwzkw.text: Stopped here for breakfast before leaving Vegas to go home. Robin was our server and she was very sweet and attentive. My boyfriend had a bud light while I just ordered a soda. For breakfast my boyfriend ordered the Mexican Omelette and I had the Western Omelette. Add hash browns for $1.99 extra. He ordered them, I passed but added avocado also $1.99 more. After breakfast was ordered a photographer approached our table and asked if we were interested in having our picture taken. After she took two pictures she informed us that she would return in a few minutes with the photos. We were not obligated to purchase them but chose to since it was his 50th birthday, and the pictures turned out really nice. Our breakfast was really good and the omelettes were pretty large so I am really happy that I passed on the hash browns. All in all a pretty good experience. Only complaint... $4.00 for a soda is a little pricey :(

WfvG73sz022VDpydhiIVgQ.text: I LOVE this place! I wish I could give it 10 stars!    We went on the last Sunday of the regular football season. They have TVs as far as the eye can see, a mechanical bull that you can ride free with your receipt (there's not enough alcohol in all of Nevada for me to do that) and the bartender Jennifer is awesome!  Don't fuck with her but she's great if you get on her good side, which thankfully we did. Haha.   The menu had some different items on it, like nachos with BBQ potato chips and the atmosphere was great. Avoid Cabo Wabo and come here instead!

UZjyBTyvQK35LWfvDe_WIQ.text: Stumbled upon this place with an out of town guest who loves the PBR.. so she had to try. We sat outside and had a great table to people watch. Service was prompt they were not trying to hard to please, but still attentive. I ordered a Sam Adams to drink, they were out of Sam and I settled with a Stella Artois... however I'm pretty sure they gave me Bud Light. My friend had a drink with "Carribean" in the name, I can't remember what it was, but reminded me of a Virgin Islands "Pain Killer" (Pussers British Rum and a little juice) it was delicious and a generous pour.   We ordered burgers for lunch, my friend had the "American" and I had the "BBQ Burger". They were both very good and the only complaint I had is both of our buns fell apart while eating them, so some old bread, but they were still good. The fries were great and the ranch dressing delicious (it really is hard to find good ranch).   The bill for 2 at lunch was $41.00, for the strip not bad. I have given up on the fact that Vegas has any hand made burger patties on the strip, since they are more geared for a volume based restaurant these were right out of a box.   With all the food choices, this place is good for the patio and not much more.... unless I have out of town guests who have their hearts set on the novelty of the PBR, I won't be back.

JEc7nICLdOpsi6S77m0yIQ.text: I have been here several times now and as I continue to eat various items on the menu it continues to impress me. It is really hard to find great food on the strip, this place has figured out how to do it right!   I had the Taco Salad 2 nights in a row for dinner and loved it. We had the boneless chicken wings in BBQ sauce during the super bowl and I loved them, actually wish that I was still in Vegas because they sound really good right about now. I can't remember off hand what I have eaten here the prior three times that I'd eaten here, however I know that I was just as impressed.   They have amazing deserts, I have had the chocolate chip skillet cookie and now the glazed donuts and I must say that both were excellent.   Buckets of beer, excellent food, TONS of TV's and a great atmosphere ... not sure what more one could ask for.

kJQiZcsIiyd7lFDAxxbNYw.text: Great place to look at and great atmosphere, but the main meals were all cold when they arrived at the table. Our beer that we ordered was room temperature and quite disappointing. I wouldn't recommend dining here if you're looking for hot food and cold drinks.

29ekB2vzgtlDcNcdeRLrGA.text: Based on service and Food this place is an absolute zero. Terrible terrible terrible. Sure the prices are cheap, thats because you would be better off going to mcdonalds as far as food and service are concerned.   This place does have a great location on the strip with a nice patio right on the strip and cool atmostphere inside. but do not I repeat do not go here for food or expect to get service at a table.  ordered the blue cheese burger, worst burger i have ever had. it tasted like the meat was in a freezer for 2+ years before it was cooked. the fries were so-so and the nachos were big not good.   Very dissapointed.

eSFChzL4CmbATYCnbT4oUw.text: I just received notification my reservation for Sunday 9/8 @945am at PBR Grill Las Vegas has been cancelled.  I received a call at 8pm on 9/4 that I no longer have a table for 7.  The girl said her manager cancelled all reservations due to high demand for that weekend, and it will be first come first served.  It doesn't matter that tables would be filled by reservations, my table now goes to the first person who walks up that day.  It's going to be high demand on NFL opening weekend--SHOCK FACE!!!  Why did these idiots even take reservations???  UPDATE: Christine Backman corrected the issue and even picked up a couple of buckets of beers for us.  It was my favorite place before to watch football in Vegas, and I'm sure we'll be back again.

CGLBSTr9S6N6e7RxNHm5nw.text: Negative 5 stars. This place is worse than herpes! 1stly they had signs up advertising $10 open bar night, so we asked about it and they said it was cancelled and replaced with a $25 open bar from 10pm-12pm. Only 2 people serving and when we asked for the $25 dollar deal they said they had to find a manager, 20 mins later nobody had come back to us and it was still mission impossible just to order a beer. We left n went somewhere else to drink. This is the 1st time I have ever written review for anything, simply bcos I was so pissed off with the lack of service in this place. In short, fucken terrible!!!

DQvvxpPLePt-AMTJy8sN2A.text: Awful. We ordered nachos a got a big vat of can cheese with greasy "meat" the drinks were very expensive as well. The c hips were so greasy we had to wipe our hands each disgusting bite. Over priced and gross. Avoid if possible

p6Vjit49quiojpWL6jQqPA.text: Food was meh. Just wanted the corn on the cob from the photos. It's bar food nothing worth writing about ;)

MwMloAiN_FWQ8XrzlHjFXA.text: Started our club crawl here. I wasn't feeling very well but my girls loved the wings & potato skins. Not too many places to hang out, I just wanted to sit and get better fast before the whole club crawl. It was CROWDED. Large cups of water were good though :-) It was suuuper loud, I had no idea what anyone was saying.

IsTrukLd0kOJRpa97_WYaA.text: This bar was were I spent all my time in Vegas. (During the day). Cheap beer, good service, awesome atmosphere. I will be sure to come back every trip.

dPSyPTuruAHgDEQTZDHaUA.text: A group of us went to PBR Rock Bar & Grill after we decided the line at the Earl of Sandwich was too long.  Boy do I regret it.  By the time we sat down, ordered and got our food I could have gone through the line at Earl of Sandwich about 6 times.  Our lunch took over 2 hours.  We had to wait a little while for the table but most of the time was spent waiting for our food which was NOT worth it.  Some of our meals were cold, and all were just not good.  Service was terrible.  When she did come by she was not at all polite.  I'm sure the fact that we were all hungover and just wanted some food did not help.  Head over to Earl of Sandwich instead for a much better and much faster meal.

K2b7rrhZY3XBfTWmtf3v0g.text: PBR is one of my favorite places in Vegas. It has a very country theme to it with a mechanical bull. We eat at this place at least once every time we come to Vegas. The food is absolutely stellar and it's reasonably priced. My absolute favorite meal here, and I'm not usually a big meat person, is the brisket grinder. It's brisket, with onion rings, roasted red pepper and aged white cheddar on a grinder. It is so awesome. And you can get tator tots. The people we've taken with us have all loved their food as well. My fiance had a burger that had pulled pork and cole slaw on it and he can't wait to have it again.

Gx-ZtYZySerAIn8r9Su2HA.text: Pretty Cool, Good Music Great Drinks.... And Mechanical Bull, Few Friends Got On, It Was Fun, I Will Be Back, Also On The Other Side Theres A Club With Dance Floor And Dj

dkivOby9YyYXhLyRnYpEIg.text: My fiance and I were walking down the strip with my sister and decided to get a drink. We passed this place and I decided I wanted to try it because of the fire on the tables. Yeah, that was a deciding factor for me lol. My fiance got an adios mother fuc*er and my sister and I got a strawberry daiquiri. My fiances drink was strong and well work the money while my sister and I's drinks were just overpriced slushies. Pretty disappointing since it was my sister's first drink ever and because I can get buzzed off of an 8oz. glass of wine. My fiance even asked the waitress if there was any alcohol or if it was a virgin. According to her, it had 10%, same as a beer. I get buzzed off of a beer so they must have forgotten to put the alcohol in. Pretty disappointing. We won't be returning unfortunately.

HrtBEV__4s2Z48-2n5Nn-w.text: your average run of the mill bar food kind of place.  nothing amazing.  greasy burgers (mos burger - literally the bread was soaked through and through with oil and grease), overdone tots (how do you overcook tater tots?!), boring salads (PBR cobb - whatever), and super lame decor (bulls etc).  meh.  why bother when there are so many other places to go in vegas.  it was a bad decision on our part.  our server was very nice.  but then again, they weren't very busy...

TYtwrMp9QY2_2uL9l3obuw.text: Breakfast was cheap and decent I didn't have any drinks here so I cant rate that. Not one of the best places for a quick bite to eat but it will do the trick.

Wk_wreWzAVsZ6GBUCAZZZw.text: My review is for their nightly bar/club.  Back in October 2012, I visited the outside bar for their Friday happy hour from 3-6pm and I really enjoyed it.  This past weekend I was able to experienced their bar/club area on a Thursday Night and Saturday night. Both nights it was with a group of people.   We arrived to Vegas on Thursday around 8pm and started walking the strip around 10pm in search of a bar with cheap drinks and some good music. We were approached by a promoter for the bar and go us in for free. Music was great it was a mix of Hip-Hop & Top-40. Drinks were decently priced ($7 for well).   Saturday Night we didn't want to do the whole club scene at a premier club so we end up contacting the same promoter who end up giving us his info on Thursday night. He got us in for only $25 which included open bar all night. Again the music was pretty much the same as Thursday.   Overall, it was a great bar/club. If you are simply looking to grab cheap drinks, dance and have fun without all the premier glam, this is the spot. No waiting to get a drink, no bumping into people and ladies no long lines to use the restroom.

fin_-e7rVvjyYEiK-m0SlQ.text: I'm torn. We were here around Halloween and Dias de Los Muertos. If you're looking for Bar food head on over. I had a good time BS'ing with one of the bouncers and the bartender was attentive Halloween night.   We returned the following night/morning for some post-party eats, and visited the restaurant side instead (This is where it turns to Three stars and I'm being gracious). We were sat in a large booth. Soon after sitting I felt my dress sticking to the seat (sequin mini dress BTW), gross right?! I had my friend check the back of my dress, and some class-act before us left chewed up gum in the damn booth.  It was stuck to my dress, back of thighs, and the damn seat! We notified the waitress of the issue and she then notified another guy in the bar. He mentioned he couldn't make any official decisions (why are you even there then..) and had to let the next manager know. I told him we were flying back to CA at 11am and we wouldn't be able to return. He asked for my cell number and told me the day-manager would call me about my dress in the next day or two. Well, no call from anyone there about my dress. Way to go guy! Will I return here if/when I return to Vegas on future trips?? Ummm, ehhh.. I'm not sure, I highly doubt it though. (BTW, WD-40 gets gum off of clothing. I'd be way more upset if my dress was ruined forever from piss-poor bussing & cleaning of tables and chairs in this place.)

1GLpUF9AlQiQ3MM_s3myvg.text: Eh. We were hard-pressed to find somewhere to grub at 3am after leaving the club, so we settled for PBR. The music was waaaaay too loud and the food was overpriced Applebee's. The waitstaff was super-friendly, though service was painfully slow. Two of our girls fell asleep before their food arrived.

NNeXyUoPYkpWs5vLkBKl1g.text: Stopped in to get a drink and snack. We sat at the bar. The atmosphere was ok although we were there on a not so busy night. They have a mechanical bull which looked like fun. The food not so good. We ordered nachos. The were actually potato chips with cold cheese sauce from a can with watery sour cream and watery guacamole. They were so bad the bartender took them off our bill. She didn't seem surprised! I give the extra star because of her service! There are much better places to go in Vegas!

J2QvT-W33eJc_gj3DtltzA.text: People who work here are transitory, do not want to do a good job and just don't care.  They used to have a decent greeter and sometimes a good bartender, but they've lost all their good staff, and hired on a bunch of idiots.  The food was alright. Not enough of a beer selection. The servers are miserable.

Sl0MkLr5jJDymnZ2oCf_kg.text: Service was pretty slow. Menu was okay. Everything else was just average. There are better places to go to on the Strip.

xeUwXKxHj8uPRa2MWnjKIw.text: I came here with 2 of my girlfriends after stopping by some stores in the mall. The place is ok, your average BBQ type place. They gave us jalapeno bread to start with which was pretty good. I ordered a turkey sandwich that had stuffing and cranberry sauce on it (thanksgiving on a roll pretty much). It was good but very dry. Although I do not drink myself, my friend was very upset that she couldn't get a PBR because they don't carry it. And the waitress said most people want one considering it's the name of the ace, but they don't serve them.   The waitress was super sweet and when one of our burgers wasn't cooked enough she quickly took it back. The place is average, but the decor is nice, the service is good and after a long and tiring day, their food hits the spot.

RLV-lLt6g-RzJ0Ou5LAylA.text: I wish I could remember the food better.  We stopped for the hell of it on our way back from morning shopping for lunch. We intended to get lunch, a couple beers, and then head back to our hotel to rest up for the evening. Four hours later we left.  We sat outside at the bar on the patio. I thought it was perfect. It was noon on a weekday and not very crowded. The bartenders were friendly and the service was fine.  I had a turkey sandwich. I wish I could remember more. I remember that the cole slaw was a bit spicy. My guess is the turkey sandwich was average. We didn't want to eat a ton because we were going to go to a buffet for dinner. I have no recollection of what my husband had, unfortunately.  If you make any sort of purchase, you get to ride the bull for free. I'm hoping my husband accidentally deleted the video of me attempting to do that.  For what it was - weekday afternoon, moderate crowd, lunch, beer & conversation with some fun people who were sitting by us, it was just fine. I can't say what it's like at night or when it's much more busy. Sitting on the patio was fun. I would definitely consider going back for drinks again.

aU2pS0rgsOuHPfINFY3j_g.text: I have open an account in Yelp due to this place. So no need of lots of explanations but food was disgusting and worse, poisoning. Noise, no light... Service overloaded so awful as well. Won't go again in my life.
