MitFzOMsw5E1mXIl84FDOw.text: My husband and I were staying at Planet Hollywood and went here for lunch out of convenience. We were very happy with the food. Burgers. Service was average to less than average however. We saw they had super cheap breakfast options so we decided to return before catching our flight home. Zwr6nW9tfF7ShtUSCri5qA.text: The only reason why I am giving it 2 stars is because the managers and the server Thomas are absolutely amazing! I wish we would have got him as our server to start with, but we were paired with Savanna who was rude, unaccommodating and a ghost after we got our drinks. After being rude to us while ordering drinks we didn't see her for 45 mins.. she never walked by to ask what we wanted to eat, we saw 2 other tables sit down after us and get their food before us. After complaining to get a new sever, the managers came up to apologize and let us know they would comp us for our troubles. Thomas came up to take over (we decided to grab our check early and go somewhere else) but he was SO FREAKIN SWEET and got me a free drink and just had the sweetest words to say. We saw him running around taking care of all his tables WHILE STILL TAKING CARE OF US with a beautiful smile on his face!! Every one else was so so so sweet but if you get Savanna- ASK FOR THOMAS INSTEAD!!!

bZL-n7mXRxQdmp3i4Y8fRA.text: This place is all about location views and the environment of being on the Las Vegas strip. The food is decent but not incredible. My waitress was extremely slow and would rush us when asked questions about the menu. Once we received our food we never saw her again and had to go looking for her to get out check. I got the club sandwich and it was very poorly put together. There was hardly any of the mayo sauce and it was just in the middle of the bread and the rest of the. Read was dry. They chose large presentation over making a quality sandwich. It was below average. The views are awesome as the location is right in the center of the Las Vegas strip. If your not gonna sit outside and enjoy the views then there is no point in eating here in my opinion. There are plenty of other places that are too close with better food and service.

gF1mBnAVbX61flqkZjGVqg.text: My boyfriend was craving a breakfast sandwich and I suggested checking out the Earl of Sandwich. Since we had already spent quite a bit on lunch the previous day, we were looking for a more affordable option. When we discovered that the Earl quit serving breakfast at noon (and it was 1 PM), we ended up across the way at PBR Rock Bar. Stumbling upon this ended up being a pretty good Vegas find.   I figured that I had already eaten enough junk for a week in my first day at Vegas so I decided to be good and order a salad. As soon as I noticed that PBR offered half salad orders, I was completely sold. Thank you for offering an option for lighter eaters! I can never finish a full restaurant salad and not only do they not typically hold well as leftovers but many Vegas hotels don't offer refrigerators to store leftovers either. Finally, I can confidently order a salad and know that I won't be wasting half of it. Also, by ordering a half salad, my Country Fried Salad decreased from a ridiculous $17 to a much less intimidating $10. The salad is topped with chicken tenders, tomatoes and cheese and I asked for the cucumbers and bacon to be removed. I also asked for a side of ranch instead of having the salad tossed in honey mustard. I'm not a fan of pre-tossed salads as they tend to get soggy. Although I thought the ranch was quite good at first, it lost some of its appeal throughout the meal so I know it wasn't quite the normal restaurant quality ranch that I love. Even at a half size, I could still barely finish it and I can't imagine what a full-sized salad would look like.   The Tex-Mex Scramble ended up catching my boyfriend's eye and he chose that over the intended breakfast sandwich. The eggs with pepper jack cheese were served with tater tots and toast and it seemed to hit the spot for him as a great hangover food option.   I noticed when I checked in that they were offering a Yelp special of buy one, get one drinks. Since my boyfriend claims that beer helps him get over a hangover, he was more than happy to partake in this deal.   Our waiter was a little odd and very chatty but I think he meant well. He seemed like the type to get nervous, such as when our food was taking awhile to come out, and then talk to much to overcompensate.   We also had a photographer stop by our table to take pictures and then, of course, try to sell them to us. At first, she offered them for $20 for two framed photos. When we said no, she then offered just the photos for $10. Normally, I'd still say no but the photos were quite good and it was a vacation so I ended up taking her up on the deal and finding my own Vegas frame in the Miracle Mile Shops.  Overall, I was very pleased to find a spot on the Strip with at least some more affordable food options and I'd definitely considering returning on a future trip.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tex-Mex Scramble
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half-size Country Fried Chicken Salad
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ended up buying our photos but you get this small photo for free

8fOUMGeGBOVxAxzzsPrpOw.text: My friends were invited to do bull riding here during a Vegas trip years ago.. We had a fun time playing beer pong that afternoon. Also other people playing beer pong near us were fun and also helped us whenever we dropped the pong ball. After 2 games, we were just so done and tired. So much alcohol was consumed that afternoon.  Overall, this is a cool spot for fun activities... bull riding, beer pong, food! I still need to try the food though.

No, but very, very good and relatively cheap. 2 beers, 4 drinks, 5 entrees and an appetizer for $99. The check-in option for BOGO drinks was awesome! Only complaint was it was incredibly loud, however if we had waited to be sat outside that wouldn't have been an issue!

What do you think happens to most bar patrons after having a few drinks at night? You don't want our business? We're just a married couple of 23 years and it was my birthday weekend celebration looking to sit at a nice bar with a few drinks. NEVER COMING BACK HERE AGAIN. Someone in my group wanted to eat here.  I ordered the pizza to share, and it was the worst pizza I have had in a restaurant ever.   The employees appeared unhappy to be at work and it showed in their demeanor.   When the owners decide to sell terrible food, your customers will notice and hold you accountable.     The location is convenient having strip-side real estate, but that is the only positive about this place.

4R4Pvok6h4iWVNpi8vkm2A.text: Our last lunch in Vegas and we decided to give this place a go..shouldn't of bothered!! From the moment that we walked through the door, the staff seemed so disinterested in being there..none of them even smiled. We had been at our seat for about 1 minute and was asked if we were ready to order food - seriously!!! Food wise - we ordered the Full Pork Ribs with fries and coleslaw. Ribs were over cooked and had no sauce on them and were dry, fries were cold and tasted like they had been in the kitchen for awhile, well the coleslaw was ok! Service was not the best we have had and they expected us to tip them $8 on top - was not happening I would not recommend this place to anyone

GbCmxC4YvL1B2mbIE71l9A.text: We went to dinner here because I had bought a dinner and a show combo online.  It was prixe fix. The front desk crew were def friendly as was our server. It was busy by 6pm. We sat on the deck and ordered a couple mixed drinks.   We had a chop salad, brisket and asked for the dessert to-go. Salad was big, tasty and used fresh ingredients. No limp or brown lettuce, which is a plus to see for such a large chain-like restaurant. The dressing was good in my opinion.  Other reviews said too citrusy, but I like that. Peppercini rings was a nice touch. Brisket was done nicely,  bbq sauce was average and side mac n cheese was also average tasting, but hot and creamy. Again, good for such a big place. Overall,  a positive experience.

B1pDHZoTr4A1ibZC8OUX6Q.text: I think the best thing about this place is the location and the atmosphere. If I would have to give stars for just that it would be 5. Really enjoyed my time here. I ordered the bucking bull fries and those were yummy!! I would recommend getting the onions on the side though. I ordered the hot wings as well and I was really shocked at how great they were! They had a crisp outside but not to much and lots of sauce. They weren't spicy enough though could have been hotter. My husband had the burger and he really enjoyed it and the serving size was huge! I hat a couple Hat benders which is an alcoholic beverage and I liked it. It had a tart sweet kick to it if that makes sense. They have a check in offer buy one drink get one drink of equal or lesser value. The service was so fast and the food was fresh.

IuLwiw-eIs5zo83ZWVfP9Q.text: I've been to this place about 3-4 times. It has a nice setup and is relatively center strip since it is located at the PH Miracle Mile shops. The bar has an outside area with heat lamps, tables and a full bar with TVs. Upon walking through the entrance of the mall, there is a stand with pretty ladies where you can buy drinks. The bar also has a main room and then a side room so in total, I count 4 bars. I've always been to this bar when it is not busy during the week so food service has always been relatively fast with friendly waitresses.  I'd imagine this place gets slammed during sports watching events.  I ordered the chicken fingers and they were relatively greasy but decent. They do in fact have decent happy hour prices during the afternoons. I ate here today with some friends and we split some potato skins and a taco pizza. The skins were cooked perfectly and the taco pizza had alot of taste. I ordered a steak salad which was not too bad either.  I give this place 3 stars for being a typical sports bar in Vegas that has the overpriced bar food that although has a nice bar atmosphere, they have alot of competition around the strip and do not exactly separate themselves from it.

TIog_JsUI3dBTCkODV-RZQ.text: Awesome staff here. Very friendly and quick service. Great bbq ribs!  Love the patio was great for people watching and the misters kept it cool and fun. Order the cocktail bowls...very fun to share.

ycOweYMH7Rd2pYfuAW7z5A.text: Fun place with loud music. We ate outside and there were quite a few smokers around us. The breakfast potato skins were really delicious. Service a bit slow but the food was good.  Waffles really fresh and delicious but pricey for just one waffle.

z59kJMvIqEsAo1oY8HrajQ.text: This place is SO awesome, I have to "re Yelp" it. I was there several times during my annual Vegas summer trip and the food, and customer service is great. This year was a special Vegas trip, as we got engaged!! (at Freemont St though,  not here. Lol). Trying to stay on my health kick, I ordered a salad there. I can't remember the name, but it was a gamechanger. It was romaine lettuce, tomato, cucumbers, but THEN it got sexy and ADDED pulled pork, bacon, bbq chicken, brisket... O M G. There are no words. Never in my life have  I torn through a SALAD AND went back at the end of our trip to have it AGAIN!! The staff was as sweet as their tea is. No complaints. First stop off the plane next summer when we fly to LV to get married!!

HYIF1T-piAbwDE4vzf8-dA.text: On vacation here from San Francisco where I keep high expectations for restaurants and customer service. Walk in and get immediately seated. We had a great host. So good I remembered her name "Bre" great personality. Help us choosing what to order kept us entertained  talked to us next thing you know our food was out before we even knew it. Great quality food and all the staff were friendly. Bre was able to convince me to even ride the bull there which was deff a good choice and a new memory to add to my favorites of vegas. I come to vegas alot and never even knew about he bull. It's also one of the cheapest activities you can do in vegas so make sure you tip the staff. They deserve it unlike most places where they ignore you unless you spend and flirt. Good location. After I rode the bull a crowd came and alot people tried and I even did it a 2nd time.  thought i just sprained my hand found out i broke my wrist. That was my down fall.  What can you do its not like I was forced but still ill deff be back soon when I fly in to town again. Thanks again Bre

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bull ride

7RUtFu568sf-AI-HrXXHkA.text: Good service with our las rags.com tickets for dinner and a show. Food was ok as were the &12 drinks. The blackened chicken fettuccine was the best of the 3 entries ordered. Bull riding a option if your game!

j353PWrjnOskPb7UWws4zw.text: It's a fun place.  Go here for the bar style food and cocktails.  Try the southern hospitality.  Goes well with brunch.   :)  catfish po boy is solid. fresh made bbq potato chips are win.

ox-6HqyNxtMh-dDz_HjWnw.text: Giant bar right next to the sports book inside Planet Hollywood. Plenty of tables  big bar, plenty of TVs. Went here on Sunday to watch some football. They have all the football games on multiple TVs.   Waitress came by as soon as we sat down and ordered a bucket of beer for $20 bucks.  In the bucket was  5 Budweiser tallboys 24 oz, for @20 wow what deal!   Ended up getting some food to couldn't   pass up the country  fried pickle burger. Name says it all burger with fried pickles on it  and a  side of fries. Not a bad burger typical, saved me form getting really drunk right away.   Good place to get some cheap beers and drinks and to watch the game.

Qy99pQi1B2ksJFv86p64Gg.text: Ok, let me just start by saying if I could give this establishment negative stars I would, I will never come back to this restaurant because the only time I was here with my significant other service was HORRIBLE food was mediocre and the price was ridiculous, considering how long I waited for what I was served it took nearly an hour for my gf and I to receive cheeseburgers not a steak dinner, or lasagna or something else that we knew requires extra time to cook, but burgers. it's not to say I was trying to be cheap in Vegas but an hour??? and it tasted like the same burgers I got from my cafeteria in grade school , so yea negative stars

VuMKy3oB0YZpq0Gh6wVEXQ.text: I have always walked by the PBR Rock Bar & Grill, but never went inside until recently. I cannot believe that I have never entered this place before. The staff is so friendly. E and Jeff are amazing. The Taco Pizza and the drinks were delicious. I will definitely, be going back!

9WuhB1eyMD7WGE5IOdOucg.text: I visited PBR Rock Bar & Grill on a girl's trip. Our waiter, Christal, was amazing! She was a great help in answering any questions we had about meal options. The 100 oz fish bowl is a must!! You will definitely get your money's worth. We received a complimentary photo postcard and bull ride! When trying to ride the bull, we faced some problems with one worker, Alexis or Alexa. After waiting several minutes to ride, she did not acknowledge our presence choosing to serve others before us. We simply told her, we were here first. She stated how that was not her problem. Even going as far as trying to intimidate us because we asked to speak with a manager. This interaction definitely turned an amazing experience into a bad one.

hC9AG6zmggx_k8r2exEgWg.text: This is for drinks only. They usually have really good specials here. The drinks weren't  fancy but very good. The service was fast and waitress was friendly and helpful and appeared to enjoy her job which isn't too common in Las Vegas.

2u4XXaG8JkNOd82FJkvSdQ.text: We decided to eat here after taking a short walk from the NY NY.  Outside, we were offered 2 for 1 drink coupons so we came inside and were seated to a small empty bar on the left. Not being happy with the vibe and wanting something a little more lively we moved to the other side of the restaurant and took a seat at an inside picnic bench.   Our waiter quickly arrive and took our orders and advised that the drink coupons were only good on the other side of the bar. We ended up just sticking with water.   There were 6 of us ordering various things. I ordered the ribs and brisket combo with fries.  The ribs were okay but the brisket was disgusting , it was shaved and didn't taste like it was smoked. It seemed more like it was boiled and they just poured sauce on it without even letting it caramelize. So I didn't eat it, I also let someone else in my party try it to make sure it wasn't just me and they also found it uneatable.   The waiter was very good and attentive, so at some point he came by and asked how everything was, so I told him I didn't care for the brisket. He offered to bring something else to replace it, which  I appreciated  it but by that point I was just over it and said no thank you. I also said, I was more than happy to pay for the meal and wasn't expecting a discount or anything , I was just giving feed back because he asked.  Before the bill came, the waiter brought a manger over and he apologized; and asked what was wrong with it ( I didn't think he was challenging my opinion, I think he just wanted feed back on how they could have done it differently) .  I told him that I just thought it tasted gross- and fatty; and again I said I wasn't expecting anything as the service and the rest of the food was good.   When the bill came, they took my entire meal off the menu..which I didn't expect but I think it says a lot about them. They tried to make it right by offering something else..then giving me way more than I asked for (especially because I didn't really ask for anything)    So because all the other food was good, the service was fantastic and they tried to make the customer happy, I am giving them 4 stars. I would eat here again because the over all experience was good.

Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jiBQe92xKTQ1F6ah68BxSw.text: The food took 45-50mins to come out. Food was cold and didnt have much seasoning to it. Staff was friendly, but they dont communicate well. I dont see myself coming back.

sb9E39Ye5DUoI8qBsWai6A.text: Not the best.  Service was slow and food was average, if you're eating at a mall in mobile, Alabama.  Should've had subway.

3GdE0ZIzCYV0P_imbF17rQ.text: Cool setting on the strip with good food, great service and some drink specials that help take the sting out of strip prices

d5Jr7TP9P3dWbe9QuN0W7w.text: Fun & loud place filled with lots of interesting people...  This place has a great design to it and a fun menu with really delicious creamy deviled eggs, mac & cheese coated with Doritos (wrong in all the right ways), fried pickles, decadent nachos, great spinach & artichoke dip and so many more fun plates!   We came here as a large group and it was perfect for sharing a bunch of appetizers and delicious cocktails! They have cocktail bowls here that are massive and will f@$k you up! The Caribbean sunset one was my favorite, Malibu coconut rum, Bacardi and orange & pineapple juice! A tropical paradise in a cup or bowl...  If you want a loud spot with Rock & Roll blaring this is it! Bull riding anyone? This place has you covered. One cocktail bowl and you'll find yourself in Urban Cowboy! I love that movie...

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato skins
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ chicken tenders

mfxMHQ-l8_yqJam8dJJ3-Q.text: DONT DO IT! Was standing out front with a group of friends when a promoter from this bar convinced us to go inside by offering two for one drinks and saying that we could ride the mechanical bull. We turned her down several times but finally agreed to go inside. We sat down at the bar and the waitress gets our drinks (Luke warm beers) and says "we're closed so you guys can take your drinks and go" just like that. And they wouldn't let us ride the bull! Over priced. Unprofessional and undertrained staff. Had the feel of a Chuck E. Cheese for old bikers.

hsx0kDvnMq0VNSuwFOwl5w.text: This girl was hungry... as usual.  Since we were out and about walking the strip, we decided on PBR.  Before we had lived here, we had dined with them before and loved it.  So let's try it again!   We were greeted and seated immediately.  Kevin, our waiter, was over in a flash to get our drink order.  Let me just say that Kevin was an amazing waiter.  He was so attentive and friendly.  Our drinks were never empty and he was pleasant the entire time.     Our food choices landed on the Buffalo Chicken Pizza and the Bucking Bull Fries.  We've previously had the pizza before and wanted to see if it was still to our liking.   Since the last visit, they changed it a little bit by sprinkling the blue cheese crumbles on top instead of the blue cheese sauce.  It wasn't as good as before but still ok.  The pizza itself is huge and can easily be spilt between two people... maybe even three.   We also split the fries which were completely covered by sauteed onions, bacon, cheddar cheese sauce and buffalo hot sauce.  Delicious!  Very messy but we just ate them with forks.  Overall the food was still good enough to dine again.  Dinner and a show?  There is a mechanical bull in the restaurant.  It's free to ride with your paid receipt.  Would I try it?  Probably not but there are plenty of others who aren't afraid to!  We even witnessed a girl in a skirt ride the bull.  It is Vegas right?  This is so entertaining watching people attempt this craziness!  Plus there are tv's everywhere in the restaurant.  It is a great fun atmosphere.  :-)

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken pizza.
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucking Bull Fries! Yum!

Eilf5vHh3rfmd2MlIQ1Alg.text: Food and drinks are phenomenal! Service is TERRIBLE!!! Multiple times, we were one of a handful of tables in the restaurant (during the day) and the service was AWFUL. Absolutely awful. Server sat on her phone behind the bar while we waited for our check for 20 minutes.

k6PyBOhOs5tR6EofGenh0g.text: Absolutely the best PATTY MELT (even better than one from the Waffle House at 2 am down off Peachtree Street).  Do youself a favor visit the PBR RockBar & Grill and Jessica at the bar.  Place to be!  If your curious who Jessica is, she the bar tender who's a True-blue BLACK HAWKS fan!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can ride a darn mechanical bull between PBR drafts, unless your a chicken

1JVsCMcZvYJ306VJr0472A.text: Food was good service was fast had reservations on open table so had no wait time . The nachos were excellent will defiantly return when not so hungover as the music was a little loud

WTHsgOKxtdIGBm-eC36iEg.text: Fast and friendly service, though food was excessively salty.  Grill is always open, so this is good for late nights if everywhere else on the strip is closed.  Yelp check-in awards B1G1 drink.  Loud music and lots of TVs, fun ambiance.  Located right inside the entrance of Miracle Mile.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled chipotle chicken

hr0a9Pj5FHhHyqXENMQxtw.text: Came on vacation with a couple friends and we purchased the open bar groupon that came with an appetizer for each of us. I was really excited because my husband and I went to the rockhouse over at the palazzo and had such a good time and I thought this would be the same because they are technically owned by the same person.   I was 100times wrong! We walked in to redeem our groupon and you can only do it at the small rockhouse bar on the left side of the restaurant. We walked up and the bartender was so rude! I wish I had her name cuz I'd call her out but she was a skinny blonde chick with a thigh tattoo. She practically rolled her eyes every time we asked her for a drink and she told another girl to get us wristbands and the other girl seemed so annoyed that she had to do that for us because they were groupons. Ok. We get it. 3/4 of us are servers and we don't like to do stupid sales but it's part of your job. At least be nice about it. I didn't even want to go back and ask her for anything because she had her nose in the air the whole time so I asked my husband to get us drinks.   I eventually went over there to get drinks and the whole time she was making my drinks she was talking to some guys at the bar and saying profanities like it was normal to do that in front of customers. No, it's not. That's nasty and rude. It makes the establishment look so unprofessional. We sat at a table a little ways from the bar and had ordered some food. She didn't come pick up the plates or trays until we were leaving like an hour later and didn't even come over to check on us or offer us condiments or napkins! I had to go up to the bar and get napkins myself. Mind you, this was a TUESDAY AFTERNOON. NO ONE WAS EVEN THERE! She was not busy and could have done so much better.   This place is only getting one star because the food was decent. But service was so awful! I would never recommend getting this groupon. I would however recommend getting the one for the rockhouse at the palazzo.   I will call management about our experience because it was so unacceptable.

br4x0DHWpaNFjky5F1oe6g.text: Garbage food. Garbage service. Overpriced. Took 45 minutes to bring us our food. 50$ for sandwiches I prolly could make better if I made them myself

5TmDEsdIjBgeolpQW93R7A.text: My friend wanted pizza but i didnt so we tried this place because of the big variety on menu. Was happy to get the bogo drink check in offer. My friend ordered her pizza w mushrooms and when they brought it out it was just a cheese pizza. Apparently they ran out of mushrooms and didnt say anything just poor communication from staff to customer. I had the club sandwich which was fine. They ended up comping us... Which is commendable.   The bloody mary's were really good.

Y52M6EftZ-_I9mRFKiXIYw.text: This place is awesome! Heather, our server, was very attentive and knowledgeable! We spent way longer than we were planning on, and it was totally worth it!  #bestspotinvegas

WZdB5WfhwjO7aYnY7mcp1A.text: One star because of the ambiance..  Otherwise zero stars...  Country bar that's packed and lively so you think the food would be good. Also has a mechanical bull.   Food was not only NOT good...  It was way overpriced and came out ice cold. We wanted to return it but the waiter (woods was last name on receipt) didn't come back the entire meal and the food took almost 30 minutes to get there in the first place.   We both ordered the $25 combo plates w Mac n cheese and fries as side. Dorito crusted Mac n cheese would have been better if they'd used kraft out of the box. Gross.   The ribs and brisket were both very subpar. Friend got the chicken that was dry and cold.      Bill was $52...  Not the biggest issue with losing the money but more with losing the opportunity to eat at a GOOD Vegas restaurant...  And they are everywhere

pSkIw01EM_xqj4CBxVJoEw.text: I have to say it is hard to mess up a burger and a steak salad. First we waited for 40 minutes to get salad with steak and the burger. When asked why that long their answer was: it takes long time to cook steak. No sorry we are busy. That why it was even more upsetting when we got the food and the steak was cold and row when asked for medium. The. Urged was cold even the cheese on it was not melted. We were late to our flight and had not time to complaint but I will never go back and I am in Vegas few times a year. Don't waist your time and money here. There are way to many good places around

KSE0XyfWvjr9x9j9W9dBlg.text: We were on our way to see Brad Garrett and wanted a quick bite before we saw the show. There are so many places on the Las Vegas Strip it's hard to choose where to go. Originally, we decided we would go to the Spice Buffet, but when we got there and took a look around, it looked like a cafeteria. We left and started walking back down the strip.  The PBR Rock Bar and Grill is outside of the Planet Hollywood Casino. We sat outside watching the end of the Rock and Roll Marathon as the runners were finishing up. Las Vegas Boulevard was closed and thousands of runners had taken control.  The menu is large, and there were a few things that caught my eye. On the suggestion of the server I got the 1/2 rack of ribs. The air was a little cold and there were lots of gas heaters around. There was actually one right over our table, but it had been disconnected because they put a TV too close to it and it was a fire hazard. So, we stayed cold.  The ribs were done so well the meat literally fell of the bone. I was not too thrilled with the barbecue sauce.   The atmosphere was great (albeit cold) and the service was good. The food was average. The prices were reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 slab of baby backs with fries
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken fingers

W2Lrf0-bSkUenPT2Tdt-_g.text: At 11pm This place a pleasant surprise the bartender was friendly. I can say a bar is a place you want to relax and have a great time. This place has potential. We made plans to stop in the next day for round two. At looking over the check, we thought it was reasonable we drank ate and had a good time. BUT when looking at the TAX... we were taxed 16.5% vs 8.25%. Now I would be fine with it if told upfront. We were told the management needed to look it over. This is happening every day to many tourists and it's just not right!..I say be wary, look over your  check and look over it.  Apparently it's been like this all day and they "just" noticed it.

5dwsTe5ujlhdbx7_z3KDkg.text: Sat at the bar which was relatively empty.  Service was bad, not attentive in the least. Ordered margarita pizza. It may be the worst pizza I've ever had. No flavor at all.   I do not recommend this establishment at all.

kawNDu4_Udez8RGfXal7SQ.text: Earlier today my friend called to make an order for pickup. She told me their chicken wings were really good so I thought, what a great idea for me to call and order as well. An hour after she called and ordered, I decide to call. A woman named Kristen answers the phone and I ask her if I can place an order to pick up, but she tells me "unfortunately we can't because the phones aren't near a register". So technically the 1 Star I gave, should be 0 stars because I haven't tried this place and looks like I never will.

cxTzuRDsPCfyl70oUz8xIw.text: Ended up here due to a drink promotion some guy was handing out outside. We actually went in because they had a girl hula hooping and she was good!!  The staff was great, I somehow spilt my fresh drink and they made me a new one. And hello they have bull you can ride!!!  This was a great place to stop for a drink and hang out for a few songs!

xtsDn4E8_dcaIy2UAMcykw.text: This is the one spot in Vegas we always need to go!! We fell in love with it 2 years ago and returned back the other day and it was still the same as we remembered!   The staff is awesome and they are so friendly. Our server was a guy named David and he was so patient with us! He was def one of the best servers we've had when eating here. He gave us good suggestions and was very quick with everything.   The food & drinks are great also! We always get the pretzel & it's our fave thing to share. You should check this place out if you haven't yet, it won't disappoint!

iiHiXh-p6TOnIP-hj0N1AQ.text: Slow is a understatement, we waited 10 minutes for someone to ask us what we wanted to drink. Then 10 more to get 2 beers, but that's not the worst of it. My wife and her friend ordered drinks that came out 12 minutes after the beers and the one was wrong. The manger walks around like he's lost, and doesn't even look to be helpful. I would have gave them 1 star, but to be fair the food was not terrible. The services is a train wreak. They had 3 hostess at the front and 2 people in the outside area taking food orders. It's a real shame,because it's a nice place, but it's pretty evident that they are lacking management.

ptDd3VbZZZ-dcw1MW2oXmA.text: Food was not only disgusting, but a big of some sort was literally crawling around in the lettuce they served with the fajitas. My boyfriend showed me and I immediately lost my appetite for the overly cheesed up bull fries that I had wanted to send back but didn't because I didn't want to be a pain. When they came by our table we showed them the bug and asked they take both plates. They removed the fajita from the bill but they still charged us for the fries I had 3 bites of. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

JgHdW29Kyq2TVJ_rxAgJNQ.text: FIRST TIME IN VIVA LAS VEGASSSSSSSS  Ordered a drink with pineapple vodka pineapples rum and oranges. Joel was the server and he was amazing and beyond. He was patient as we (five indecisive girls) made food and drink decisions. He was fast and checked on us often. If you dine inside, definitely request him. I ordered the meat lovers pizza and it was extremely tasteful. There was also a girl that came around and took a gorgeous picture of us. Loved every moment of this place.

LhIB1I_6CXRPdG-27FxKwA.text: Great location on the strip with beautiful views from the patio seating. The staff was friendly and the service was good. We had the grilled cheese with tomato bisque, the spinach and artichoke dip and the triple decker turkey club. Everything was excellent. The tomato bisque was a little cold, but still good. The turkey club was huge; more than enough for my husband - who was unable to finish it. The grilled cheese was excellent and the chips were to die for! The bar was a little slow getting a beer out, which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. Would definitely eat here again!

PZc9gm-S1o3700_3AhQ6uQ.text: Great, inexpensive breakfast that ranges from $5 to $10.  Bloody Mary was tasty and full of veggies and vodka.  Customer service could be improved because it took 15 minutes for a waiter to serve me.   Once I received my food she was very attentive.  Seating outside is comfortable because misters provide a cooling off experience.

BzZEhK1MefYdT_G85WnaDA.text: Best reasonably priced breakfast on the strip.  Coffee was great and hot too. Our server, Thomas, was very helpful and attentive to our needs.  We never had an empty cup of coffee.

8DMgvkyfr-LjpzrDFgJOpQ.text: Great place. The bull is so fun. Erin is the best bartender. Super fun! BUT unfortunately not a 5 star because they changed the uniform.... I wish it was more casual. They're wearing button up shirts. Need to go back to more casual like it used to be!!!

HKsU5I3r5gCBnLB09r5t0A.text: 2 for 1 drink coupons and great brunch/breakfast menu made this a great place to start the day!

B3duqw5P-lb26f0kwlpq0A.text: A massive sports bar (video screens EVERYWHERE) with just average food.  My server seemed busy and relatively non-attentive, even though it was a very late lunch (not that busy).  The food is on par with an average Fridays or Chili's - ok but nothing to write home about.  It is a little on the pricey side for what you actually get.  OK for a family, but not really budget friendly.

Ll4GDw8Pg_udqFkC1l9njw.text: Okay food. Good & fast service. Reasonably priced. Awesome outdoor seating. Enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KE5subpt1mVIVhJY3d8HWw.text: We are leaving today and wanted stop in for a nice breakfast and drink. Can't believe how affordable it was! And delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QD9Xgb9JiOmqHKRjxGDe1A.text: The two highlights of PBR are the mechanical bull and the large format drinks (serves 6+ unless you're feeling ambitious). The food is standard bar/pub food and is nothing to write home about. We tried the bull shrimp appetizer (shrimp with fried tomatoes), wings (buffalo style were actually pretty good, baked in flavor) and the salmon (overcooked). While I didn't try the large format drinks, the group said they were too sweet and tasted like Capri sun, which is to be expected.

bUnkU1G1Uj_qTp9rRUr4lw.text: Great atmosphere, fair service, gross bathrooms! Food was good - fried pickles are delicious.

I5CupuDgwfkQnG3y0R-D5w.text: Great food and great service by our waitress Jenny!  We stopped in after arriving to town late and got right in.

XCsjbA8BO6UDz3xbVzeSDA.text: I can't even rave about it being conveniently located right in front of Planet Hollywood as there are loads of other options for a drink within just as great a location.  Unfortunately all I cansay is overpriced, dirty and avery disinterested verging on rude bartender.  The fellow out front enticed us in with a two for one drink ticket.  Yet two draft beers still cost $20 and this was bluntly pointed out to me by the bartender that this was WITH the ticket.  SO consider me played and next time I'll find a friendlier place for a beer even if at the same price.

VefP7qvJdyOYdjsyN0Cmng.text: Almost any vegan choises. I had the green house salad with no dressing or croutons.. was ok. The food came fast. The place is really noisy.

W6LdXS49B0-z6GdwwQp6lQ.text: Overpriced menu selection Does not have a veggie burger as an option Macaroni & cheese dish lacked flavor as a supple alternative for anything to eat & even the beer tasted bland

LINU6XEWa1o93ixyN2W1dQ.text: Meh....  Wings were eh...  And fries were decent  nothing to write home about....  Good service though...  Waiter was cool.

qmJGDtaJCERuB9KVLHjKJQ.text: I have been to PBR bar for drinks a few times before, but hadn't tried the food until now. I have been on a Mexican food kick all week, so to keep with that I got the chicken fajitas. The chicken had a great lime flavor to them, but for the cost, I felt like they were pretty mediocre. I could have gone to Chili's down the strip and gotten better fajitas for half the price. The guacamole looked like runny baby poop and the fajitas weren't served with any cheese. Brian decided to go out of the box and get the chicken and waffles pizza.  The pizza itself was good, but the chicken and waffles on top were extremely dry and lacked flavor. The service was really good, but the food was nothing worth getting excited about. We shared a fish bowl of margaritas with some friends of ours, which tasted really good. 100 ounces of margarita is a bit much, but they gladly give you to-go cups for any that can't be consumed at the table.

JvhJxc6Hm5Zd7KrhCZ9zew.text: Terrible service. Went for dinner and drinks last night. Hostess did not bother to acknowledge us when we walked up and made us feel as though we should be grateful for their ability to seat us. Once seated we waited 30 mins before a waitress even stopped to say shed be back to get our drink order. Needless to say we got up and walked out. Customer service is lacking. I dont care how great of a place it is. There are another 1,000 just as cool places in vegas. Not worth the time.

_Rz2Ok9i_bIY9S75ONgIcQ.text: Love this place. Every time we are in Vegas we make it a point to come here for breakfast. We have never been disappointed in the food or the price!   The staff seem really invested in the success of the Restuarant.  See some of the same faces working each time we come back.  Note to chef: bring back the grits- they were amazing.

dAOQnZjoAi-7IPu_adgC7Q.text: OK...looking for a great place to watch the games...look no further!!  The Rock Bar has a thousand TV's and an outdoor area with fire pits in the table!!  The best amenity of the Rock Bar is Crissy Compton!!  Crissy was more than accommodating for our group of almost 20.  The buckets of beer are the way to go and the potato skins with the pulled pork are Epic!! Thanks Crissy for creating a great place for us to enjoy the games!! We'll be back!! CHEERS!!

z4xv0o-0379meZVBS2kgVA.text: Stopped in here for a few drinks before clubbing labor day weekend. The girls on the side walk hand out 2 for 1 drink tickets. This is somewhere to stop by and have a ton of drinks and quality is not an issue. They have a beer pong table and mechanical bull. I didn't try the food during my visit.

c6fvAM6P0NFmPhRnRjfxqw.text: 4 of us stopped in for a few drinks on the patio.  The hostess just pointed us in the direction of patio & we had to piece together some chairs at table for 2 together ourselves because there were 2 people sitting at a table for 6.  That was common for this patio, lots of available chairs but all the tables taken.  Not sure if the open seating patio was the bars idea or our a hostess. The drinks seemed a little weak & they put salt instead of sugar on the rim of my wife's strawberry margarita.  The patio couch we had as our only option (after being asked to move)  was nasty.  Didn't even walk inside, just wanted a few drinks on our way elsewhere & that's what I rated.

HaZb7GZXO5Rb7zyYoGhSZg.text: Jay is the most amazing server that I have ever seen in action.  My husband and I had our groom's dinner at PBR Rock Bar & Grill and he served 29 people by himself!!  He was extremely attentive and made everyone feel like they were important.  Jay deserves a raise for being able to handle our families, what a huge task!!  He meet every single request with a smile, all while everyone was moving throughout the tables and restaurant.    Our families raved about how much fun they had, including the 5 children under that age of seven with us.  The food was fabulous, the atmosphere, and music were great.  Of course everyone loved the bull...it was an added bonus.  Every single one our our guests from our 3 year old nephew to my 82 year old grandfather had a enjoyed themselves.  And we didn't have a heart attack when the check came, everyone had their fill of food and drink and it was reasonably priced.  We will be back!!

QHR5_gILOL2eBaWTS5ZAyA.text: I ate here because the line at Earl of sandwich was really long and I was starving. I should have waited in line. This place wasn't horrible by any means it just wasn't great. I had the field greens salad with goat cheese which would have been great if it was drenched which dressing which over powered all the other flavours. They also really need to get new menus they are so old and warm that they are kind of hard to read.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Field green salad with goat cheese

yqgC8H_HnJjpEZfpP_v0YQ.text: It is what it is. It's a pub where you and your buddies can grab a (relatively) cheap drink), watch some sports on the tv. Came here on a Monday during their happy hour for a quick bite. Had their $3 beer special which comes out a plastic cup - keeping it classy, college style :) BF has a 36oz strawberry slushy which I think came in under $16, but I could be wrong. Either way, this was by far the most bang for our buck alcohol-wise during our entire trip. Cheapest slushy drink I've seen walking around Las Vegas.   Ordered some buffalo wings to share which were delicious and large. They were fat, huge wings! It was suppose to be a snack but was closer to feeling like dinner even though we only had 10 wings.   Would come here again if I was around Planet hollywood next time I'm in sin city.

ARnEjzn_eg5b-YPK1buzEA.text: We had a blast at the PBR Rock Bar & Bar. Great BBQ food, sports on all night and a mechanical bull to ride.    We started with the fried pickles (delicious), and my boyfriend and I split the pulled pork sandwich and fried chicken sandwich. The pulled pork sandwich was ok - not BBQ enough for me. The fried chicken sandwich was good...nothing special.   For dessert we ordered the mini cupcakes on skewers...such a cute idea! 3 were red velvet, 3 german chocolate and 3 had bacon crumbles. We also shared the sundae...so good. A warm, freshly baked waffle below ice cream, bananas and whipped cream.  Yum!  Such a fun place...you should stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Cupcake Skewers and the Sundae

NJ0Vs44x7H7B_q3JWH_B9A.text: This place has a killer patio with strip view and great people watching.  You have to order the pulled pork nachos and the dorito crusted mac n cheese! !!!

F9Cv-G0k_kvN0eAHVqDzdA.text: Came in here on a thursday night, late.  Inside was so loud we could not hear each other even when shouting. Went to the outside part and it was great.  Loved the outside party/strip atmosphere and our server was GREAT and I give him extra credit for it being 1 am! He told us about he 2 for 1 drinks we could get inside and carry outside.  That brings down his check average but he told us anyway.  That's pretty amazing.  I got the broccoli cheese soup because I didn't want something fried that late at night. It was good.  People in my party got wings and buffalo fries and they were really good. The fries especially. I loved the menu and wished it had been earlier so I could have ordered more. I would definitely go again.

vZYDVS5MNPgl0KW6gjqvvA.text: This is a decent option of you need food late at night and want to roll in looking like garbage after a long flight. I had the pulled pork sandwich and my wife had a burger. They were both good, but nothing that you couldn't get elsewhere. They had Angry Orchard on tap, so I was pretty happy about that.

IDAzrewuehNeupOw4CjJKA.text: Free dinner after a show... Whoever thought a sports bar was a good end to a show night was nuts. Not a rock bar in any sense, expect commercials so loud you can't talk to your party.

4Yh_yIZEKSgyrVAhGjcpOA.text: I like this place for the most part. The location is cool and it was nice to sit outside. We were seated quickly and our server was nice and efficient. The food was pretty good, but one of my sides was cold. We wanted to order strawberry margaritas and were instructed to order one in this bull cup thing. Already slightly buzzed (we had just 2 drinks by the pool before we came), we agreed. The drink was huuuuuge in souvenir cup I could have lived without but pretty good. I was disappointed to find out they were $28 each when the check came. Overall the check was $106 for 2 ppl to eat and have 1 drink and mind you this is a bar with bar average food. The drink was so big neither of us could finish it and by the time we got back to the room I was sick. I never get sick so this was alarming to me. Not sure if it was the food or sugary margarita that made me nauseated with a splitting headache, but our day ended there, all Vegas night plans out the window!

6g5Wq8XWX4TmDfIr7i6BdQ.text: I was in heaven here . . . . on a Sunday with every NFL game within view, and close enough of a view that I could see who missed that catch!  One thing to note (I don't know if it's a good thing or bad because listening to someone else's game would be annoying), but there is NO GAME SOUND -- they play music instead.  Like I said, maybe not such a bad thing.  Atmosphere was perfect -- restrooms are IN the restaurant, not across the casino floor --- BONUS!    The food is ok, just ok.  Thus the one less star . . . it's bar food, though they try to make it better than bar food.  Though we only tried breakfast items, so I can't judge too hard.  :)   Beer in a bucket was the special -- $20 for 5 bottles domestic of your choice.  Not too bad . . . don't order draft, those are something like $8/ea and after a bucket's worth, that gets a little pricey for football watching.   They do have some minimums though -- if you come during the early games and stay for the late games, there is a $40 food and beverage minimum that needs to be met for the afternoon.  We had no problems making this with the price of the food/drinks, but just a good thing to know.   P.S. when you've had enough of the games, there is a bull you can try out too. . . . if not for you, watching is always very entertaining!  We did laugh our a**es off at a woman who thought the had it down, but didn't.  Ouch!

ZI6O5dyYHznlXOMwDRzocA.text: In town for a company retreat and a party of 11, we walked in excited for lots of drinks and some much needed food. We sat down at the table that was set up for us in the center of the floor and waited for our server. After about 10 minutes of waiting (it was slow) and no water, she came over for drink orders. We put in an order for 6-7 different appetizers and proceeded to make her aware of our Yelp discounts for buy one get one. At this point she directs us to the bar to order our drinks, "that will take me 20 minutes, you'll need to make your order at the bar and show them your voucher and stormed off. I don't know about you, but it seems a tad unrealistic for 11 people to make their way to the bar to place a drink order. Hence, the reservation. I'd a also like to point out we were not splitting the bill, this would all be on one check.  Seems like a good opportunity for some $$$$, right?  The owner of our company made his way to the front to speak with a manager. He had to wait behind another very unsatisfied customer who was speaking with the manager about the service received. (Bad sign eh?)   He came back to the table, we waited for 5 minutes and no one addressed our concerns or apologized.   Our group of 11 stood up and made our way to Cabo Wabo. Needless to say this was a very poor experience, I would not recommend it (especially to a group).

uAzIUtwSgQgF8nDuYt5S8Q.text: Dorito Crusted Mac n Cheese $5 (3/5 NOMs).  Vegas Brunch, Whenever I encounter a weird food experiment I just have to try it. This is like mixing my two favorite things! Doritos and Mac n Cheese. Overall the dish was good, but not amazing. I wish there was more doritos mixed with Mac n Cheese. I want the whole thing to be orange! Most likely if I come back, this is a one time order dish for me.   Breakfast Burrito $10 (3/5 NOMs).  Lets have giant Vegas brunch, Dam that thing is ginourmouse. I was very surprised how big this burrito was. Though the size was the only surprise in there. While there is a lot going inside, it was a bit weak. Tasted kind of bland to me. I do give them high points for adding crazy amount of bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dorito Crusted Mac n Cheese $5 (3/5)
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito $10 (3/5 NOMs)
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito $10 (3/5 NOMs)

hEtfXPshTe1de-PIrMEl9Q.text: We visited here on our last night and they were one of the few restaurant and bar that was opened till 2 am on a Sunday night on that end if the strip and in the PH mall/casino. The waitress was sweet, she communicated well and let us know when last call for drinks and food was- that was greatly appreciated since we were starving at 1 am. Beer and food selections were great and prices average to strip restaurant bar prices.  The atmosphere was fun still and ambiance was exciting even in a Sunday. Great decor and clean! I'll be back to hangout and eat here! I gave it four stars because we didn't get to hang out longer and heard great things about it - I'll update when we revisit.

h2qEr_EF2zEoaxjaKYsh8g.text: Awesome joint. Great food. It was a great place to catch our breath after walking down the Strip.

q5l9fFvcStZzw3KWqU5eXQ.text: This restaurant is right outside the Planet Hollywood entrance near the sports book, so it is very convenient. We shared sliders and a soup/grilled cheese appetizer that were both delicious! Michael at the bar kept our glasses full, and saw to our every need!

v2Urr6_O8mgl8ba9HyeLEw.text: Took forever to get food, had to ask the server several different times for extra plates, when was our food going to be out, and for the check. There should be a manager on duty walking around making sure customers are happy and that they are being service in a timely manner. Service was bad and food over priced for what it was. Wont be back!! Way better service at Cabo Wabo and Nacho Daddy!!!

TabARYWGUd8QJDy7RCypgw.text: My girlfriends smoked salmon in and it was raw in the middle. My other friend had pizza and the dough was raw inside. I told a waitress about it and she said she will tell our main waitress about the problem. We waited for a while and realized she didn't tell her. So I went up to our main waitress and she apologized and offered a replace or a substitution. My fish and chips were just nasty. Amateur line cooks?

OW-SsZo_S_XMHT9r03zj3w.text: Unfortunately our experience at this bar was pretty bad. We ordered de queso con carne appetizer and it was truly disgusting! There was literally two tablespoons of grease floating on top of the cheese. The service was really mediocre, we saw our waitress, the manager and a bus-person passing by our table, but no one was willing to refill our drinks. It literally took 20 minutes to get more soda. For my entree I got the mac and cheese and it was pretty bland. The only good part about my visit was the warm cookie appetizer which was delicious! Overall, the bar has a great atmosphere, I just wish the food an

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie skillet
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken mac

UkfJMbVtgHDt2xZ-1TGLJQ.text: Never again. We sat and nobody came to help us so we moved to the bar. We asked them to put the fight on the tvs. That took at least 30 minutes so we missed quite a bit of it. When we ordered, half of the things we wanted weren't available. If it was slammed and busy I would be more understanding, but that wasn't the case. I would not recommend you bring your Vegas experience here.

nmpr2pmp0kbbPCtLpEwvVg.text: The brisket was tasteless,  the pasta far short of al dente, and the salad lack luster. The server was friendly and attentive and did cover my drink because everything else was awful.

cTbO5kJAks-vZF5io7SU5A.text: Went in last night with my girlfriends for a late dinner. I was greeted by Hunter and Tyler. All the staff though including our waiter was very friendly. Better than your average restaurant/bar food for sure. I noticed some healthy options on there as well but who buys healthy in Vegas! I had a jalapeno burger with sweet potato tater tots. It was so good, I ate the entire . Atmosphere was fun- we got to watch the drunk girls rip their pants and fly off the mechanical bull. The waiter split our checks for us (how annoying that is, very nice of him) and I loved the location. We sat outside (Right near the strip where you can watch everything and everybody go by).  1 star for the food, 1 star for the atmosphere, 1 star for the waiter, 1 star for the management and 1 star for the location = 5

d_7Q8XkolLuWqt3cKw44Wg.text: Was really excited for my birthday to do some karaoke on a Wednesday with five other friends. There wasn't hardly anyone in there and we waited 15 mins at a table and were never acknowledged.  We left.

EWi3YIb8kBAGeksDazXxkg.text: Too loud Over rated Over priced Food was bleh Drink was weak  You wait 30-40 minutes for nothing!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pkZrzwrWNQ8j9XpQubU9gg.text: Great food, great service, great deal.   We came for my husband's 30 birthday brunch. The manager offered us a free desert and free shot for the occasion.   There were 13 of us, and we all got about 2 drinks and an entry and a shot, and the bill came out to $407. The portions were so big we all could have split our meals and been fine.   Selena was our waitress, and she was very patient with our massive party.   The hot dogs could feed an army.

epf8-K60pQASy3wXv34jbg.text: The atmosphere is a bar of loud 70s rock music. We had good service with several check ins. I ordered buffalo wings, while they had a good flavor, they were not spicy. The California sandwich is really good and i would recommend it.

fP81kum66GQHNG1-F_Bw2w.text: Attentive service from Eric on a slower Sunday night and high-quality entrees for a reasonable price. Lots of variety on menu. Would return.

k4cN83Y8vKuy3jlj-Cz1oQ.text: No stars. If you cant accommodate your guest on the 'OpenTable' app, why even bother. Absolute pathetic service

sJzYj88Vo9kqvJbk57lzrA.text: I love the PBR Rock Bar & Grill! Besides the friendly service, the location is a huge plus! We sat outside and had a great spot to watch the people going by. I had an egg & cheese sandwich with fries which was good but nothing special. Combined with a PBR it makes a real good meal. Especially because the price was pretty decent for Las Vegas.  We visited in the afternoon and various seats were taken. I could imagine it being crowded and party-like at night, because they offer drinking games like beer pong and others. Over all I really enjoyed my visit and would definitely come back again!

sBpvZuMcJV7zQI7lk_VZ8w.text: Amazing staff good drinks and low prices..... The atmosphere was electric and contagious

yXwn1Kvdx9j-EEY5rK5hrg.text: Went to Vegas for the weekend with the wife & son. Drove in Friday afternoon. Came to PBR for dinner around 7pm. Came in and was seated immediately. We chose the patio area to enjoy the views. It took awhile to get our orders placed. Once the food came in, the appetizer was brought with the main course. The server didn't bring my son his Mac & Cheese that we ordered for him. He was brought something totally different than what we ordered from the kids menu. So we had to wait an additional 10 minutes until the correct order was brought for my son. We weren't going to eat while he sat there waiting. that would be rude. So we waited until all 3 of us had our plates/bowls in front of us. At least my son's food was comped. At the end of the dinner, I wasn't really bothered. I was not going to let that ruin the start of the weekend getaway with my fam.

UT47iKMmFZf_e5iT_wkpIw.text: Vicki and Sammy went out of thier way to make a really awful experience with a promoter better. You ladies rock! Thx a million

6p337sAvZff8Z7VBH4S8QA.text: My absolute favorite place to eat after Vegas Pool Parties.  They have outside seating so you don't have to freeze in the air conditioning.  Good food, beer on draft, nice servers, decent pricing.  It's in the middle of the strip, which makes it an easy spot to meet with people staying at other hotels. There's also one of those margarita yard cup fill stations right next to it. Good for anyone ready to continue the days partying on way out :)

Ji2molZgjiTxHWCXiMUiwA.text: Go to a buffet...   This was overpriced food. My gf didn't want to do a buffet bc we always do buffets but this place was overpriced. Same cost if you got a cheap buffet.   This is a bar place but we wanted regular breakfast/brunch/lunch food and it just...wasn't good.  Food: I ordered a chicken sandwich with my gf and they split it for us. Wtf,this was a tiny sandwich. It was falling apart as you ate it too. I was just shocked with the price or a small sandwich - $15  My gfs ordered soup and it was incredibly SALTY. They were able to change it but man... It was ad.  Ambiance: very bar scene. So I didn't expect much or the food. I bet the drinks are overpricely great.    Overall: skip it for breakfast-lunch, but you cn drink there

S7QtJOc_8t_Dsg56eGCutQ.text: Best Bloody Mary I ever had!!! I had the deviled eggs and chile verde chicken soup, the soup came with a waffle corn bread. My son had the half rack ribs and sausage links with a side of Doritos crusted mac & cheese. The food was great and the atmosphere was fun and you get a free bull ride with your receipt.

sDCs3H76N1s_2DpQi412dw.text: Great music. Both in restaurant and club side. Food was avg and a little slow  If your short on money seems like they always have some sort of drink deal going on

e-gkGRuSBAoZcFC8G5bURg.text: Where to start.... service too slow! Food over priced and over rated. They had no utensils and glasses. We asked for utensils and the waitress said they ran out, really? What are we suppose to eat our food with? Don't waist your time or money here.

pKD58nCWdQh9ID2n8BE60w.text: The food at PBR is not by any means healthy, but oh so good. We were seated promptly and catered by multiple servers and bussers who were very attentive. We ordered the fried pickles as an appetizer. These were by far the best fried pickles I have ever had! We were so tempted to order more before our meals came! My boyfriend and I split a jalapeno cheeseburger and the taco salad. The burger was cooked perfectly and had great seasoning. The meat was very good. The taco salad was incredible! Not healthy at all but so addictive! What happens in Vegas right? The atmosphere of PBR was casual and fun! Everyone was having a good time! They have picnic tables made to look as if you are eating outside and a mechanical bull that you can ride if you dare! They also have a nice bar attached to the side where you can chill out, play giant jenga and order more drinks after dinner. This is a great casual place to visit in Las Vegas where all feel they are welcome.

I9jHbQdKjkY_GccO5nbUqg.text: I wanted a quick meal and a few drinks and this place did not disappoint. The bartenders were fast and very receptive as well.  I had the double burger, I think it's called double trouble? It was very good but it really is perfect for splitting between two people. I would recommend it to anyone who likes a good $19 burger.

Sp9Cy8rQVRcGlKSFh_81pQ.text: Food was very good.  Other than that, the bartender I had tonight was awful.  She only checked on me twice in an hour, and even poured a little bit of water into my beer.  Plus, unlike the name this is a country bar, not a rock bar.  To top it off, when I paid she got my credit card mixed up with someone elses.  Never again will I go to this place, nor will I recommend it to anyone.  Gilley's at Treasure Island is a far better country bar

1H8lYCfGMaL_HKpsdJQwfA.text: Such a cool place to drink and dine. The atmosphere is very rodeo even have a mechanical bull. We received a free ride by eating there. Sorry to say we declined the bull ride. The waitstaff was amazing. We ate burgers and they were delicious. Will definitely go back on this trip to Vegas.

7QuCBeiqzh_OzA6HuhrMMQ.text: I'm gonna give this 5 stars, and it could possibly be due to the fact that I had a drink or ten in me when I ate here :)  Came in around 330 in the morning (which was 630 for us east coast people). The fact that we were able to get food this early, with no wait and able to have a great time while doing so speaks for itself. But, the food was pretty good as well...and I'm pretty sure it's not because my judgement was a little off. Good food is good food, right?  I ended up getting some type of burger with pulled pork on top. I have no clue what it was called but it was delicious. This is just ingenious. Just writing this review makes me want another one. Wonder if the PBR in Baltimore has one?

HeZTHclu2hs6fl1xZRu7GA.text: This is an AWESOME place to catch a sporting event in LV.   They have really cool seating spaces, but get there early!  Country music is commonly thumping throughout and the wait staff is decidedly good natured and fun!  The Chicken Club is AMAZING, huge and full of goodies like avocado!

fv_xnag4J6RXOsURpjHZuA.text: AH! This place is AMAZING! I literally wanted to eat here everyday, and pretty much did! They have one of the best menus I have ever seen. Everything from breakfast served all day to sweet potato tots to Dorito encrusted mac and cheese. There were so many crazy, ecclectic things on the menu that I literally wanted to order one of everything just to say that I have had it!   I ordered the bacon and egg grilled cheese and it was heavenly! Everything was cooked perfectly and it got me wondering why I don't make these bad boys at home! Also, their french fries are delicious and perfectly crispy.   The atmosphere is that of your typical sports bar and the service is just fine. It's the menu options alone that are earning all 5 stars for me in this review!

RJ7geSReuKtL96f7C27v5A.text: If you want to talk to a hostess and be ignored and shrugged off, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU! No seating outside or estimated wait. We were sat inside for breakfast with strobe lights in our face, our server was super nice closed the sliding doors, the hostess came over 1 min later and opened it even further than it was before, said it needs to stay open, and when we tried to talk to her she waived us off and walked away. They made us move tables, said we probably can't keep the same server even though we had already ordered. The  manner in which they handled the situation made us feel like pests. The food was average. Nothing to write home about or go back to, but edible for sure.  Moral, if you are looking for a dirty party. Probably a great place, if you're looking for a meal and service, keep looking.

C5ICMA7ez3nhuumRHOGeVA.text: We came for lunch while waiting for check in. We are trying out a vegan diet and our waitress was extremely accommodating. We got the Fajitas and the Black Bean Burger and she made sure they removed all hidden butter/cheese/etc. The meals were good: nothing too fancy - delicious pub food. It's expensive, but it's Vegas so that's not surprising.   We came a second time around 1 am on a weeknight and were surprised to see that they still served food. Get the fries!

2QgmqyXuvQc8iyHLWbzt1Q.text: Food selection is great.... OMG they have a smores martini and dessert?! Breakfast all day? Chicken and waffle bucket?? Holy crap... WTF do i order?!?! That's what was going through my mind on Saturday when I went.   I'll keep it simple: -Food is awesome. I was so happy with my order and I wanted to order like 6 other things too. such a good selection and really yummmmmmmm.......  -SERVICE IS CRAP. Our waitress didn't even smile. when she went on break she told us someone would check in on us but they didn't. Her ass didn't even refill our drinks or anything. She came by when the bus boys cleared all of our plates (The bus boys were really nice and did ask us if we needed anything which is like so ass backwards.. +100 stars for them) then asked us if we wanted the bill. I wish I took her name down. We left a $10 tip but really shouldn't have left one at all. I hope she didn't get all of it.   So there you go. Honorable mentions: lots of TVs, good choice of beers on tap, mechanical bull in the corner.

DlCXuTEN54Lkb8NRuDDgNA.text: So NOT come late at night!! They are slow and you will fall asleep waiting for your food

euZFiMbpN5kuLELqMlsm4g.text: Roaming down the strip with drink in hand - my roomie & i went all the way from TI/Mirage to PH/Aria. Naturally, parts of it were a blur, but all I can distinctively remember is my Napolean Dynamite-intense craving for tater tots. In my desperation, I practically asked every restaurant on the side of the strip if they served tater tots.   But, we finally meandered our way to PH and found the ROCK BAR. My roomie knew of this place because she likes that the alcoholic slushies in the guitar/bud light containers. But, we didn't know they had food. Asked if they had tater tots, answered yes, & we were SOLD - or at least I was.   And from my fuzzy memory, I recall a giant glorious basket of deep fried golden-brown perfection. I really don't think anyone should have that much starch + deep fried food in a 15 minute window. But, I snarfed those puppies down (smothered in ketchup of course) with the utmost satisfaction.   Rockbar has a plethora of drunchie/bar finger food. Yumm-o.

yOe0e8gqROOGusPhhLgjvg.text: Pretty decent place to grab some food on the strip. The service and food were good. The sweet potato tots were my favorite!! I can't say anything about their drinks as I had water, but that was actually pretty good considering most restaurants I've had to actually order a drink Bc the water was so yucky. The servers were pretty cool and accommodating when I needed to charge my phone and didn't have an outlet they offered to charge it by the dj booth. Overall I had a good experience... may be back if I remember next time I'm on the strip!

cMTWjWw3COstQN89HzxqCA.text: This is the first place we noticed when we arrived in Planet Hollywood for our stay. Rock bar, bull ride, beer pong & flip cup, sounded like our kind of place & we intended to hang out there a bit. Unfortunately we didn't quite have as much free time as anticipated on our holiday as Vegas just seems to eat the hours away.  We did get in there for a bite to eat one day though. It's one of the few places we came across with free wifi for customers which was a massive plus for us since we hadn't been in touch with anyone online all week. The other thing they did, which I really liked, is when we ordered one meal & asked to split it, they actually cut the burger in half & brought it out on two separate plates. Maybe this is an american thing but I had never seen this before so it really impressed me.  It wasn't the best burger I had in the week I was in Vegas & it also wasn't the best pulled pork I've ever had (hence the 3 stars). But the sangria was good (albeit more juice than alcohol) & they also had a member of staff come take pictures of my Fiance & I and give us a small free copy of the one they took (with the option to buy the bigger ones). It was nice to get one souvenir I didn't have to pay a fortune for, even if the picture of the sandwich on the one we got was bigger than the picture of us two!

6GFdSLBmKp_n3qbAiHheTg.text: Seriously impressed with the veggie fajitas. My husband and I stopped here for lunch the other day and I wasn't too hopeful about finding a good veggie option on the menu - I was so wrong! Considering this place boasts BBQ and burgers I was really happy they went above and beyond for the vegetarian fajitas adding in loads of fresh veg, all well cooked and seasoned. Plus great drinks specials, good service and an excellent location.

tZuNNG_nZghuWAKlSTWZhw.text: The place itself was very nice, the service was a different story. We approached the outside bar and the bartender was a total D I C K! As soon as he saw us walking in, 4 Hispanics- his whole demeanor changed. He had no customer service skills. We asked if he had Modelos(beer) and he answered,"Yes, I take it you want them to go?"(with a smart look in his face) We said no,we sat down and he left us sitting there for over 15min waiting for our beers. When he finally came back,my brother asked how much was it and with a rude tone of voice and shoulder-shrug he answered,"I dunno." I asked for the recipe, he got the recipe, our change and a cup- he placed the recipe and money on the table and slammed a cup over them. This whole time he had a look of discuss in his face(just look at the attached picture), not making eye contact or any short conversation. His vibe, body language, demeanor screamed prejudice!  What a shame that now in these days we are still living and witnessing racism at its best.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worst bartender ever- no customer service and a total racist pig!

Nwfqk90wz01OmQuICPBEew.text: Burgers were delicious, nice atmosphere, watched our ATLANTA Braves clinch the NL East title!!

tBPMqgboCmk-K1vViSy1Xg.text: Great atmosphere with greater drinks and awesome customer service.  be sure to stop by and ask for Jenni

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 35oz Caribbean Sunset

D7osst_Xr3Rn06yotSAA_A.text: I've had tons of salmon salads as a pescatarian and the one at PBR was the best. It was very much like a delicious piece of salmon on a bed of spring greens, rice and garbanzo beans with some other  tasty yummies.   Their pretzel!  Wow. Go BIG or go home!  Awesome experience.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VSd2gZVkPJM4IJn_eQ0eKg.text: Fun place. Stopped in for dinner and a couple drinks. I had the barbecue ribs and mashed potatoes and my wife had a salad. Everything was delicious and the waitress did a great job. If your feeling tough you can ride the mechanical bull with the purchase of your meal for free.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vs9teUZWva0X4sZRjEzzCw.text: Myself and my Nephew had a great time the staff was friendly they made us feel at home the drinks were good the food was tasty. I was celebrating my Nephew 's 21st Birthday And I come to Vegas every year but this was my first but won't be my last visit here Thanks for the hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dR22Tn76CtZfjxXdJ-Kc-g.text: Live music and a great set up right on the strip. We ordered the nachos and fried pickles. The pickles were great but the portion size of the nachos were small. The service was slow but the overall atmosphere was great.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w2emfZl6K0dfCNSPvzOa7w.text: Great bar!! They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. Staff were wonderful. I even rode their mechanical bull. Thanks so much .

3yxSvcsM1RVUW5F7cTEfBA.text: I really love this place! We were searching for a place to eat and stumbled across this bar/grill located inside the Planet Hollywood.  We were seated at our table and were surprised that the table had its own TV to watch the game on plus a plug/charging port for your devices. Our server Kole stopped by our table a couple of minutes after we sat down and immediately took our drink order.  I cannot emphasize enough how fast the service is here. We received our food about 15 minutes after ordering.  I ordered the Triple Turkey Club which was incredible. I have never had a sandwich with so much flavor. The turkey tasted as though it was just carved and it was so flavorful. I ordered fries with a side of cheese sauce. The cheese sauce was so creamy and flavorful as well.  My husband ordered the California Club and a side of Mac n' Cheese. He loved his dish as well. The portions are large, so we were really stuffed.  All in all this is a great little spot and I really enjoyed my food. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Sandwich
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TV set up at our table with charging port.
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close-up of sandwich.

y5_jSNAQJi_pimfHroimgw.text: I have mixed feelings writing this review. I work in customer service myself and I'm typically super understanding. That being said my boyfriend and I were set directly in the sun, no shade whatsoever and then waited. And waited. And waited some more. 15 minutes passed and finally a girl walked over, I asked for water and said I was ready to order.   About 15 minutes later, my boyfriend went to the restroom and when he came back, we still didn't have water, silverware, nothing. He went to the bar and ordered me a water and I finally waved down a lady and asked for the manager.   The manger informed me a lot of people called in sick and the waitress was working the patio alone. Ok, I understand. Things happen but maybe the manger could have waited some tables too? I will admit I don't know the situation going on with employees working or not but to wait almost 30 minutes for a glass of water is kind of frustrating.   The manager comp'd a beer for each of us and gave us bottles of water to go.  I do appreciate him acknowledging the unreasonable amount of time to get service and explaining the situation. It's not their fault they were short staffed because people called in sick but it could have been handled a bit better in my option.   The food was average at best. Nothing to write home about and we happened to stop in on what was hopefully an off day. I can't say I'd return to give them another shot though.

C2XPuhIDO8ipQQK2jsy-Ug.text: This place was good, nothing crazy. We stopped in for lunch and sat in the outdoor dining area. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  The food was good and overall a nice place to grab a quick bite.

Y2tE77RBujoxGdJLddVdhg.text: Stopped in here for a late night snack, it was dead but it seemed like it would be a fun atmosphere a littler earlier in the evening when more people are around. Friendly staff, nice decor, fun theme, and the food was good! Don't know that with everything vegas has to offer that I'd come here for a full meal but for drinks, and apps it's a great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gZUqqUtRGimanqxZxsm2mg.text: Great prices on food and bogo drinks!  The breakfast pizza was very good!  I would come back here for sure!

OLh6YeLxXccNN-BzbpyBZA.text: In Vegas food/ alcohol is more expensive compared to other cities. This is a decent place.  PBR has a plethora of seating options as one can sit near the bar or out on the patio in comfy couches. They do take reservations as customers were still getting tables reserved past 11pm. PBR also has live music, which can be loud and makes it difficult to have a conversation,but that's  a duh with any venue that has live bands. The service was slow that evening as it was difficult to get refills or order additional food/ alcohol. For my entree, I ordered the Baked Ziti which comes with bread. The portion size was decent, and the pasta was so-so. I also enjoyed an Angry Orchard Rose which is definitely a sweet drink.  One nice attribute is that several of the alcoholic beverages comes with a souvenir glass, just be sure to ask for a box. So overall a decent place, with a great location and is open in the early morning hours.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PBR sign Las Vegas outside Planet Hollywood
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Ziti with bread

2Xi7uu-PQEweYU4Q8AvLRg.text: I teetered between 3 and 4 stars primarily because this was between okay and 'hey this is pretty good'.  My husband liked it a lot so 4 it is.  We actually came for a late dinner one night walking back from the Luxor to Paris.  There was no wait to get into the restaurant (score in Vegas on a Friday night) but man was it loud with all the fun they were having in the bar area.  Service was really good and attentive and the menu had a lot of options.  I went with the grilled cheese/tomato bisque and the Hubs went with the steak & eggs (9.95 people).  I was pleasantly surprised at the prices here with everything being mostly overpriced on the strip these days.  The food was pretty good for this type of restaurant.  We came back on Sunday morning actually for breakfast/brunch before heading to the airport since Planet Hollywood is right next to Paris and it was a quick walk.  My husband went for the steak & eggs again, and I tried their breakfast pizza.  I would say the breakfast pizza was okay, and I should have gone with the classic breakfast (4.95).  The service was great again so we would definitely come back if only for the price point here and service, with decent food.
