-d4UOzKTWeaxiwIBleKUQw.text: I really like this restaurant and location. The food was great and drinks are nice. I recommend it but if you have a large group you have some confusion. It is great!!!

RZFz0m093NCUoC6IVkzXHA.text: Husband & I grabbed lunch here.  The wait was under 10 minutes & we were helped soon after we were seated.  There's tons of items on the menu to choose from, but once I saw the BLT with the option of adding a fried egg...umm, awesome!!!  I LOOOVE BLT's and I don't know why I never thought to put a fried egg on it.  Have you ever ate something so good that you go home and try to recreate it?  Well, this is one of those.    My husband ordered the fried chicken and waffles.  The plating of this was great.  Crisp, fried chicken wedged in between triangles of waffles.  The food is yummy, portion are big & the service was great.  I'd definitely come back here for that BLT whenever I'm in vegas.

8YSqqgsLqeLsWA6aJTca_g.text: Found this place by reading reviews on good restaurant preferably with country atmosphere/nice outdoor patio and this place nailed it! Huge patio right on the strip with outdoor heaters and fire pits! I was super happy we got a very nice table right next to the strip with a fire pit in the center! It was amazing. The food was delicious! I had the chicken nachos and most of our party head the steak and eggs! It was all great food and service. We had a blast and I'm so glad we came here!! Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fire pit table/ fun times! Take me back!!!!
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken nachos! Huge and delicious!

YAGBogVM-8nUtDTIMwxksA.text: We sat outside, me with my strawberry daiquiri and he with his Crown and soda.   It was 106 degrees outside in the sun at this point - at noonish - and he made friends with the bartender and a couple from Ohio. He's a lot more friendly than I am, so I just kind of hung by the side, drinking my very rum-filled slushie. It was good, too! Not too sweet, probably from the amount of alcohol.   I loved sitting outside, as it was right next to one of the many escalators, and people were very drunk from the heat and beers in hand.

dwif0YCfkT1goSpxrjgFGQ.text: Flight crew checked into the Elara Hotel, which is attached to the Miracle Mile where PBR Rockbar & Grill is located. Went to the Rockbar and sat at the bar. The bar staff was as helpful and friendly as one could hope for. I ordered the full rack of ribs. It definitely was a full rack. It had the most meat I have seen on a rack in a long time. Very tender and tasty ribs. Had the cole slaw with it, also good. Had a tall IPA to complete the meal. Overall, good dinner. Lots of TV's to watch sports too.

XFFloOImzMADuZWT91ffGw.text: Typical mass market crappy over ranch dressinged food. Had a taco pizza that weighed 4 pounds, a pound of which was Ranch dressing. I spilled it on my pants and I almost caught on fire. Jk but it was super gross.   Burgers were mediocre. Salad was bagged. To many choices in Vegas stay away from this one.

nRB4mCIlwq0d4Hl4RvKhtg.text: Nope.   In an attempt to maximize our time in the sun on our late fall trip, we wandered down to PBR Rock Bar's patio after the pool at our hotel had shaded over. Situated right on the Strip, we thought it'd be the perfect spot to people watch. Side Note: People watching in Las Vegas is everything you thought it would be. Bring eye drops because they will dry out from staring so hard.   Anyway, back to PBR. As I said, we sat outside where half the tables were full of pretty chill groups of older people having drinks and appetizers. Our waitress hated everyone. At least, she hated us and the people next to us, and the people next to those people, and the people in front of us. Yep that was everyone. Asking for menus and what brands of vodka was totally unacceptable. The scowls turned to full-on eyerolls when we wanted to order food with our drinks. How dare us. And when we asked to split the check? She nearly punched holes into the computer as she rang us up.   Everyone has a bad day, totally get it. But go punch a bag of flour in the kitchen and suck it up like everyone else. If your day is really THAT bad, stay home. You aren't doing yourself any favors or your tables by being the witch of Vegas. And you certainly aren't receiving any great tips either, ours was below average and came with a note explaining why we undertipped. Personally I can't bring myself to do that... but my dining companions sure could, and did.

MdO9pcQPmdsWnOYMaLjG9A.text: 4 stars for food, 2 stars for service.   Hostesses were absolutely rude, and refused to seat us on a Monday night, at 630, when there were about 10 open tables within view. "we have reservations,  but you can sit at the bar." I tried putting my name in for a table, and she literally rolled her eyes at me.  Bar tenders were nice, but service was painfully slow. Looks like it could be a fun spot on the weekends, but it fell a bit flat tonight. Buffalo fries were to die for.

2MQIcbhGeuj3-mH-AwdlUQ.text: This place could easily have 4+ stars if they had better service. The portions are really large and filling and great quality too. I ordered a steak salad. Steak was cooked and seasoned to perfection and the salad was enormous. The atmosphere is great, the facility is clean, the restaurant has a nice consistent theme, great seating both indoors and outside. Our server was nice but she rarely visited our table, took about 20 minutes to refill our water and get us some ranch for the salad, and basically disappeared after we got our food. After waiting for a while longer we actually had to go look for her to get our check. The other servers looked bored and uninterested. You'd be surprised how much more people would pay for good services!

4lDZ_u_1KG1BcD6cV6BnoQ.text: Overpriced and lacking....I had the chicken and waffles and while the presentation was good the chicken was really dry and the waffle was cold. My husband had the turkey club and coleslaw, coleslaw was not edible and the club was huge but that's about the only positive.

7fHdiSxCT8LJJxhV3RSM5A.text: This was the worst meal we had on our trip to Las Vegas. The service stunk and the food was mediocre. Our waiter forgot about us and we had to ask somebody else for our re-fills. Also a couple of orders were slightly messed up.  Plus one star for the sweet potato tots. You can do a lot better on the Strip.

jf6Xrit3TtYEVEffFgRyEw.text: The atmosphere here is AWESOME, the food is great and it came out SUPER fast. Military discount every day too. LOVE IT!!

WcR7P5DqaW7OAeNQ9OAHjg.text: We always stop in whenever we're in LV or staying at PH. Fun atmosphere, good portions of food and variety. Their breakfast is big enough to share.  Lots of drink specials and TVs to watch.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT

cZyCxfcn-iJTIeIvDUuvzg.text: Again I find myself in the most undesirable position of running a touch late in my scheduled evening activities, therefore I have become adept at food quickies.  During a busy 6:00PM Friday evening dinner rush, we were seated promptly and our server was quick to address our table, even though NFL wild card weekend was in full swing. Located in the middle of the strip next to Planet Hollywood this eatery had just what we were in need of, some quality noshing food, served up quickly.  What an asset to PBR Rock Bar, our server was.  Joe recommended just what this hungry trio needed with no up-sells, expedient in all facets of serving and with a sense of humor and a smile all servers could learn valuable lessons from. The Chicken Quesadilla had serious amounts of shredded/pulled chicken, pepper jack cheese and decoratively topped with sour cream and pico de gallo.  The House Green Salad was average and pricey for what we were served, so if you are going to go with some greens you may want to avoid that menu item.  The half order of the House Made Chili totally nailed it as one of our finicky and modest eaters did not come up for air from his cup. Another stellar recommendation, in that the cup was more than enough to satisfy in our servers opinion and he was spot on. For 4.95 you will be hard pressed to find a much more filling and hearty meal. (Thanks for offering a taste buddy, no I did not want to try it--sarcasm)  As a pizza traditionalist, I was not about to order a Buffalo Chicken Pizza, what happened to the old staples of meatball, sausage, anchovies, yet PBR does offer a pepperoni pizza. Well you can teach an old dog new tricks or serve him up a perfectly cooked, hand tossed dough with chunks of chicken, heap on the mozzarella and hit it with crumbled blue cheese.

iE3yMTGzv0rhjKMnn7L1Dg.text: We dined at PBR Rock Bar & Grill as part of a dinner and show package with Vegas! The Show. There were several choices for us on the fixed price menu and we both ended up choosing the pulled pork sandwich. I was originally going to try the chicken pasta dinner but our server said it is so super spicy that he always steers people away from it. I like a little spice but not too much so I appreciated that advice. He also let me know that the menu was outdated and the dessert choice of the warm chocolate chip cookie with ice cream was much smaller than before and only had one scoop of ice cream. That was fine and I was thankful for the heads up. The food was good but we were traveling and attending the show right after so we were not able to take our leftovers home. There were a couple of drawbacks to our experience. The music was super loud and we were not able to really talk to each other. The server attempted to get a second tip from us and we are generous tippers but we knew that the gratuity was included with our dinner and show package.

6WJkMw4zH8RaEfhqImVq6A.text: Food was delicious. Not enough BBQ  on my pulled pork. We went there because of the HUGE drinks on the menu. We ordered a $65 100oz marg, it tasted like all marg mix...too sugary, and we didn't feel drunk. Not worth the money.

uMrmUiaZmyod6nuav-shQA.text: There is a wonderful Country atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The food is great, but I cannot get over the amazing fries. Totally worth the price and I could not be more happy with this place. It is perfect for some great food!

EoMk0qN37-66sjft-w3qbQ.text: Service is good, a/c on the inside is acceptable, food comes out in timely manner..the burger is good, no great, but all washed down with a beer works out just fine on a 110 degree day.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xkTbfm45p0q0pFhlkQw3NQ.text: This review is only for breakfast: Hubs and I had breakfast here recently. We enjoyed it. Pretty standard fare, no complaints. The tater tots instead of country style or hashies is interesting, but for me, it's irrelevant since I always sub fruit for potatoes anyway. Hubs' came with a corn muffin that was good. My breakfast came with pancakes. When the waitress gave me several fruit options, I thought it was included so I chose strawberries, but fruit is extra, as seen on the bill. No matter. The strawberry pancakes were yummy, I likey. Laid back atmosphere, good service. Would definitely come back here for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggs, sausage, fruit instead of taters and strawberry pancakes
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VFbr1h7ol23CJmduM9tqCA.text: I registered just to post this review.  In my entire life I've never been treated like my friend and I were at this bar last night. I've been going to bars my entire adult life and I've never seen or heard of anything even close to this.   The bartender flew into an absolute rage at us for no reason. We were both calm and reasonable. I attempted to find out what we had done to offend him, but he refused to tell us and continued his rampage, throwing glasses and bottles into the trash behind the bar and stomping around. He was in a barely controlled rage for 15 minutes. He called my friend a crybaby for pointing out to me that the overhead mister was dripping onto the bar. He refused to believe me when I said that my friend and I had were having our first round and couldn't have complained about the dripping water more than once - not that either one of us were really bothered by it, and all my friend did was warn me about it. When I finally asked for my change because I refused to leave a tip for him - I left $20 for two $9 bud lights - he angrily threw my change on the bar and screamed, "Now beat it!" at us and we left.   I am completely baffled at what caused his tirade, but there is no excuse for it. I've never been treated like this in my entire life.  I have no other explanation other than the bartender has severe emotional problems. I would skip this place unless you enjoy being berated for no discernible reason.

CHeHemg_GkQFA8QBzuEUhg.text: Ok, so honestly I haven't eaten here. I actually walk up to their little outside bar and order me a frozen strawberry daiquiri. I've been here a few times now for the same thing and every time I come, the drink is amazing and has a good amount of alcohol in it. Of course I add an additional shot to mine for an extra kick but it's a pretty good drink. I'd say the size right below a yard is like $14 (somewhere around that). It's worth it.

vujaYW8FW9ClQ325mVAO-Q.text: Came here for lunch with a larger group. Service was mediocre. What was supposed to be a 1 hour gambling break turned into a 2 hour waiting game between food and the bill. Food was standard bar type food.

AtFANqJ-ouMnbEWcFmYNtw.text: This is a solid mix of fun and drinking. The best part is watching drunk people ride the bull

nUqRrdtfDHsIm18SteZLYQ.text: Food was ok..service was slow but they were busy due to NASCAR in town.  Had the bloomin onion dog...OMG when it came out it was huge.  A beer battered deep fried hot dog topped with crispy bacon and ranch WOW!  All in all an average meal.

qauyh2Dn0fxDDrPI2b5Hyw.text: The only reason I've come here is to walk away with a meter sized slushy drink. It tastes alright and if you add shots, which is a must, you will get drunk as shit. If you manage to drink the entire thing, or even half, you will most likely end up barfing too. The drink basically consists of syrup and alcohol. If you haven't experienced this in Vegas at least once, you are not really missing out.

471PLzheQ5vElzp97PlamQ.text: Walked in, sat at the bar, had a good salad (yep at a bar in a mall that is attached to a casino...) and generally liked everything about it! The Salad: leafy greens, the kind my mother would want me to eat, mixed with goat cheese and pecans. Seriously this is what I would find at a place in Santa Monica (where I'm from) and was stoked to be eating one At A Bar, In A Mall, that is Attached to a Casino.  Speaking of the Bar, it was fun to watch the seemingly Endless stream of people who would stop by (half of the bar fronts directly into the aforementioned Mall) and pick up one of the GIGANTIC drink boots or yard-longs, filled with various imbibements. Fun!

kOb88hG968Isp0pQ1EF20Q.text: Review is for the frozen bar.  Overpriced, even for Vegas. Not nearly as good as Fat Tuesday or Lime Ice.

QgS1Yl59bLTRErDgKjvjNg.text: Stopped here around midnight on a Tuesday with a group of four.  Sat outside which was enjoyable to see the sights and sounds of Vegas.  Ordered a PBR bucket which had 6 beers. Food was mediocre bar food.  I had a footling hotdog, the rest of the crew got burgers, all in all which were mediocre bar food.  Indoors they have a bull to ride, and often have live music playing.  Outdoors was not smoke-free which wasn't particularly enjoyable, but was expected.  Overall, not a bad place to just eat and drink with friends.

bwaK6S_ga62PIU4KwTY_pA.text: I mean it was alright service was OK the nachos were just alright. The prices are a little too high as well for the atmosphere

iZDreMevOcapo8FIbU91Aw.text: The line at the Wicked Spoon was too long so we headed over to the mall.  This was the first place that we saw.  As 3 starving hungover girls it satisfied us just fine.  I ordered the chicken fajitas which were surprisingly tasty.  The service was definitely slow and the sodas cost $4 a pop.

P565VpDvINyu0Rp6vPQRnA.text: I stopped into the PBR Rock Bar on Sunday late afternoon to catch a hockey game and a bite to eat before making the drive back to LA.  I got there around 5 and found a seat at the bar in front of a TV that was playing the local news.  The two bartenders basically ignored me for a good 5-7 minutes.  They both seemed pretty bored and miserable, but at least one of them was hustling, so I respected that at least.  When one finally came over, I asked if they would turn the game on, because I did not want to order anything if they could not.  She said 'sure let me find out'.  A few minutes later the other bartender noticed me, and asked if she could 'help me'.  I said that I was waiting to see if I would be able to get the hockey game on.  She replied with "no we can't do that."  I was up and out of my chair, and it is a good thing the manager showed up then to turn the game on for me, otherwise I was gone and this review would have been much worse.  The manager accommodated me, but also seemed like she did not want to be bothered.   The food was typical and pretty unmemorable.  I was debating between the buffalo chicken sandwich and the BBQ Cheddar Chicken Sandwich, so I asked the bartenders opinion (as usual), and she recommended the former, so I gave it a shot.  I had finally gotten her to lighten up and be a little friendly by this point by being the nice affable guy I am.  The sandwich consisted of frozen chicken dropped in a deep fryer and coated in buffalo sauce with toppings.  It arrived with the chicken half off of the bun with everything falling off of it.  It was not the most appetizing. I fixed it the best I could and some bites were pretty good with the crumbled bleu cheese nicely complimenting the buffalo sauce.  Mostly though, I was unimpressed.  The mechanical bull looked fun, but I was honestly a little turned off by the initial service and food.  The patio looked pretty cool though and I would return for drinks and to hang out there if people were staying at Planet Hollywood, but I would not go out of my way to come back.

48gUDdqQzUwjNcOyt4reGA.text: Came here for drinks one night. It was ladies night, so $1 drinks = PLUS!  I liked the ambience. It was fun watching drunk girls falling off the mechanical bull. LOL. The music was good. Very rock vibe, hence the name.  Came here again few days later for our last meal before heading to the airport. I had the pulled pork pizza. It was delicious but way too big for one person.   My boyfriend had the Fried pickle burger. I had a bite of his and liked it, but he wasnt crazy about it. Our waitress was extremely nice though [forgot her name, but a very tall blonde]. She brought him 2 kinds of BBQ sauce, both of which he wasnt crazy about though. [Hes a chef and very picky!] All in all, a good experience though! Plus it was located right at our hotel, Planet Hollywood.  I wanted one of those ridiculously obnoxious touristy guitar drinks, but they were very pricey! [I think $35-38] Instead I walked to the casino where I got free drinks. LOL

ee75TW9C8Ra8nFVU4wJxjg.text: I was in Vegas this weekend with a group of 9 girls for a bachelorette party. We stayed at Planet Hollywood and decided to hit up the PBR Rock Bar & Grill on our way out and to get our bride to be on their awesome mechanical bull.   We had a reservation and they seemed to not be able to find it, but got is up pretty quickly. The host were friendly, asked how our bachelorette party was going so far and were very helpful.   Once we were sat the next half hour SUCKED. I don't want my rant to be the firsxt thing you read so if you'd like to hear about our shitty server read about him at the end.   After 45 mins, barely getting our water, going to the manager 2 times already.....I go to the manager once more....I feel like a bitch but come on. The manager says he (Kim) and the other manager (Josh) will go ahead and take care of our table personally. By the time I get back to our table Josh is handing out our shots he said he wanted to compliment us. This got our mood going back in the right direction and our order was placed and we were on our way to an awesome dinner. The food was amazing, I had The Boss Salad, and the fried pickles and jalapeno poppers were great. The other girls loved their food as well. The managers both checked on us ever couple mins, filled waters, cleared plates, go utensils, and brought everything we needed. The manager Josh looked like Clark Kent and one of our girls even told him so, he took it with a chuckle but didn't open his shirt, so who knows, he might be! The bussers were very helpful along side the managers, and definitely saved the day!   Thanks Josh and Kim for making it up and turning a disaster around! Josh even brought us bull riding tickets and we got our bride up on that bull! If it hadn't been for the dick server, this would have gotten 5 stars. Loved the food, environment, host, bussers, bull, and of course the managers. Say hi to Josh and Kim if you go by and let them know you heard about them on Yelp.  The bad parts of dinner: Our server took a few mins to approach us, and said he'd get us a round of waters, while he was there a host came up saying they could hook us up for a better table outside. We said that sounded great and would wait to order our food until we got out there. We waited 10 mins, no water, busser came by with water and the server sent him away with our water saying we were moving. (maybe he didn't want to carry our water outside?) Waited 10 mins, no water. I mentioned it to our server again and jokingly said maybe we should be given shots since we've been waiting so long for water. Waited 10 more mins, still no water. I'm at this point thirsty and annoyed and all the girls are talking about how long it's been. I go to the host, ask for a manager, explain what's going on, and they said they'd tell the manager. We have a manager stop by, I explain what's going on, and he said he'd get us a round of shots.   We see the manager by the back talking to the server and look at us, so I know he's talking about us. Waited 10 more mins, still no water, and we haven't seen our server. We grab a busser and ask for water and have it within 2 mins. I go to the host stand again and this time a new manager is walking up and I explain our situation. I couldn't believe we had been there so long and had barely gotten our water. The manager says he'll take care of it and we see both managers then talking to the server. I think the servers name was Tony? Not sure he even told us. He then comes to our table, confronts us by starting with, "What's the problem here, I got you your water, I thought you were moving, it's not my fault". He then asks us if we want a new server and as everyone is just looking down because they can't believe we're being confronted, I blurt out a yes please and he turns around and storms away. This server is going to lose the restaurant business. How ballsy for him to confront his table like that.

NRLu0X9ChCUgsfJUtJrAOg.text: 2.0 Stars  PBR Rock Bar & Grill is located at the Miracle Mile Shops inside Planet Hollywood, directly on the Las Vegas Strip. My buddies and I originally wanted to check out Pink's Hot Dogs, but the line was way too long for us to wait. We decided to give PBR Rock Bar & Grill a try since there was no wait and we saw all the LCD screens on the walls. There must be more than 40+ screens spanning the whole establishment. That was pretty crazy.  For my order I tried the Memphis Style BBQ Pork sandwich that came with a sesame seed bun and fire crack coleslaw for $10. I was thinking about ordering the coleslaw as my side, but then I noticed it already came with it in my sandwich. I ended up picking Fries as my side. The other side selections available include:  Fries, Potato Salad, BBQ Baked Beans, or Fire Cracker Coleslaw   The sandwich was very mediocre. The bun was not even toasted and it got soggy fast from the coleslaw. The pork was not flavored very well and was pretty bland. Half way through eating my meal I had to just eat the pork and coleslaw filling because the bun was just that unappetizing.  I might have just picked the wrong dish at PBR, but my friends said their dishes were also 'eh, so-so'.  I think I'll only come back to PBR to try riding their mechanical bull, not their food.

W5eJ24GC01dJHhxSQTD3Vg.text: A great menu!  Friendly service, classic Rock music that I grew up with, too many big screens to count followed by hugely portioned good food....yes it gets my "two thumbs up".

l82IQWoq-gtMwhB4JB968Q.text: I brought some out of town friends here. I had never been before and the atmosphere look fun so we tried it. The look is cool and they had comfortable chairs. The menu seemed over priced. I sprung the extra $2 for the Doritos mac and cheese. It was good but for the extra money a bigger portion was expected. I ordered the chili cheese burger. I was never asked how I wanted it cooked. It came out VERY over done. My friend ordered the veggie burger and got a portabella mushroom sandwich instead, We asked the waitress about it. She looked puzzled and said "You don't like it?" she told her it was good but not what she ordered the waitress continued to say that she heard her order this. I couldn't believe it the waitress was arguing when it was clearly her mistake. I won't be back.

2ldBulNOrdwue4xla6h3rg.text: A friend and I have been here today since 5pm to watch the Martinez vs Cotto fight, since they were advertising it for free we thought it would be fun to go out and watch the fight (we normally order PPV at home). When we arrived around 5pm we asked where te fight would be showing inside or outside the bar, and the two staff members at the entry said both inside and out, we asked if we needed to seat ourselves or if they seated us they told us to help ourselves, but let us know there are no tables and there is only standing room. When we walked inside they were playing hockey on every single tv except the small 20" one in the corner by the entrance. All but 4 tables were full and the four open tables had reservation signs on them. So we walked back to the front and asked if we could reserve a table for the fight and they said they are not taking reservations, I asked why they have reserved tables then and they said people reserved those online, and suggested us grab a table as it opened up. About 30-40min later two spots at the bar opened up and there was a tv screen displaying Martinez vs Cotto on the picture and we asked the bartender when they were going to turn on the fight, the bartender said she didn't know and would ask, about 10 minutes later she comes back and says they are ably playing the fight inside, irritated we go and ask the guy who originally told us it was playing both inside and out and he said due to us having the fight for free and the high demand of people asking they have decided to charge people to enter to watch the fight and it's only playing inside. We were like okay so now we have to go try to find a spot inside? I asked if we. Plus pay to reserve a table and he said no they are not doing that just making people pay to walk in and stand. We went back inside and searched for a table, all of them were full except for the reserved ones in the middle of the bar. We wended up making friends and sharing a table, they were here to watch hockey and planned on leaving when it was over. We orders fries and a Caesar chicken wrap, both were absolutely disgusting. The fries were soggy nearly dripping in grease and the wraps had mostly lettuce and the small amount of chicken was soggy as well. Our waitress was very nice, busy with so many people in the bar. I had to ask several times for someone to turn the fight on at least one of the TVs near me, After about 2 1/2 hrs at our table enjoying our new friends and watching the prelims of the fight another waitress walks up and asks one of the people at our table if they were here to watch the fight or just hockey and that she was just wondering the guy let her know he was here for the hockey. I looked over and said I bet they are gonna try to give away our table after the hockey game! everyone at the table laughed. Literally like 15 minutes later another waitress walks up and is trying to put a reserved sign in the middle of our table, I said wait a minute, we are hear to watch the fight? She said we would have to leave because someone reserved the table. I then started getting mad! I was like NO I've been here since 5PM trying to get a table and some service so we can sit and watch the fight I told her I tried paying for a table hours ago and you guys said your not taking reservations! She the. Went and got the girl who asked one of the guys at the table if he were just watching hockey or the fight and I looked at her and said, you asked him not us! We have been here for hours. She then began to argue with me about speaking up next time if we were planning to watch the fight! I told her that she specifically said she was just wondering not that she had planned on giving our table away!! She just took the reserved sign off out table and walked away, didn't even apologize or anything.. I would say the food is gross, and over priced for the quality of food. this place is poorly managed, every single staff member said something different about what was going on several times and they probably shouldn't have False advertisement outside the bar about showing a PPV fight for free if they were charging people and kicking people out who didn't pay for a table to watch the fight. I will not be returning as a local not will I suggest any friends to go to this sports bar!!!

ySnRtGpwjXDs3MFpRatJww.text: Ate here twice the last time we were out. On friday our flight got into town in between lunch and dinner.  We ordered beers and split a burger and it was around $20.00.  The burger was plenty big and pre split into two portions with two portions of fries....most places wont do this for you.  shortly after we ordered jalepeno corn bread was brought out to our table which was a nice little snack.  All of the wait staff were friendly and would stop to check if we needed anything.  it was a bit loud, but what bar isnt.    The sunday afternoon when we ate there it was busier than Friday afternoon.  I would assume because of the games on tv.  Although it was busier it didnt show with the service.  The service was just as good as the slower day.  I was impressed!

j7Bx8m-OjdWUGa4bmGtAcQ.text: This place is full of shit. It was 4 of us in a group, and they give us the smallest table in the place. It was so small that we had to put menus that stayed on the table on the floor so we could have a spot to eat at. I asked the hostess for the booth and she said that it was for the larger parties. I'm looking like what the fuck are we.  I ordered the whole BBQ rib fries and onion rings. When they put the rib on the table, I could not believe that this rib was white!!!!!  White as if they had but it in a pot and boiled it! It didn't look like it was bbq at all. I got the manager, and he said it looked like that because he ran out of hickory wood chips.!!!!! I guess he thought we couldn't tell the difference between a BBQ rib and a one that was boiled. Then after all that complaining, we look over and that empty booth was being occupied by..... You guessed it, a party of 4! Well I guess if we would of been any blacker, we would had to eat by the dumpster...... I sat in disbelief to see a waiter walk buy with.......... Ooooohhhhh yeah, you guessed it. A BBQ rib that was cooked the right way. You know, that wasn't boiled and didn't gave the same complexion as Michael Jackson. That rib the waiter had look just the the picture on the menu. I can not believe the service here at this place. I just wanted to take my wife  on a decent place for b-day. Fuck this shit hole!! If I could give this place no stars I would. The hostess, and manager can take that one star that they sure as hell don't deserve and stick it up their ass till it reach the back of their teeth. Fuck off!

7YK2UAjgU6v3UZXAYvAdTQ.text: Sometimes in life, you just have to punch yourself in the nuts.    And the PBR Rock Bar & Grill is a great place for that.  You see, they have a large bar inside and a decent sized bar outside.  Happy Hour provides good drinking for cheap. (for Vegas)  Then, when it starts raining and you go inside, and the girls you're failing so miserably to pick up sit at the counter ouside of the mechanical bull, you HAVE to ride the thing to impress them.  I've ridden one before...in khakis and boxers.  Big mistake.  Anyway, you basically just get to junk punch yourself over and over until you have the worst sideache ever, or you actually fall off.  I fell off after two junk punches.  But then something funny happened.  Two shots and two beers later, I magically could feel my testicles again, and felt I needed to show off for the two girls one last time.  Plus, my friend got there and said he needed video of me junk punching myself since he wasn't there the first time.  So, back on it and this time I said, "Take the pain!  Take the pain!"  And I did...for far too long, until I got 360'd at a very high rate of speed and flew 20 feet.  I'm not sure if the girls were impressed, (doubt it) but my friend bought me a drink.  The end.

tajK_ewTV15dIO7HNTGgkA.text: Horrible service.  We asked for split bills at the beginning ...they couldn't do it?!?!? Been here twice first time drinks took about 15-20 minutes when we were about the only people there.  Second time food came fast just management and staff are clueless.  Place to avoid.

DeZu-VX_4tuRCsVi6LvqVA.text: So, we heard live music from the 80's and decided to try it. Food was tasty but our waitress Jen did not seem to want to serve us. Before I could finish telling her I needed ketchup, salt or oregano, she left the table. Not good service at all.

44yhEX7pnZ34tU94LZ0msw.text: Kenley was the bomb.com Completely genuine and runs the show like pro. 100% recommend this place

e9SIc9uUjxBT9yBWtzUF5Q.text: Had the brisket burrito and substituted spinach for the potatoes.  Both burrito and spinach were fantastic.

bl2nibA4bsUuq5ZBH1feLw.text: Excellent service excellent drinks. Had the porch ponder and it will mess you up! The food is really good and you get a free bull ride with whatever you order. Can't pass that up!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hSx9QGCe2XposOGVDA6GNQ.text: FOOD & DRINKS GREAT! Happy hour menu was great, we got the chili cheese fries today and they were really really delicious. They also do the free drink on the Cityzen app, which is always awesome.   SERVICE NOT SO MUCH! I would give 5 stars, however, the bar stuff was not busy at all and it was like pulling teeth to get them to serve us.

O1thlZX5peFUOAxtEc9wBQ.text: This place has good food. We had nachos and the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup, it was super bomb. They had live country music which was good, it added a fun atmosphere to the bar. I'm rating this place a 1 star because they OVERCHARGED ME $30. I've been called and they keep telling me corporate will call me, so I called corporate because it's almost been a month. It goes to voicemail all the time..  I ordered those two things with two drinks. My total came out to $43.00. I tipped $7. So it would be $50. Well a couple days later when I'm leaving I'm checking my account and I realize that they charged me a flat $80! If they were to just give me back $30, I would've never made his huge complaint. So if you eat there, PAY CASH!

99DXP1vjj4rzil8H8P4IFQ.text: Excellent place for drink and food  Good for group and family  Excellent drinks  Bloody Mary delicious

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DdXsAxMjdwQrHAbzRex1qA.text: Me and 6 other iron stomached men ate dinner here as part of a dinner + show package, so our meals were prefixed. 3 out 7 had explosive diarrhea. 1 vomited. The other 3 i worry about the most, because 7 of 7 of us should have taken a trip to the ER after attempting to eat what was possibly the worst meal I have ever had at a restaurant. Stay away from this place unless you like peeing out of your butt.

W3Ap5rncfreOYf2mLveLqg.text: Had the "country's biggest burger". It was pretty good. We had the Mac n cheese balls for our appetizer. Was not impressed with that at all. We also had one of their 100 oz cocktails. Really good but would recommend at least 4 people to finish it (in the restaurant). Our waitress was kind enough to give us a ladle and a couple to go containers for what we didn't finish. I would come back again but just wasn't thrilled with the food. They do give you a free mechanical bull ride with your food if you're into that

1lonDsMT6Pn0Iw-qJEM_JQ.text: I got the brisket dip sandwich and the bread was rock hard. My water cup stayed empty and never filled. They did have a huge pretzel with beer cheese that I am so happy I ordered for an appetizer since my sandwich was not edible.

gO0mLg1rc3-fhZfO-btY2Q.text: Best breakfast on the strip! Incredible and attentive staff. Won't eat breakfast anywhere else now that I've found it!

orMGZw9xGg3iULwQo6qCdw.text: My wife and I ordered tickets for a show and they came with a meal from the PBR restaurant. We were hesitant but like to try new places. We tried the chicken chipotle pasta and it was DELICIOUS! Spicy and full of flavor. Cole our waiter was friendly and our food was served fast. Tea tasted fresh brewed. We will come here every time we are on Vegas. A must try if you are in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FFrh92euVu4eugzT730tXg.text: Real fast service. Food did not come out hot but it was delicious so I didn't send back. They will give out a free personalized post card if you opt for a free photo! Must get the Mac n cheese balls!! Overall, decent priced comfort meals.

9iY673B-mayfCHNU7Hx0uA.text: I stopped here with my bridesmaids because the lines at the other restaurants were too long. The food we ordered was good, I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup combo. One friend had the quesadilla, which was huge! We are that for about 3 days. My friends has the California chicken sandwich which they liked. However, one for found a long black hair in her guac, which was pretty gross. The staff seemed truly apologetic and our waiter was great about everything. She was given a new sandwich, and it was taken off her bill. Hopefully this was a one time incident, because the staff was really nice and the food tasted good.   The restaurant itself is pretty dark with lots of screens to watch sporting events. There is a separate section of the bar with a mechanical bull. It was lots of fun watching people ride the bull.

LSAYU1YmFxR8u12RZ_rW3w.text: Interesting place. Very busy. Had the smoked brisket dip. Was more like pot roast. A little disappointed, but it's ok. It is Vegas and I'll walk it off and search for the next good meal if one exists in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked brisket with chips

yTlCXL9sbYFPCaS1NnHapw.text: Candy was the best server ever. So glad we decided to have brunch here. Food was good service was better.  Thanks so much Candy!!!!!

6qwZG5IYKw92kVz2Zdb-Sg.text: Had a great time here! Customer service is fantastic and the food is great. Reasonably priced and great atmosphere!! Mike the manager is the best!!!!!!! Definitely recommend.

CWs1tXrYURdahNRn2WUnIA.text: Food was good, music so loud it was hard to hear what my date was saying, and our server was super nice. I just gotta say, though, don't seem so surprised when I show you my Yelp check-in deal (Buy 1 Get 1 free drink). I mean, for a second there I wondered if maybe I'd checked into the wrong bar, and seeing as we were in Vegas, walking into unexpected places is totally a possibility. Thankfully, our server was cool and did eventually give us the deal. That breakfast served all day was legit! Gotta love that late night white chocolate/raspberry french toast! Nice selection of food overall and the fries and patty melt my husband ordered were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White chocolate &amp; raspberry french toast -- breakfast all day!
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patty melt up close
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patty melt with fries

a8SBeNhmbUMfoAaZ-BGobA.text: I was on vacation from Sept 9-14 and ate brunch every day at the PBR. We were served promptly by Corianna and Jay, and the eggs and steak were exactly as I ordered. The food was delivered quickly and was hot . The prices were reasonable for the food. All I can say is the service is great, the food is good and the prices will not break your wallet. This is the second vacation in the last 2 years to Vegas and I always eat at this restaurant.

tMXuE5zhTr7wn11W7bbZSw.text: The hostess who seated me and my friends was very friendly and welcoming. After ten minutes we got water. Then for the next 20 minutes we were on our own. Ended up leaving and eating somewhere else. A shame as I've heard good things about the burgers and have been dying to try one. Hunger won out today. Had to leave and eat.

dchmoC8rXcFL8heFw6kDSA.text: Stopped by here for breakfast... It is right outside miracle mile shops next to planet Hollywood... We were seated right away. The food came out quickly, tasted good, and was reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YvUpuCQqUI-FjSLu3gqrTw.text: Great spot to try if in or around planet Hollywood. I highly recommend going for breakfast as the prices are unbeatable for anywhere on the strip. The service was good, nothing special and nothing to complain about. You can also get breakfast all day which is different. I tried the potato skins as an appetizer and I wasn't impressed. This is your casual, regular bar restaurant but with decent pricing compared to most places you'll find on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lndeZso0jXR9r6A8MNVAIQ.text: This place really sucks.  Service was terrible, food was meh.  I guess when you have a captive guest base at the hotel you don't really have to try all that hard.    Will not be back.

WM3vl1dE6Mj2fE-DEIZC9A.text: Visiting Las Vegas for a few days and came down to the PBR they have an awesome delicious breakfast it's right by Planet Hollywood and the prices are very reasonable. Just found out George Straight will be here today and were from Texas what a Surprise! Back to the PBR it is a very good place FYI.Also great waitress Kristal.  Jesse V.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Breakfast Classic.

TABq6IEFtKps1RsMKb-bbQ.text: Currently drunk. So that's good.  However, my sandwich was dry AF. No sauce on it whatsoever. Kinda disappointing because the live band and the atmosphere is great.

bp4Bg-et77K_gxGM49L9bg.text: Fried pickles , and fried tomatoes were fried perfectly with this amazing sauce . Kids had nachos which they enjoyed , on ordered Brisket sandwich which was huge the size of foot long. Kid stated the brisket was a lil dry ,but gravy was given to wet it up . Overall satisfied with my meal

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rf9melTQupvCEuDv8IE7Zg.text: This place is insane but I keep coming back so it's insane in a good way. The first time I went I ventured in here because me and my friends watched a touristy Facebook video showcasing their huge drinks. Said drinks are expensive but not even three great drinkers can finish them. It tastes like a fishbowl but it certainly looks like an aquarium. One time we got together with a group that couldn't finish theirs so we tried to help each other out because after drinking that logic makes complete sense. The staff here must see it all because not only do they have drinks, but they have a mechanical bull and every purchase you make here gets you a free ride on the bull. How fun! Keep your receipts as riding on the bull gets more fun as the night progresses. Also usually someone is handing out cards with happy hour specials for this place. Take it because something there's even a discount. Me and my friends make a habit of visiting this place every time we're in Vegas.

G8tw0LPiSX4H8z2_O9PXcw.text: We went at 1030pm the place only had two other tables it was the worst slow service! We asked for ranch and he didn't get it to us until we were done with our food.  Not going back.

SyfzKyhFTldp9DiDWS4b1w.text: This bar is kinda exactly what you'd expect when you imagine a typical Las Vegas bar.   The food is good, nothing out-of-this-world, but good nonetheless.   If I had to make a recommendation, go for the drinks. Being right on the strip, PBR is a good place to grab a drink to walk around with. We split a fishbowl drink and they offered to put them in to-go cups for us.   Overall: good starting spot to get some food and start drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TzHO1-DyFz2IX0XU82YkdQ.text: Our server was very Nonchalant! Cute but not enthusiastic about taking orders, maybe because it's the end of the night. The wings came out cold and not appetizing. The nachos are not your ordinary dish of nachos, taste great but if your looking for a big plate don't order the appetizers!! Upon requesting a manager he was escorted to our table by  S E C U R I T Y!   Over priced bar food.

1mR78l_d5d8XLy_YaPd9qg.text: Our server christalyn was great! Very friendly and good at her job.   Negatives: -the men's bathroom had no toilet paper or soap -the bartender was sitting on top of the bar yelling at the people bull riding to shut up

zKWCpJbiHbr4xowPWmuPFA.text: I had NO INTENTION of eating here, until someone handed me a 2 for 1 drink coupon.  It also helped that I could see my favorite soccer team (L.A. Galaxy) was playing on a few of the televisions.   Overall, this is a decent place.  I sat at the bar and enjoyed the numerous televisions, along with the friend conversation of the other patrons.  The atmosphere is fun and raucous!  What would one expect from a place that has a mechanical bull.  You will find that the vast majority of the crowd is tourists.      PBR has an array of seating options, sit at the bar, at one of the high top tables, or out on the patio on the comfy couches.  FYI, they take reservations, but as a party of 1 it didn't really matter.   Another benefit is that PBR has live music, which can be loud and makes it difficult to have a conversation with your table, but again, I was solo so I had no issues.  It only interfered with me calling out for another beer.      The service was a tad slow, seemed like the barkeep was the only guy working in the area, plus he was filling drinks for all the dinner tables, so he was busy.   For my entree, I ordered the brisket dip with sweet potato fries, it was excellent, and plenty filling.  I also enjoyed two Stone IPA beers, one of my favorites, which they have on tap and they come nice and cold.    Overall this is a decent place with plenty of craziness going on, just don't expect the service to be too fast.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of televisions throughout, what you are looking for is sure to be on somewhere. I watched Zoltan score 3 goals in the LA Galaxy win!
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar requires patience, it can get quite busy.
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The brisket dip with sweet fries

4bM3VFGI7Wf4TYdFd4Wf5w.text: An awesome awesome spot! Music and ambience are great! Our Bartenders Aaron & Kseniya were the best! This is a must stop!!!

aav8x_kA9wvjUz_w3TQ4Sg.text: This place gets 5-Stars for a well-prepared, fair-priced traditional-type breakfast and great service.  A great feature is that on a very hot summer morning, they had outdoor seating in a shaded area that was comfortably cool and offering a good view.  If you're as far away as the Aria it's only a 10-minute walk.

MB8jR8MqClcx-ObMPCzDXA.text: Honestly, the live music was playing blink 182 and my friend and I were drawn in for some quick drinks. Had it not been for the music we might have kept walking.  Waitress was pleasant. Drinks were good. Apparently it is cheaper to get shots in the light up shot glasses than just regular shots. (Strange, but hey I now have a lightup shot glass.)   I was a bit disappointed that they were out of two things I wanted, raspberry for their raspberry mojito and something else I can't quite remember.   Although service was slow, it was a fun atmosphere and seemed to have a good crowd. Random couples slow dancing to rock music, fancy artists and everything in between. I'd probably be back, the shots were good and the drinks they had ingredients for were decent.   (Birthday cake shot, and the shot with crown. Vegas vacation drink was good. My friend got regular beer and whiskey drinks and had no complaints.)

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoot me shots (birthday cake and something with tequila...)

toy9zrEZ2n5uRWvsMwwXZQ.text: This place was one of my favorite bars/restaurants to visit while in Vegas! They have mechanical bull riding too and the music was great! Everyone was soo friendly, customers and the bartenders!! I don't think i ordered any actual food, me and 2 of my girlfriends could barely finish our drinks! Sugar factory has nothing on these drinks!! I had a great time! Definitely a great place to stop by at when you're in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

URh7QREDpf72m8WCS2K8gw.text: Good afternoon world.  I would like to tell you about the worse dining experience of our 10 days in Las Vegas. To be fair I will start with the high points. The manager responded quickly, the hostess was polite and the fried pickles were amazing. That about covers what has gone right with this visit. Now for the bad news.  The first table that our party of six were pleased at was broken unstable and was supposed to be out or service says the manager. "They are not supposed to use that table and they know it."  Once we were placed at a more sturdy  table  orders were taken.  Order 1) Fried pickles (amazing) PBR Burger made to order. So far so good.  Order 2) Jerked Burger cooked to order. Good job Order 3) PBR Burger cooked to order with a side of mac & cheese ( not sure which box that was made in but I am sure if it were served hot it would have tasted better. Order 4) PBR Burger med rare ( cooked to hockey puck status.) Order 5) Jerked burger cooked to order with cold sweet potato fries. Yuck Order 6) Cowboy Steak $33 Ribeye. With carmelized onions portabella mushrooms garlic mashed potatoes sweet corn and a side fresh fruit. Round one of this one was almost recognizable no onions mushrooms the corn was on the cob the garlic mash was cold. Here is where it gets good. I own a restaurant and the table was full of service industry personnel. We were just going to deal. Then the server started talking. As the food was being placed we corrected who ordered what. Quote from server. Misstep1: Take it easy lady I got this. !?! Misstep2: As he handed the plate his thumb was on touching the food. Misstep3: As he attempts reach over the plate of guest 4 she asked him not to his quote "I wash my hands like 45 times a day." After we spoke to the manager the majority of the items were fixed. I feel bad for the manager she had to visit multiple tables with similar issues. At the end of this argues meal there is the opportunity to ride the bull in the resturant. We attempted do just that and were told only one ride per reciept. Di I mention 6 Orders. I would not I repeat would not  recommend this place to anyone for anr reason.

hd4grH9GEL6euWQ0R2jjvA.text: The drinks were great , especially their signature drink "Its Vegas B****". The food wasn't all that great . Seems like their bbq should've been the only thing I should've eaten , not their burgers. The burger was dry, not hot and the bun was hard .. it was a no for me lol

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best place ever !!! The drinks are to die for and this menu !! OMG

ReouK6MnaytjA2kW6zuxLg.text: PBR is near our hotel, and we walked past a few times. We even went in and watched a few people ride the bull one afternoon. One night we were hungry for a late night meal and didn't want to go far. We started with an appetizer of the bull shrimp, but I can't remember anything that stood out about it. I had the pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese, and my friend had the smoked brisket dip sandwich. Both were good but not great or outstanding. Same for the mac and cheese. I used my check in on Yelp for the BOGO drink. The drinks were good, but when I went to the bar to get them, the bartender was brusque when explaining which drinks I could order with my check in offer.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked brisket dip with a side of Mac and cheese
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bull shrimp
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese

gRP2TEGH9OZ5WhBH20dzRQ.text: I came here because I bought a Groupon over 2 years ago and did not use it.  Me & hub were greeted promptly & the hostess was nice. She wanted to sit us in the middle of the dining room but we opted for the booth with a tv.  Also they have an outlet and USB ports if u need to charge your phone.  Smart idea guys!!!  I coincidentally brought mine since I was at 47%.  The server Thomas was prompt, cool, on point.  Ask for him.  We placed order.  I took his recommendation on ordering the 10 wings which they were delish.  U won't be disappointed.  The sweet potato fries were superb plus the cole slaw.  He took my Groupon with no issue.  No wonder we gave him 22% tip.  His service and the food was great.  Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Condiments
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another snapshot of spot
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lighting

E9b4xjTzoiTMUeh0DcBVog.text: I can never knock a place that caters to the ladies... Rock Bar makes sure that the gals get their share of free entries and drinks! During my visit in July, the DJ was pretty consistent and played a great variety of Hip Hop and Pop Thursday thru Saturday. It's a great place to stop before or after leaving the PH Casinos. The only drawback is that drinks are measured depending on which bar you go to and can be pretty pricey at times. Ladies should always check them out on Thursday for ladies night where the well drinks are $1!

PDbOh_k2NO41pq1PhMtGBw.text: This place was great and different.  The service was great no lines or waiting time...our waitress was funny and nice.  Me, my fiancee, sister in law, and friend ate here.  This place is a little bit on the expensive side but it's well worth.  I had a bacon cheeseburger with fries and I love it...the appetizers we had was deviled eggs and some type of fries that had onions...buffalo sauce...and cheese which was really good...the only con about this place is that the drink I had was not strong at all...but I would most definitely come here again...

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Cheeseburger and fries were so good
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Fiancee&#39;s Chicken N Waffles
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These style of Fries is so delish!!!

szCHcelm9XGH1S0FklWi0w.text: Being from Texas and married to a huge PBR fan, we had to stop here. We were seated quickly for lunch, which was nice since most places had a wait. We were greeted promptly and had wonderful service.  Our food was good, I definitely recommend the chili tater tots.   Food and drinks were fairly priced for Vegas. Check in on Yelp! and receive a free alcoholic beverage.

EjlYZZPSvNTv7rpWsxg5vQ.text: The drinks are cold and yummy! The food was really just ok! The place was not lively at all. My drinks were messed up but they were quickly fixed. Spend your money at a different place!

AkLJ7bE7XBO8maZBuKsL8w.text: Our server, Jonathan, was awesome! Very quick and efficient! Also reminded me to use my total rewards card to save some $$! He definitely went above and beyond for our group. Will be bake again!

kwRdiXldpwL-0lv3EtKdYA.text: Tried to take in a party of six for drinks and some snacks. Waiter took the order and after a 20 minute wait, another waitress came by. She wouldn't serve us as we hadn't immediately ordered food. Told her we'd already ordered the beers and she became really rude and told us we must leave the table.  We left and I will never return. They need a better attitude and some customer service training.

DQBMvP0qjbZymn0y5VL-fw.text: The hostess seemed like she did not wanna be there, but the bartender was really upbeat and sweet. She made a bomb gin & tonic, and there was a nice little band playing some awesome covers. However, the music was way too loud to have a conversation. It was a little dead, but it was a Monday night so that part makes sense.

fUbZTh8RKHLWJu0Zrtg_Wg.text: Best option on this side of the strip to sit outside and watch a game.  NFL Sunday ticket.  Tons of tvs outside.  Can't speak to the food, but the beers were fine and the bartenders were responsive to my TV channel requests (super important on football Sunday).  They serve breakfast, which looked like it would be good.  One thing is that the beer prices made very little sense - $7 for a Coors Lite but $6 for an Angry Orchard?  Whatever, I had no problem with Angry Orchard drafts but the pricing is a bit odd.

RoM9qMcy9amb4dgWcsKemA.text: If you're looking for a sports bar to watch a game, this is NOT the place!  After being told a game would be displayed on a tv after being seated, the staff struggled for 40 minutes to change the channel to the right broadcast.  They had a young lady finally come out into the 2nd quarter and announce if there are any other issues from this section?  eye roll?  Really????  Inflated drink and food prices for no game and attitude?  Manager, Crissy Compton, came out and supported this 100% and informed us these she had a whole restaurant to deal with and these were promotional screens....not sure what that meant, but will definitely never return.

48sBf4PQ7jJ6K9hI3AAV3g.text: Good quality food, good quality pricing and service. Much better than BWW around the corner.

RvZH9RmMtLn0L0-fQUdoJA.text: Definitely what I expected from a sports bar...lots of TVs...all showing March Madness. They have a bull riding station and beer pong for all the beer drinking, rodeo studs out there. All this makes for a somewhat raucous atmosphere.  The food was really tasty. I highly recommend the penny butter and Jelly wings as well as the spicy cheese wings for appetizers. I promise you won't be disappointed.   I had the Jalepeno burger and Cheryl had the pulled pork sandwich. There was so much pulled pork on that sandwich that she took half of it back to the room.   They have a ton of drink specials as well. Too many to go in to details.

izS0ymhDCP9WgeJxZclmsw.text: I had a mini vacation in Vegas and tried this place out. Not to bad. The wait wasn't that long. They have the motorized bull there and tons on TVs to watch sports. Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tri tip pizza!!!!!
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon cheeseburger!
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast all day!!!

mhzEld84JrYFoyEHujeMmQ.text: This place was so fun. Love the atmosphere, and  loved the bucking bull fries we got. We also got a giant Margarita bowl to split between 4 of us. It wasn't very strong and waayyy to sugary but it was fun. Service was great as well. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qw76jBIq2ZdwQM-CEu5ZgQ.text: This place is just inside the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. My friends and I were walking by on Saturday night when a club promoter stopped us and gave my friend and I free entry to their club and a buy one/get one drink coupon. So we said why not, let the guys walk off, and went inside.  The club part is this little squared off section partitioned from the actual restaurant by sound proof black walls, but they're technically connected. And while the restaurant has all the trappings of a country bar (with a mechanical bull and country music playing) the club side is GHETTO. I'd feel safer at a dive bar just off the strip than in there. It's loud and gross, cups and garbage everywhere and there's not a lot of space. Most of the dance floor is taken up by a metal cage you can dance in, but there were mostly drunk girls barely hanging on to the poles and twerking to crappy music. It was nothing even decent to dance to.  3 beer pong tables are squished across from the club's bar. Nobody regulates them and I'm pretty sure nobody has cleaned the tables or cups in days. The bar itself.o .. I have NEVER had such bad service. Two female bartenders (wearing just a bra I might add) were talking sh*t and goofing off, not paying attention to customers. My friend and I sat there for more than 5 minutes waiting for service while nobody else was even at the bar... I'M SERIOUS. I practically had to wave my credit card in their faces, and finally they deigned to look at me.  So I showed the girl our drink coupons (buy one/get one for well drinks or beers on tap) and asked for whiskey. She grabs Crown Royal off the top shelf and starts pouring without asking!!!  Crown. Royal. When clearly the drink coupon is for well, and I didn't ask for any name brand. I had to yell at her to stop and give me a well brand, and she got pissed and threw the Crown away and then poured me a 1/4 shot of whiskey and charged me $7 for it.  1/4 shot. For $7. After trying to scam me for Crown Royal.  After that we just wandered over to the restaurant bar and sat there for another round, but were wholly disappointed. Never again!

NwIGP13Pf-0l5x8oAUlMMA.text: If you like top 90's country music with the decor to boot then this is a great place to eat! Live events, bar, bull rides, outside dining, foot long hot dogs, and custom cocktails in cups the size of punch bowls (no not joking and its $65) had a nice service experience; friendly and considerate staff. I recommend the Taco Salad as an appetizer. Personally ordered the PBR Burger and was not disappointed. 2 mojitos, 2 burgers, and a taco salad for a total of $40, not bad for right on the Vegas strip. If you're craving BBQ style food in Sin City then this is a place worth trying. Yeeha!

qRMabFI8PXgXH_lGBFm1iQ.text: This place has a cool location. We sat outside at the fire table for breakfast. I only got an egg and toast but my boyfriend liked the BLT and the bloody Mary's were delicious! and the drinks were buy one get one free with yelp check in!
