4n5PevZn4OCdTHzoll-BAg.text: My girlfriends and I have gone here 3 times and all 3 times we have had such an amazing time! We got seated right away, the servers are super nice and become your friend the first conversation!:]  I love every moment of it the restaurant!  There pina colada is so delicious!!!

K6bF32lMimjvXkvzJ__AGA.text: This is my last day in vegas and my girlfriend left this am so was feeling weird going out solo but everyone here was soo nice. I used to be a bartender so I'm aware of certain things. And everything about all 3 bartenders I interacted withs  attitude and demeanor was on point.

opp1O7lQGFz_AhWmjyQjGQ.text: We were in town and simply wanted to order Wings-to-go so we could get sloppy not in a public forum also FOOTBALL and we didn't want to be excessively rowdy in the bar.  We approached the waitress at the main restaurant and said we wished to get an order of wings to go. She said we could do that through the nearby Daiquiri Bar. What kind of restaurant doesn't allow the hostesses to place orders to go?! Ridiculous.  We sauntered down to the bar (a mere 5 feet away) and placed our order. When the server (Alisha H.) handed me my receipt, I asked about my change and she said that they don't give change and she assumed the dollar I'd mistakenly overpaid was a tip.  I'm not sure what kind of policies the PBR Rock Bar has implemented when the staff is stealing your money to get tips-- This is the direct reason for the one-star rating.  I've also e-mailed their GM and I've received no response yet in 24 hours. Honestly, with the treatment we received, I'm not expecting a response.  Wings were ok. Overpriced but ok.  Will definitely be going elsewhere when we return to Vegas.

x-1SxrHuPKGYrhoGXESKhw.text: Thank you to Crissy Compton operations manager at RockBar & grill for making this SF Giants fan a happy camper. Even though it was Football fun day Sunday she made sure I was able to watch my STRUGGLING SF GAINTS team play today. What awesome service all the way around!!!!

BodNLhvhqhovpKcS7w51Kg.text: Only had drinks here and they were decent & somehwat cheap.  They have a mechanical bull you can ride.  But be careful!  A friend fell off wrong & ended up breaking her ankle. Not the establishment's fault, just know you sign that waiver in 15 places for a reason.  I didn't try any of the food, so I can't rate it.

YkQl7yHxjs4ZLNe81ustHw.text: Was pleasanly greeted by the host when we entered. We asked to sit at the bar because we only wanted drinks and apps. The bar had only four other customers and we sat for almost ten minutes with not a single staff member coming by and saying hello. Both of the bartnders made eye contact with us and one even walked by. They apparently did not want our business so we left.

7EHNS20ab0tKi1ezh6HDlw.text: Walked into the bar and were seated at one of the high top tables. Ordered a couple of drinks. The waiter asked if we wanted to order food, I said not right now. He left and who I believe was a manager came up to us and told us we had to leave or go to the bar. I asked why and she said that if we wanted to sit at the table we need to order food. No one told us this before being seated and the bar was over half empty! The waiter returned with a $25 bill for 2 drinks that we had only taken a sip out of. I can understand having a policy like that if the bar was full and it was a busy time, but you need to make your patrons aware of it before they are seated. With a bar over half empty it just doesn't make sense.

hw_0R8lkFsrGyPbjeueqpg.text: The worse meal and service I have ever had in Vegas .... Yuck beware of the food I came here with a group of friends about 11pm at night and it sucked ( excuse my French). First we had to move to the bar in order to get any kind of service and second the place was completely empty and we had to literally scream HEY !!!! Well after ordering tatter tots and grilled chesses the basic American meal, never received a drink. When i received my food my tatter tots were cold and hard as a rock and my grilled chesses was cold and no longer chesses which was disgusting... How can you go wrong with grilled cheese!!!!! This place was horrible doesn't make it any better that the bartender disappeared and had to wait for ever for the bill..... The place was disgusting, my parties meal wasn't any better but ill let them complain on there own YELP page.

JxKJs3YT3GagCsB44P1lvQ.text: Came here on college night we showed our IDs and it was $10for open bar from 10-12 it was great. Music as good. If u aren't ordering food they ask u to stay only at the bar and not sit at their tables. So they do need more room for people looking for to drink only. The also have a mechanical bull which was pretty fun.

bmkBqLRGvSBrkv86Efvebw.text: Wow, busy place!  Lots of bar space, good place to hang out and drink. Drew is the best bartender!!

xWCUiVqKuCKa55InNYXoQg.text: Outstanding burgers. I ordered a western burger, I think, and they brought me a blue cheese burger. Whatever. I ate it and didn't say anything, but it pissed me off a little. I like the outside patio. It was great weather for it. Overall, it's nothing special, but they make a great burger (it's big, so you can split it with someone rather than ordering two).

Qqf0TkkGYYm0ok-ZkukujQ.text: Where do I start...HOT ladies,great prices on beer,great atmosphere. I didn't eat here though so can't really give more of an opinion on the food and service side of things. The bartenders were spot on and took care of me and kept a friendly conversation going. I'll come back for food next time.

ITtUeQB8TGMOweyk5cXOxA.text: We were staying at PH and needed a place to eat. BBQ Potato Chip Nachos is a huge dish and can be shared by 2-3 people. Be careful because it's spicy. Hat Bender is a refreshing drink (I love watermelon) and I hear their open bar is worth it. Save your bill for a free bull ride.

iIvOVrqf6H3NzuRPOaP75A.text: Good albeit expensive drinks BUT the gorgeous Asian bartender was awesome!

kOyNXrMQJsTtzTP61XubvA.text: Amazing. I love this place.. We loved it so much we ate here twice while in Vegas for 4 days. The chicken wings are amazing. The salads are a amzing the drinks.. amazing.. the bull..amazing ha ha ha.. Great atmosphere and the male waiters are pretty cool and very hospitable.. however the female waitreses even the hostess.. were rude. We were excited to get a male waiter when our waitress went on break. I will def be back when I am in Vegas.

G_kddUAmvtsEyNWTrB2igw.text: I'd like to give this place two stars based on my first experience with this place but alas you are only as good as your last encounter PBR Rock Bar.  I know you can do better as you have!  The original time I went here was a year ago for my Sister's 21st bday.  We sat in the outside patio area and had a blast!  The waitress was awesome, drink specials were decent and the atmosphere was great.  So when we were in Vegas for 4th of July weekend this year, again celebrating a 21st bday this time for my cousin, we were super excited to go back here.  It was a Sunday and they had all these advertisements for something like $10 all you can drink from 9pm-1am.  As it was almost 9pm we asked one of the hype women standing out front of the outside bar that was yelling about the special.   (I call them hype women as I don't think they were waitresses and they didn't know enough information to be a hostess.) They said yes come back at 9pm and for $10 we could drink until 1am.  PERFECT!  So we came back around 915pm and grabbed a seat at the outdoor bar.  Once we sat down the waitress came up and we inquired about the special.  This is where it went downhill, FAST!  She told us that the special wasn't for the outside bar it was only for inside.  Umm OK?!  So we went inside and asked the snotty hostess there about it.  She said she had no clue what were talking about to which we pointed to the sign right next to her stating the special.  She pointed us down the hall and said to ask down there.  We walked a few feet to another entrance.  Upon entering this rundown, hole-in-the-wall looking area we saw an empty bar to our right and a couple beer pong tables to our left and another bar behind them.  There was an employee moving tables and cleaning floors and then a few couples playing beer pong - no one else.  A waitress finally walked up to us to see if we needed help and we again brought up the promotion, which we found was Twitter driven so you had to become their Twitter fan in order to partake.  Side note here: I have done this type of promotion in Vegas before and they ALWAYS SUCK!  You will get every line in the book about why you aren't applicable - "we ran out," "We served all we can on that promotion," " where did you see that at?" etc, etc - it's only to get you in the door and they figure since you are there you will spend money!  Ok back to the terrible service at PBR - so the waitress gets the GM/Promoter of this special to help us.  This guy walks up to us doesn't introduce himself and is as cold as can be.  He asks what we need and we AGAIN repeat why we are there.  He asks if we all have a Twitter and we say yes and that we understand the promotion.  Then he looks to my cousin who is wearing a tank top and asks if he has another shirt to put on.  Now keep in mind it's July, in Vegas, and 120 degrees outside.  No my cousin says to him and the guys says Oh well then we can't serve you.  We inquire about the three guys playing beer pong ALL in tank tops and he says that they aren't here for that promotion.  WTF?! What do you have to wear a suit now to a rinky dink, drab bar in order to pay $10 to drink all  you want of their watered down well drinks?!  That was the last straw - we left all quite irritated.  If he didn't want to make the $50 he could have off of us and if he wanted to lessen the servers/bartenders tip money that night so be it.  If he is the person running this place I honestly want to have nothing to do with it.  Word of mouth travels fast and I've already recommended a few good places (AHEM Peppermill) to friends on their way to Vegas this Summer and rest assured PBR Rock Bar is NOT one of them.

7nypkKaI0OVEG8OzBR_qNQ.text: I came in this past Thursday with a few of my girlfriends and had a blast. We came in after partying pretty hard and wanted some greasy food. This is the place to go we were told and boy were they right. The mechanical bull really was exciting. Our server was Joshua P. He was really great with drink suggestions and food selections. We had a picky eater in or group and he helped find just the right thing for her. He was really on top of refills and we had fun chatting with him. He's one of the best servers I've ever had and I would definitely recommend him as a server to anyone considering eating here. Thanks!!

TY9iZq0gxCuqJIRfDb9Z0g.text: I 've worked here for a year now,and finally ate there with my family!  This place really serves the best ribs I've had! It seems like your in the down south when youre in here ,really nice atmosphere,  wife and kids definitely want to go back again!   It could be a family thing in the day and a friends thing at nite!  would recomend it!!!!!

v8HdYTwVGfOMwJjcRcY2vg.text: Food was good, but my medium burger was well done (which is probably okay since I'm prego, but still, not how I ordered it). The fried pickles with the cajun ramulaud were awsome though and the Turkey Avocado sandwich I had the second time we ate there was really good!

tp4dBbXd82Q7-7IrfOMWTA.text: I wish I could give this place 0 stars. So many problems, no redeeming qualities. I'll do it in list form. 1. We put our name down with a group of 12, they gave us a buzzer and told us 30 min. When we came back after 20 min to check on the status of our table they said oops, someone came up and said they were you so we gave your table away. Our buzzer didn't even go off. We didn't want to wait any longer so we split into 2 groups. 2. One girl in our group had celiac (gluten intolerant) so she asked the waitress if a menu item was gluten free. The waitress didn't know so my friend asked if she could check with the cook, and she said she would. My friend forgot to double check that she had asked the cook, but the waitress clearly did not check, and my friend was in bed with a horrible stomach ache all day long. 3. I ordered grits (because that's what I like when I'm hung over) which were $3, I asked for cheese on top. The cheese on top was an additional $3. $3 for cheese??? That's f&%king ridiculous. 4. Out of 6 people at our table, the waitress forgot to put in 2 of the orders. How do you forget 1/3 of the orders?? So they came out like 20 min after the others. Granted, we weren't charged for them but by that time we just wanted to get the hell out. 5. No one liked their meals that much, food was just blah. Go to earl of sandwich across the way, sandwiches are better and your expectations for service are lower so you aren't disappointed.

d0ID_bETXOxfPCAqPvSchw.text: I was hanging around the planet hollywood sportsbook watching the basketball game I had money and I was getting real hungry and decided to stop at pbr rockbar to eat as Im always walking past it but never stop in. All the waitresses are hanging around by the entrance trying to get people to come in which is kind of annoying. It was dead as it was only 4pm, but I just wanted to go sit at the bar, eat, drink, and watch the game. As I was just walking towards the entrance a waitress asked if I wanted to come in and eat, I said yeah that I was just going to the bar, she says no you're sitting at my table in my section, as she was kinda cute I got guilted in and said ok. She sat me at the table right next to the entrance which was more annoying as it was further away from any tvs. I told her I wanted to watch the game so she had the manager change the closest tv to that game, which the tv was far away and I couldnt really see it anyways. The waitress was very friendly as she made several recommendations and was very upbeat and energized. I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich with no blue cheese, and of course when it came out it had blue cheese on it, which I cant stand. But I just picked it off. Waitress came by to see if everything came out the way I asked and I told her it came with blue cheese on it and she asked if I wanted to return it to the kitchen and have them remake it, I said no its not that big of a deal as I can just scrape it off. It was a monster piece of chicken, part of which was just bad meat which I was immediately disgusted by, it was served on a brown wheat type bun which is strange and tasted like shit. This place seems like a cool place to drink and party as it has a college bar atmosphere which I like, but as far as the food (atleast that day or maybe just what I ordered) was not very good.

yna0rdEKoc3z1Tvjr7sSzQ.text: Place was decent priced and extremely great tasting. The burger was cooked perfectly. The fries were bomb. Waitress was cute hehe. Next time I go there I'm definitely hitting up that place. It's a lot cheaper than most places in Vegas.

WZ6emMlrVT6e6F0wgB0EdQ.text: Sat outside.  Unique space heaters.  Food was OK, servings plentiful.  Waitstaff pleasant.

6QhHz13oAC8YRWcDWU1k-A.text: I didn't go in expecting a lot but I ended up really liking this place. The best parts were the young crowd and the location right on the strip. If you eat outside, you are right there and can see all the action which can be very entertaining. I had no complaints about the food or the service. They of course had a mechanical bull and it was fun to watch people attempting to ride it. My favorite part though, had to be the beer pong tables that you could play on. You could buy a pitcher of beer and play right there in the restaurant. No need of trying to find a way to play in your hotel room. Overall, it was a great way to start off a night in Vegas.

oTkelgqUHJw9Cm4JPz8-Vw.text: If it is not happy hour stay away. My $10 Captain and Coke was all ice and weak.  I told the bar tender and she said it was a good pour.  Weak drink weak attitude.

SG8ifzv_dxyXB9jcuDKyAA.text: we were here for xmas week on family vacation. stopped in for brunch on the patio our 1st morning....loved it. ended up back for xmas dinner and also amazing. service was slow at some points, but we chalked that up to holiday rush...everyone on staff was really helpful i, house and suggesting other items for us to see on our trip. great place and great food to match!

3yFY79b3XP6Y27MnKpTN4A.text: Sunday nights open bar for 10 bucks! Good times!

7lZaTsBwQb2JuKtxBPYRDw.text: Food was amazing. The atmosphere was really good if you want to do something a little different then the normal Vegas place. The Bbq burger is delicious

6d_gXsB2QcqEcL7Z0C38iQ.text: Good food when you're drunk. I had their garden salad with chicken and it was bomb. The only downside is that it's tooooo loud inside!

Qs2ZwHQ_BDZgex7z_ogMEw.text: I have mixed reviews here.  I loved the potato skins and the Hat Bender was DELICIOUS!  I also tried the peach cobbler to my great disappointment.  The bartenders and servers we had inside were all very nice and friendly.  The service outside however was lacking.  We sat outside 3 different times and every time the staff was inattentive (each time we actually had to ask for our server to be sent to us).  The music was too loud but the bull-riding was cool.

TcY-gZ9GXqHD5wKv4C9ALQ.text: This place actually exceeded my expectations.  I give the food 4 stars - good selection, moderately priced for the strip, good portions and tastey.  I had the grilled PB&J with bananas.  Elvis would be proud.  The service unfortunately gets only 1 star.  Be prepared to wait, wait, and wait some more for the servers.  Get a table where you can see the mechanical bull to pass the waiting time.  It was especially entertaining when plus sized members of bachelorette parties rode the bull.  Oh yeah, it's loud as hell in there.

2wfTRXK6hPgeEcUho2CyNA.text: DO NOT GO IN THIS PLACE!!! I made a yelp account just to write this review for this horrid place.  I never knew I could get the WORST POSSIBLE SERVICE EVER, especially in Las Vegas.   If you're thinking bout eating in here, TURN AROUND and go to Pinks just outside or Lobster me next to fat tuesday.  I ate here with my friends Friday 2/10/12 for breakfast and we were sure in for a treat. We got seated right away and asked for orange juices all around. 5 minutes later someone comes to take our order: 2 Classic Breakfasts, Sausage Biscuits, Bucket of Wings, Steak & Eggs, and Breakfast Skins (Potato Skins). Waiter comes back with waters all around, still no orange juice. 15 min later.. Bucket of wings come out; pretty good, not the best but still somewhat satisfying. (Still no orange juice)  20 minutes have gone by no orange juice and still no food at our table. We're getting restless and impatient. Since no one bothered to ask us for refills we asked one of the waiters passing by to see if our food was ready. Another 5 minutes later, our food has arrived.   Classic breakfast - Eggs were cold. Not hot. Not warm. Cold. Tater tots cold. Bacon was the only thing even close to warm.  Sausage biscuits - You can tell by the look of congealed formation of skin on the gravy on the biscuits that it was only possible to achieve this look from sitting around too long. Not to mention that the biscuits were getting harder by the second. Hopefully they think twice before putting their biscuits in the microwave.   Breakfast skins - Looks nice. No sour cream?? Potato skins were not even baked long enough, no crisp whatsoever.   Steak & Eggs - Asked for medium rare, came out well done.  After all our food was delivered, we had to ask for our orange juices. We couldn't even finish our food because of the low quality of food and service. I don't understand how you can eat at a restaurant and not even get asked "how's everything tasting?" "would you like refills?" "everything come out ok?" not once.   After we asked for the check the busboy had was cleaning the table, literally everything while we were still sitting down. Picking up silverware, napkins, dishes, and even wiping it down while we were trying to pay. Couldn't it have waited till after we left?   I would never come back to this God-forsaken place. Worst quality of food. Worst possible customer service. Worst lack of integrity for a restaurant.   Save yourself the time and eat at pinks 2 min away or lobster me down the walkway, you won't regret it.

St_Z69IG464SUCxk9uw0WQ.text: Great place to drink and have fun. Especially with such a great bartender like chuck! The food was great the drinks were even better. Thanks Chuck for making it such a geat night.

0miWN1m4CP2RirplW049xQ.text: The food here was perfectly good, no complaints there, but I think our waitress got pissed off that we didn't want any alcohol with dinner (we'd had quite a bit in the room beforehand) and therefore proceeded to ignore us for the remainder of our stay there. We pretty much were served by random different people for the rest of the meal. Which was fine, they were all nice, but it doesn't equal quality service.

-ipqAKeyEEKJQL0au88uEA.text: Arrived in Vegas at 11am and was starving. Got to my hotel (PH) and met up with my friend for breakfast. We went to this place since it served breakfast all day and was conveniently located. We ordered our food and awaited what we thought to be a great breakfast. Oh were we wrong. First off, I had a basic breakfast with eggs, bacon, toast and tater tots. The eggs were decent at best,nit sure if they were real eggs. The bacon had no flavor whatsoever and the tots were fried to a crisp. I had to eat them with my hands since I tried to use my fork and a few almost flew off my plate. Toast was the only thing on my plate that was good. I was starving so I ate most of it. My friend only touched his plate. When I told him to hurry and eat so we can start drinking he said the same exact thing I did. He ordered the Lumber Jack Scrambler and it had no taste whatsoever. Everything on his plate was bland as well with the exception of toast. Not much of a complainer but this pissed me off. Not off to a great start.

sb6WwiHVFAxkhi08GkQw9w.text: Let me just start by saying it's pretty tough for me to give a one star review, because I always find something I like about a place, whether it be pretty waitresses, or the fries were nice and crunchy, or the price was low enough to make it seem reasonable.  I seem to be an optimist when it comes to dining out and going to new places when I review them.  However, this place can s*** it. Horrible service was the number 1 factor, pretty crappy food in my opinion, and they sat us outside on a saturday at lunch when it was over 100 degrees already. The shade sails they have set up don't even cover up the two big tables they have out there.   The scene: Bachelor party, 10 guys, needing some comfort food after a night of drinking into the wee hours of the morning..... Earl of Sandwich just across the hall was our #1 choice, but the line was about 60-70 people long down the hall. Our first clue this place sucked was the fact there was no line, when across the hall the line was over an hour long. DUH to me, my mistake. We sat down, and it took about 15 minutes to even be noticed by a server, and the place was NOT AT ALL busy. We ordered a bunch of waters, and a couple bloody mary's. 15 minutes later, we still didn't have anything to drink. Finally we went up to the bartender and asked for our waters. Then, we all ordered our food, which included a few burgers, a half rack of ribs, a steak and egg breakfast burrito, a couple club sandwiches, and a pepperoni pizza. 20 minutes later we finally got some food out to us, they cleared the trays and took off. Guess what, they didn't have the pepperoni pizza on the tray. The runners took off without asking if we had everything, and if we needed anything else (like ketchup, hot sauce, more water, etc)  So, we all realize that our boy didn't get his pizza. 5 minutes later the server came back and we brought to her attention the pizza didn't come out. She went to check on it and we saw her punching buttons on her screen, then start walking back to us, thinking she was gonna tell us it was on the way, or that she forgot to put it in the system......but nothing, she didnt' even stop by to say sorry or that it would be out in a few minutes. She just walked right on by our table to help somebody else. Now we're really starting to get pissed!!! How rude!!! What kind of service is that????  10 minutes go by and we're pretty much all done eating our food, and still no pizza. The pizza orderer said screw this and went to the server and told her not to bring it out, cancel the order, and that he doesn't even want it anymore, and to take it off the bill.   The service was horrendous when it was even there in the room, the food was way below average (the burger had no flavor and the potato salad was not cold or tasty, and I was told the fries were soft and not cooked well), especially for the price, and the drinks were expensive, even for being on the strip at a casual restaurant (why do you think we didn't order drinks at a bachelor party???) 1 star, wish I could give it less won't be coming back

nI63aDU7JMyxX6jYR5x_tA.text: I had a couple of classic margaritas here with some appetizers.  Buffalo wings and mini corndogs.  The margaritas were the most expensive feature on the tab but as good as they were, 3 cups ran me $24.  I might as well have went with the yard at $40. :)  Anywhere you sit, it is quite loud and ambient with music.  Save your receipt and you can get two beers for $8 and a ride on the bull.  Sit outdoors and soak in the afternoon sun!  Mind you, keep in mind that service can be at certain times slow, which can be expected.

wKXTH8O-Z081BPDdmxNm3g.text: I love this place, any time I'm leaving a club with friends or just wanna get a drink I come here. If you like mango drinks try the Coral Crush I believe it's called, soooo damn good. It's like drinking a mango alcoholic slushi.

6fHxAkPDcOTGvYsWYo2zvw.text: If you are desperate for something, this place suffices... but don't expect anything out of their alcohol. Ridiculously overpriced and ridiculously diluted with other crap. If you're in Vegas, you wanna have fun!!! But PBR doesn't really set you up for fun as they charge you an arm and a leg for drinks that don't really have much alchy in them. I paid $17 for drinks and I wasn't even close to being buzzed -- I never came back here and told my friends to stay away from this place as well. This place is pretty average, nothing spectacular or special but nothing completely awful either. Two stars for me : /

xR5d_TJmV0N4x6cqmR7N-g.text: A group of us went there for my sisters bachelorette party on our last night in Vegas. The bull was the last stop on our pub crawl, and we were having a great time....until we went to leave. The "operations manager" (at least that was the card he gave us) Dean Torres, approached my sister and accused her of defacing the table where we were sitting. Apparently while we went inside to ride the bull, some jerk had written awful things on the table where we were sitting. Not only was Dean visibly angry and shaking, but he was ridiculously aggressive and confrontational. With all 5 of us girls being in the industry, and not being A-holes, we would never had done what we were being accused of. Even if we had written on the table, Deans reaction was absolutely unacceptable and not even close to how a good manager would respond. Not only were we berated by this guy, and found to be innocent, we NEVER received an apology. ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?! We stood around waiting for him to "check the tapes" so he would apologize to my sister, the bride, whose last night was RUINED by this punk, and never received squat. They didn't even comp our meal, which was the LEAST he should have done. Dean even taunted us to "go right ahead and write his boss David". I've never been treated with such disregard in my life. Not only will I never return to the PBR Bar, but I (along with the other girls) will make sure everyone we talk to about Las Vegas knows to steer clear of this poorly managed, bachelorette party ruining, dump.

gIKK7RHOBht6DLnviJchgA.text: Horrible customer service! This place was awful!! Our group of 4 decided to come to this bar to ride the bull.  We bought four drinks, sat on the edge of the bull riding ring, and when we attempted to ride we were told we needed to buy a drink or we would have to pay for the ride.  Fair enough but we each had a drink in hand and were told no, we needed proof (receipt).  We went back to the bar to ask if they could print a receipt and they did, but when we attempted to ride the bull, the woman operating it was SO RUDE and told us we would still owe her money.  What?! We called the manager over and he said, well how do we know you didn't bring the drinks into the bar from outside?  You think we brought in glass cups full of beer from outside when your staff just printed us a receipt?  It was the weirdest customer service experience and the woman operating the bull was just horribly rude and unwelcoming!! I would never go back.

PMGy6FatLS_-PkoxUEdq-w.text: A surprisingly nice place for lunch seeing that I just stumbled upon it on a recent trip to Las Vegas. To be honest, the only reason I darkened their door in the first place was that the nearby "Earl of Sandwich" line was about a quarter mile long and I was starving. My companion and I headed in and bee-lined for the large comfortable bar area where we were immediately greeted by one of the many very attractive bartenders who work here. Drinks came immediately and we received only light-hearted ribbing for ordering sodas instead of cocktails or beer. Hey, I know it's Vegas, but at 11:30am, I'm still trying to regroup from the previous night's activities that concluded just hours earlier. Anyhoo, we ordered the buffalo chicken pizza and (I believe) a country chicken salad served as a wrap. The food came out quickly and astounded us both in presentation, flavor and sheer portion size. I guess a restaurant with a "Professional Bull Riding" theme needs to serve a hearty entree and they certainly delivered. We left very full and very satisfied. In fact, when it came time for brunch the next day, we found ourselves right back at the bar at PBR. This time I ordered a breakfast omelette that featured beef brisket among a savory medley of cheese, onions, peppers and potatoes. This thing was the size of a newborn, I swear. I stuffed myself and made it through just over half of the thing. So good, though. My dining companion ordered the country chicken salad wrap AGAIN and loved it for a second day straight.  In summary, great food, excellent service and an entertaining time chatting it up with the bartenders and watching women take turns riding the nearby mechanical bull. Certainly an unexpected gem in Las Vegas!

EHniTm7Bo7_HbnJYl8NflA.text: Pretty normal place...not that lively when I went there for lunch.  Food was standard.  My Sierra Nevada Pale ale was skunked.  Had to send it back, but got a replacement pretty quickly.

6G1MT5kDxln7R57XyAOTLg.text: My review would be a one-star if this wasn't on the strip.  I get it, it's tough to find cheaper food options on the strip.  (When I mean cheaper, I mean their entrees here are roughly around 11-15$)  But, even given the handicap, it's still pretty poopy.  My group had a bad experience with a server but all the other times I've came, the bartenders have been pleasant.  Decent sized Shock Top for 9 dollars... I'll take it.  (Again- it's the strip, I'm compromising)  Their patio is right on Vegas blvd across from the Cosmo, so that's a redeeming quality.  In general I think Planet Hollywood has some of the weakest restaurants/beers on the Strip.  Miracle Mile is the only reason I go there.  I'd say if you're at Planet Hollywood and you want to drink beers on the patio and eat below-average bar food then give it a go.  Or if you're into the whole obnoxious loud sorta-country bull-riding ambiance.  Other than that there's cheaper food and drinks elsewhere.

GM2EFJe0abihQVT-HWyc2A.text: PBR is right on the strip not far from Hard Rock!  It's pretty spacious and serve Las Vegas style Mexican and even my Chicken Quesadilla was not bad. Of course, not authentic by any means, but in the Las Vegas Strip standards, this will do. They do offer a BOGO (Buy One Get One) with your first order of any drinks but here's the catch.... you have to flag the nice lady wearing the shorts with the booties to give you one of those special cards!!  Hahaha....   Overall, great experience and the staff are super friendly!  Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

HpKWUL027Vx-gXLf4VW3lg.text: Its a restaurant on the strip so let me get one thing out of the way, it's quite expensive.  I ordered the chicken and waffles... and let me say, it was INCREDIBLE!!  A large Belgian waffle topped with flakey, boneless, fried chicken covered in syrup and bacon bits. If your mouth isn't watering from that description, you need to get off Yelp to go try it! Xp8K6VRGzefiJLj_nOTDJA.text: Bad Service and Bad Food.  I've been here twice. The first time I went was about a year ago. I ordered the chicken which tasted cheaper than supermarket chicken, and the service was bad. So, a week ago I decided to give it another try, and once again the food was bad and the service was worse. I ordered a burger which turned out to be very dry. They quickly brought it out and left. The burger didn't even have any sauce on it. I asked one of their guys who brought out the food about it, and he just quickly said that our server is supposed to supply condiments. So, we waited for our server but ended up having to just go find condiments ourselves. Later when the server actually popped up to quickly ask us if everything was fine, I asked if it was part of standard procedure to get a dry burger and then have to go on a hunt for mayonnaise or ketchup. He just said sorry but didn't seem to care. Don't go here.

ZCaKyG3rruHLQpiFFn46Fw.text: An ok eat on the strip. You will get better service if you are a group of drunk guys as the wait staff clearly flirt with them to get bigger tips. the food was ok but nothing I would go out of my way for. The sandwich my bf got was so crazy big that we could have shared it. half of it was bigger than my burger.  the fries were good and the cocktails were strong. id go back for a drink and maybe a bull ride. the food was ok but it would be more about a drink than the food to get me back there.

kh_k1DF6CfBU2NtE1G98JQ.text: Last Friday (8/23), my friend and I had taken a visit to this restaurant.  I was really excited to come to this place because I had been aware of the amazing, alcoholic, fish bowl beverages that they serve.  When we arrived we got in right away and sat a high top table near the patio.  Our server, Kole, was very nice and accommodating.  The service was very good and quick!  We ordered the "Wild Thing" porch pounder, which was delicious.  For food, I had ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich with fries and my friend ordered the triple turkey club with fries.  The sandwiches were really tasty, but the quality of the fries was poor.  They were hard and tasteless.  Towards the end of our visit, Kole did not ask if we wanted dessert or anything else, but rather just placed the check on our table and  told us "there is no rush, whenever you're ready."  A few minutes went by and a hostess walked by our table and asked if we had eaten our food yet, which was really strange.  We told the hostess yes we ate already, then she said good and walked away. Eventually, we noticed that hostesses and servers around us started to bring tables together and were talking about a larger partying needing to be sat.  My friend and I then realized we were being rushed out of the restaurant, but weren't being directly told that.  I found this was extremely rude and so we paid our tab and went outside to the bar at the patio.  A nice bartender named Aaron...I believe, began to serve us and we didn't have further issues from this point.  I wouldn't necessarily recommend this place if you're visiting Vegas, as there are far better restaurants to try on the strip, especially after the service my friend and I received.  It is too bad that this experience ended the way it did, as I was excited to try it out at first.  But if you do end up coming to this place, try their porch pounder beverages and not necessarily their food items!

U7bDIa48-13iYifPCKyqoA.text: This place is very loud, but has great clarity of sound, varying between piped in country and rock music.  Large and colorful flat screens are in abundance, mostly showing professional sports action.  And there are two bucking bulls: a gilded, decorative one, and a no-nonsense mechanical bull that diners can ride once for free.  I soon learned that some of the loud noise is due to the high volume of the music, but another component is the vocal cheering of onlookers encouraging amateur bull riders.  And the two riders I saw (one man and one woman) got tossed out of the saddle eventually, but looked pretty skilled and experienced at bull riding until then.  The operator of the mechanical bull starts a rider off very slow and smooth but the bull's movements become unpredictable soon enough, and it is difficult for anyone to remain indefinitely fixed in the saddle.   Regarding the food, I enjoyed very good Chili made of a lot of beef, Kidney Beans, and cheese ladled inside a bread bowl; and a good Pulled Pork Sandwich with a little bit of Coleslaw and sweet BBQ sauce encased inside a cold, highly polished plain bun.  There were a few burnt crisp ends but the Pulled Pork was mostly tender, and extra requested BBQ sauce nicely moistened the sandwich.  The real standouts though were my choice of homemade Potato Salad as an included side, and Diane's selected French Fries.  The Potato Salad contained egg whites and celery; and Diane's Fries were long, thin, and wiggly.  The two starches were equally excellent.  Diane's Cheeseburger came out ultra-rare initially.  But, after I pointed this out to our server, a new medium-rare Cheeseburger as ordered was quickly supplied, without any fuss.  Diane said she liked the replacement.  Service was not very friendly at first, but our server seemed to warm up to us as the night wore on.  We had to ask for Iced Tea and water refills.  But, in all fairness, in the capacious dining room each server had many diners to attend to.  And even after midnight this rocking and fun place was not lacking for customers.     XXX-1.2 stars overall on this particular night.

3rRy31ktvQD7ARCrCrICGQ.text: PBR Rock Bar and Grill is the perfect place to watch football. There are a crazy amount of TVs, and several of the booths even have their own so you can watch any game you want. They also offer gameday specials, including $5 Laguintas 16-ounce drafts and $25 beer buckets. Food is decently priced for the strip as well. A killer omelette was only $8, and came with potatoes and toast. Highly recommend PBR on gamedays, but be prepared to wait a bit for a seat!

R7WmAc7ul-ImPnOZi_JGjg.text: PBR bucked us off and we probably won't get back on.  There's not much about PBR that would bring us back. The food was mediocre bar food and all of our meals, from the salmon to brisket, was over cooked and dry. The jambalaya was very basic nothing special... there is far better jambalaya right down the strip.  Perhaps the worst part of the experience was at our table.  We sat at a high table with a gas fire pit in the middle. The pigs that sat there before us used the fire pit as an ash tray and left a bunch of cigarette butts in it... freakin' nasty!  I understand you can't stop people from being pigs, but this should have been cleaned up before we were seated. The lone bright spot was our server... she was attentive, engaging and cute.    I think they lure you in with the 2 for 1 drink coupons and the rest is disappointing.  There are far too many better options on the strip to settle for mediocrity.

RrGz-zDJFG4RtMIPPM9G2g.text: First thing that attracts you is the huge drink on the menu. After going through the menu items (and prices) it sounds like a great deal on the strip. The server was super nice and patient (took forever to make up our minds) so she really was what saved the review. We ordered the brisket breakfast burrito and the tomato bisque with grilled cheese sandwich. The burrito really lacked flavor. The brisket was not seasoned well and didn't even look like brisket. The tomato bisque soup was the only thing that tasted good because the grilled cheese sandwich was just ok. The cheese was average and hadn't completely melted. I would recommend for the alcoholic drinks, but not the food.

I didn't eat here but I did have shots and ride the bull. The shots were good quality and a nice size. Riding the bull was pretty fun. You have to hold on with one hand and hold it a certain way which actually caused me to break my nail so be careful.  The service was good. Everyone was nice and answered any questions I had. There's a mixed crowd. They have television to watch games etc. the size of the drinks are pretty big which is good I believe they have two for one drinks as well. I think this spot is good for people that like Apple bees and things of that nature or people that want to try something fun like riding a bull. That's the most unique thing about this place.

vHsacoByCUZ8xC4J9Wra7g.text: I grew another 5 o'clock shadow just waiting to be served (let alone welcomed) by these indifferent staff dolts, which never came during the 10+ minutes we were left hanging by the waitress, who was busy chatting away with another table no more than 5 feet away, and the mouth-breathing slack-jawed yokel busser, who was literally over my shoulder watching a repeat Georgia-Clemson game on ESPN from 2018 and ignored my request with his 1000 yard stare to clean off the syrupy/sticky table we were seated at. oTwkA5127QRKMJJ2joW67A.text: Food was mediocre and the service was worse. Pizzas sucked. Wings sucked. DO NOT ORDER THE DORRITO MAC N CHEESE! Weird texture, feels like eating slugs covered in sand. Serve was rude. Only thing good about this place red the guitars filled with booze

KcXxqJhhbGb7kb5lCIfvog.text: The only reason I'm giving this place 1 star is because the bar tenders were super nice to my girl friend and I. However the manager was a dick the night of the Super Bowl that I highly recommend people go elsewhere unless they like being treated like shit.  After a great day/night of drinking and meeting new friends, my girl and I left with some "to go" food we ordered earlier that day. We spent $500 for an open bar, food and tip with $100 of that going to food. Since we couldn't physically eat that much food, we order food to go. It wasn't until we got home that we realized that some food was missing so we called the place back and spoke with the worst manager. He refused to give us his name so unfortunately we can't call him out.   Essentially this guy told us to come back to the bar to pick up the food they forgot to give us (which was a good 20 min cab ride away) or too bad. After trying to be reasonable to ask them to deliver the food we just paid for, he apparently didn't want to talk any longer and hung up on us.   Worst customer service we've ever dealt with and highly suggest going somewhere else if you don't want to feel like you got stiffed.

5vzGfm46Aq-TPc4PrzvUrg.text: Service and food was great. The chicken and waffles were worth every penny. Great servers crystal and Kevin thank you for making us feel at home.

jSsHwf9vyG8QNcnFPGAPzw.text: Had bloody Mary's which were supposed to come with a pickle which they don't do anymore even though the new menu says it does and the celery and lime look like they'd been sitting for days. They said they have a gluten free menu but no longer do one. Nachos were ok. Overall very disappointed!  Only ate an appetizer and chose to eat elsewhere. Waiter was nice though.

HimSG_pWbi0sDcA_XEjxBA.text: Close as your going to find to some really greasy spoon food. They have tv's of which they play sports on, downside: there's no SOUND WTF! They have a mechanical bull! They are strip facing so it's easy to get in that way. BAD: they are at PH which if you are a local is terrible to park at . Right across from the Cosmo! They have live music outside in the evening AND they have outside seating. They are also situated right next ot the PH sports book #score! So you can place bets really easily.  They have a back room that seats like 20. WHY they don't advertise this for sports watching/rental with a minimum spend I don't know. It has couches, it has flip cup, it has tv's, and wait for it ...it has SOUND! or can have sound. Went there with my friend's bachelor party and sat in this special room, it was awesome!    Their menu is amazing: breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They even had a grilled PB&J which my friend actually ordered, but their roasted chicken salad sandwich *crowd pleaser* I went back to eat there just for that sandwich

FSHg8qpB95S3L6jpEmvH7A.text: Great place for a quick bite, bull ride, and drinks! Friendly staff, fun atmosphere. Wish they could have given us a deal on the pic they took... But still a fun place to stop to refresh and go back on the strip for more.

-PcFK1DyoOKc91Ho16adjw.text: Both meals arrived cold.   The service was great but the food was plain and cold.  If you are working of a hangover,  this is a good place to be.

ZFYlC3NsyVUfiDMNzqxOMw.text: Shoutout to our great waitress Heather!!! She's so great! It's my birthday and she got me a birthday shot that tasted like pineapple upside down cake. I got another one of those! Food was good too, big portions!

PEb4PJA0XuqBv5pXoO-f-g.text: Came in on a Thursday afternoon for the Happy Hour. The server did not mention the happy hour specials so I asked for them. There were small appetizer plates to share for 5 and 7 bucks, which was perfect as we were not that hungry. However after taking our order, the server disappeared and nobody came for 20 min. Then another Server came to us and apologized for the wait saying that he will take over and the previous sever had an emergency. Funnily enough,  5 min after the new server spoke to  us, we saw the previous sever , waiting and serving the table next to us and even around at the bar, but he was not serving us. Hmmmmmm, makes you wonder whether the emergency was RACISM ? Even though the food was good, I will not be returning for this kind of poor customer service.

ar8maL-qn6G052nMOxXU0g.text: Came here in the evening. The bartenders are super nice and friendly and that's where all the stars go. The outside area is nice; but the inside is super dark. The drinks were fine, if a bit forgettable, but I wouldn't really come here just for drinks or a night out--it doesn't seem like somewhere to go to chat over drinks or dance; it's definitely a food place/sports bar. The set up of the place is a bit awkward, with weird columns everwhere. Maybe it was just the night I visited.

Md4uqU6kFOWJA6gByOyB0w.text: If i can, i will give 0 star. Discrimination placed. Just because we are asian? We are ignored, food is horrible. The waitresses are super snob. If you are not white, please do no even go here. They treated you like no body

-8celksL8VpgmcawI_gppQ.text: Ok. Fun place if your looking for bar. Only problem my food was all wrong. And if you have food allergies and need to follow a special diet I wouldn't go...  Then I was told it would taken off check. But no adjustment made.

bw0HFkGAjHmWGDFIstLf-A.text: Cool atmosphere. A cross between cowboy bar and hip hop. A couple of bars in the dancing area with the dj and karaoke which make getting a beer or drink easier to access. There's also a completely separate bar that is more of a cowboy bar than the other so as to not disappoint the sound of the name. I personally know the dj so I stayed in the dance area but more was going on there anyways. DJ Sally keeps that place hopping. The karaoke is fun for everyone. One guest did a jodeci song and the next did an Elvis song and everyone enjoyed. The stage for karaoke makes it a pro feel to it. Having to get up on an elevated stage with lights in your face gives it a more star feel to singing in front of everyone which is cool. It's a step up. Adequate space throughout. I did not spend much time in the other side except to use the restroom which is on that side. It was even more space and more of the traditional type of cowboy bar that I'm used to seeing in SoCal.

6fDwE5mTq06rEuvsDxN4Mw.text: Must get the Doritos Mac and cheese and the ribs! They are so delicious even the half portion is filling. And the corn on the cob is cooked perfectly!

7yMqf6y8XiuBpXdrW_u_gg.text: Great food.  Location perfect for ppl watching. ..everything was great including the service.  Many options to choose from and the food tastes great.

m1U1JolXbgrrqgJxr_L6Kw.text: Came here one Friday evening for a meal before heading to XS later that night.  We were staying at the Elara so the ease of  getting to PBR was easy. We just wanted a quick bite close to our hotel as we stopped mid getting ready to eat and didn't want to go far and take too much time out of our getting ready/pre game time. My friend and I both ordered half a rack of ribs with a side of fries and coleslaw.   The reason why I've given this review 4/5 is because the food was delicious and it came out to us very quickly, the ribs were so meaty and tender. However, the general service was not very good. Our waitress was fairly grumpy, we straight away asked for ketchup and an extra plate to put the rib bones on. She brought them over about 3 mouthfuls before we finished our food. By that point I had already asked someone else. She never came over to ask if everything was ok.   When it came to getting the cheque, I had to ask her twice because after asking her once she said yes sure and disappeared for 20 minutes! I would definitely return because the atmosphere was good, food was delicious and reasonably priced, but I won't expect outstanding service and I wouldn't return if I know I'm in a rush or have somewhere to be. If the service had been good, I would have given 5/5. The poor service definitely reflected in the tip I gave her!

XU5nzQvnyD6jsGBAosPovQ.text: I had my birthday meal here and was able to get a table with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. The Barbecue Burger was awesome, It's huge! My sister had a chicken and waffles pizza that she said was good as well and we got to sit outside. Best Birthday ever!

LCqb_9K_j_062E1szfMcUg.text: I had dinner here with my husband last night. We both had margaritas, which were decent but nothing special. I had the PBR burger. I asked for it medium, but it came out pretty rare. Overall, it was a very average burger and I should have added bacon to it. My husband had the BBQ burger. It had a lot going on with the burger, pork, bacon and onion rings. His also came out pretty rare for medium. The service was not great.

bTrlE8UHSpMak5qaM-jrQw.text: Four words that I had thought would have had me hooked--- SWEET POTATO TATER TOTS.  Although they were good with their little maple dipping sauce, they were the only redeeming quality of PBR Rock Bar and Grill.  These are the only reason that 2 stars are being given here.   Other than that, with Vegas offering so much more, I have to say that this place is a waste of your time.  Explore other places that have better service, food and seem less trashy.

5ngiLAloKjoc2pnnuWkaWA.text: Terrible service. The hostess talked down to us. Seemed like she wasn't very happy with the world.

0rCrWc6WDOCUs23ba3mhaQ.text: Pass by this place pretty often due to it's proximity to earls. On the outside they sell tall cups and novelty drink holders filled with some kind of alcoholic slurpy. The most expensive thing is the guitar which was $40 if memory serves right, and the smallest cup was something between $10-$16. I don't know exactly how many ounces is in each one of those but I can tell you it's a lot. Throw in a couple of extra shots in each and it'll mess even some heavy weights.   We went in and tried a bunch of different foods. The food was pretty good, although we were all pretty hammered so there's a high probability it's a lot worse than how I remember it.  Inside the men's restroom was Mexican Wolverine, I shit you not.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucking bull fries $8
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate BBQ chicken quesadilla $12
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hat bender speciality cocktail $12

Vk8prUCpa-1v00iZxsORMQ.text: Me and a group of friends have been coming to PBR for several years now for the opening day of the NFL season. This year was no different. They've made some strides to spruce up the space and the menu! It was a very pleasant surprise. Our group of 6 was taken care of for the whole day. The manager (Crissy) and our server (Crystal) really went above and beyond to make sure our group was comfortable.  I would highly recommend PBR for game watching!

zDtF4xVEdPkVsRFGINVO9w.text: We had a great time here on our last trip to Vegas. A nice place to stop for a drink and catch up with friends while you watch people make a fool out of themselves trying to ride the bull. I can never resist the controlled danger of a mechanical bull. I always end up with bruises or a jammed thumb among other jammed appendages, haha! Glad they had a wide range of beers on tap but I had to have a large PBR to reminisce on how much my Pops used to drink back in the day. PBR me ASAP!

D0y1GSjoTqo1UOlcTm1xjw.text: My BBQ burger had raw pork on it and ice cold/stale onion rings. The waiter was super nice and tried to say all their pork is smoked for hours so couldn't be raw...it was raw. Other meals at the table were great. Service a bit slow and drinks are $12 for plastic cup sized beverages.

brP0lb1EK73WXr0rX70UCA.text: Happened to stumble into this place on my last day in Vegas. I really wish I hadn't. I don't think I have ever had such a sorry excuse for food in my life. The menu is pretty common, simple stuff, burgers, salads, sandwiches, aps. My boyfriend got the SIGNATURE burger and I got a quesadilla. Both were inedible. The burger was dry, bacon was tasteless cardboard. Even the fries unseasoned. My quesadilla was a hard crisp tortilla with unrecognizable meat. Even when I asked for ranch and hot sauce I was unable to eat my food.  Please if you ever come to PBR skip the food. Take a shot, ride the bull, and see some of the much better eating establishments in las vegas!

3fsXZRJa67ecQTP3zMsudA.text: Great food! We had a great waiter also but I can't remember his name . They had a mechanical bull that you could ride but I had to many drinks to try it out lol. I would def go back to this place!

nmlvgpXEe_CM-DF0Ifi1mg.text: Great food.  I laughed like crazy when my daughters hot dog and fries came out because they where huge and she was just stairing at it like really.  Lol. Everything really great.  I loved that they took my phone number and texted me when my table was ready, so we could shop and not have to sit and wait for our table.  Just a really great experience all around.  It was a little loud in there.  When you leave the restaurant don't forget to take a picture with the bull and check its balls out lol.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilling dog and fries

BwXKGuZKtnhn4HT9xL01RQ.text: PBR was our back-up restaurant before a show.  The food was as expected, nothing great but nothing bad - the french fries are damn good  Our server was quite nice and attentive.  My beef is with the hostess - we were seated right away (we had a reservation), but as soon as we were seated, we noticed the table was uneven.  Not the legs are off/stuff napkins under one side kind of uneven, but the top of the table coming off the supporting column.   We mentioned this to our server (Crissy), who immediately volunteered to fix, then after realizing the issue, went to get us a new table.  The hostess came over, angry, and said there were no other tables right now - because this was our fault?  There was a high-top, which we took, but it was completely the wrong attitude.  And no one else ever came and apologized, checked on us, etc. - we also moved ourselves.    Kudos for convenience, food is fine, but save anger towards the customers until they do something to annoy you.

zbxwygLFn_pWH1ccOe-HFQ.text: Great food, great drinks awesome management team!!! Started off with sweet potato tots, this was a first for us they were delicious. I had a grilled chicken sandwich, my husband had a huge burger, it was outstanding. Management was on their game, made their rounds talking to tables. Our service was impeccable, we never had an empty glass.  We will be returning, thanks guys!!

4Zjmm-2ViGFrX1O6KU5oTg.text: Great spot for drinks,breakfast lunch and dinner~ cool atmosphere~ had the classic breakfast today , eggs, bacon tater tots and toast~ but I've been here before and burgers are great, big enough to share~

6CSsZLie1uMuB2fk1F4PBw.text: Good location ! Staff is very friendly and accommodating ! Had burger , pizza and signature drink of 100oz ! Very well and happy to come back again ! Portion of food is large so Asians need to take care and order as per consumption needed !

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the 100oz (3 liters) cocktail signature drink !! Amazing !!

y_lxT4qK7Jz55K99tBFjeg.text: Huge bar with a million TV's hanging on the walls--a good place to watch the game. The drinks were not very good, that was definitely the low point, but the food was surprisingly decent. I was expecting it to be gross, but the chicken caesar salad was good, as was the turkey burger. my fiance ordered the buffalo dorito wings with and those were interesting--i would not recommend them. they came with a cheesy sauce on top vs. buffalo when we were expecting a buffalo sauce with doritos sprinkled on top. service was good and overall was not a bad place to come to if you are looking for a sports bar vibe.

-4cwlA0DolPCFzEBCFTkhw.text: So it's my first night in Vegas and I had a hankering for a burger. The boyfriend and I stopped here on a Thursday night and it really wasn't crowded at all. The first thing I noticed was the inconsistency of the style of the bar with the design, music, posters, etc. For one thing it's trying to play that cozy country bar attitude, but it has faux leather booth seats as if you're sitting at an Applebee's and the music really leaves a lot to be desired. (2000's pop music, totally not the vibe they were going for) The wait staff was nice and friendly but also didn't go out of her way to make sure our drinks were refilled on time and we had to wait.  Now I can totally overlook the feel and music, and uncomfortable seating IF the food is good. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case here. For the appetizer, we ordered the chili cheese taters. The taters were fresh and hot but totally buried under way too much cheese and even more chili. I usually like chili, but this wasn't a homey comfort food chili, it was more like 90% out of a can chili.  For dinner, I got a BBQ burger which is usually a go-to for me because I love BBQ sauce. The burger was falling apart, and not in a good way. And it definitely wasn't cooked medium, it was well done. Also a big no-no for me is if food doesn't have any flavor. There was really no taste except the toppings and the ground beef. If I took ground beef with no seasoning and cooked it well done at home, it most likely would've tasted better than what I got. So it looks like I won't be coming back here.  If you want a good burger, try Burger Brasserie! That place was surprisingly awesome!! After coming here, I was pretty nervous to try burgers anywhere in Vegas, but wasn't disappointed.

vB3ZLtHmm3dQkWmS2WiJ4g.text: This is my response to Jocelyn C. of PBR,  Thank you for your comment... but, "What part of my review, did you have a hard time understanding?" Was that a computer generated comment left by pbr??? yes that was our horrible superbowl 2013 experience, not this year?! And No, as clear as stated on my review, we will not come back here anymore. And for other superbowl seekers and sports fanatics, I recommend finding another bar.

U5NvfRK7HNuNWgomgb33IQ.text: Tried the buffalo pizza and buffalo fries it was delicious! I love the atmosphere will definitely be back when I come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GJ_KS_4B_sMA3HtsQLe5AQ.text: Came in because the bf and I were hungry, and the line for earls was wayyy too long. Got seated pretty quick. It's a bar restaurant so it was pretty loud. There's a bull you can ride near the front. We got our food pretty quick and it wasn't bad. I thought the prices were okay considering everything is $$ in Vegas. However, it took wayyy too long and wayy too many reminders from another waiter in order to get our check from our waitress. I wouldn't mind coming back but it's not my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My quesadilla (fully loaded) and the bf&#39;s burger

1imoUqUNz1-kbygja_c1Bg.text: Stay away from this place.  Was given a buy one get one drink free coupon. I figured I'd order a corona since I was drinking that earlier.  So one corona get one free. Bill was $10.  Yes $10 for one corona.   How the hell does this place survive.  Because of dumbass like you and me spending $10 for one corona.  Fuck this place I'm going back where they were $2 a beer.   This place sucks and is a shit hole.

kBdvhyNWQenaad5Ln0mkMA.text: This is where I get my yardstick every time! I really like their flavors and mix hurricane with coral crush. For some reason I think it tastes better than Fat Tuesday, especially when more shots are added in. I have also tried their food. It's not bad for bar food and the portions are pretty big.

NjkjbOe7PPFYCQ3vZeWK-w.text: Our family came in to Vegas from the U.K., Canada and California during a vacation/birthday celebration. Thursday, April 14, 2017 They ate at their first American restaurant in Las Vegas which was PBR because they had a meal with a show offer. The evening started off well with the fun mechanical bull riding but I'm sad to say that for their first family dinner and a show they received awful service from then on. They were told they could not order their food until 5 pm even though the show started at 7pm. The food came out late, it tasted ok and they ended up having to miss their desserts because they had to leave for the show. My sister in law (who is visiting the U.S) realized she had left her phone at the restaurant and was panicked and relieved to see that it was turned in at the hostess front area. As we got the phone, the waitress came us up at the front and told us we had an extra $6.00 charge after we paid our bill and gave her a proper tip even though the service as not good! Nasty surprise for us seeing as how she wasn't considered about the situation, only that we needed to pay 6.00 dollars. We gave her the cash and left. Needless to say we wouldn't return or suggest anything other than a try at the mechanical bull riding there.  Gave the two stars for the bull and the polite lady who was there running it.

Huq3Euy62vwfsQaenMTPpg.text: Had great atmosphere, got seated & waited for waiter. Place was somewhat busy for a Wednesday, but finally had waiter stop by. He was friendly and took our drink order.  Took some time for two draft beers, but it was early. Ray, our waiter, was happy to take our order.  Apps & some sandwiches.  Well, last we saw of Ray our waiter for quite some time. Apps came, we had no silverware or condiments.  No waiter.  Drinks were gone, no waiter. I had to get our own silverware off another table then go to the bar to get a drink. In the meantime, main course has arrived. & still no waiter. Lousy waiters & bartenders!  Good food, no doubt about that, but service....Worst in Vegas!

Xx2tszKD8eLrUqo731Z9jw.text: You literally cannot find a better bar than this one in Miracle Mile.  I spent the last three days there (not counting today, because reality made me leave... darn!) and met some really amazing people (both people that work there and patrons).  It's a huge place, and yes... they have a mechanical bull you can ride (no, I don't ride the bull).  Basically it's three bars and a patio.  For me, the smaller back bar was comfortable.  I tried the big front bar and, while it was still fun, I just kinda felt more comfortable back in the back.  Even when it was busy, it was home.  I won't name names (mainly because I don't think I can find all my card receipts), but everybody that worked in the back while I was there... thank you for making my latest Vegas trip something to remember.  Cheers, and Jameson on the rocks for everyone!  :)  *** Update:  I forgot.  The metal bar stools in the back bar... they seriously suck.  Please switch them out with something with some cushion?  Thanks!

icmdxaWp7npfFBgtW5Suiw.text: MISSED THE MARK.  We went to this location out of convenience and should of ventured out.  I cannot complain about the ambiance.  Who wouldn't like 1000 flatscreen TV's and a mechanical bull.  These created a fun an lively atmosphere, but unfortunately it ends there.  As a bonus, you get a free drink when you check in, which comes in handy when a Margarita costs $12.  I ordered a cup of chilli to start and was asked if I'd like it before my meal, to which I said yes.  My chilli arrived and was great.  It is served with a piece of corn bread.  Very hearty, this can almost be a meal all by itself.  The problem started when my meal arrived one minute after I got my chilli.  I initially ordered the 1/2 rack of ribs with the Doritos Mac n Cheese.  As soon as I sampled a rib, I realized why it came out so fast.  The meat was clearly pre-cooked and wasn't sufficiently reheated.  My ribs were actually cold.  We also ordered the Chicken Mac n Cheese and a BLT.  The Chicken Mac n Cheese did not have any desirable taste.  After a lot of salt, pepper and hot sause, a decision was made to give up trying to improve on this disaster.  The BLT comes on a very large piece of bread, but lacks the BLT to compliment the size of the bread.  Ultimately we decided to send back the ribs and mac n cheese and opted for burgers.  The burgers were just OK.  They clearly don't know how to cook them to the appropriate temperatures requested.  Finally our waiter forgot to discount our coupon as well.  While dining a woman came over to take our picture, which we gladly posed for.  While we were trying to eat a second woman, who was extremely rude came over to try to sell us the picture.  She did not like the fact that I said no thank you to her.  At least she could have waited until we were almost done eating before interrupting us.  Overall, if you are gonna drink and ride the bull, you should be OK.  Don't go out of your way for a dining experience unless you want to be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cljKNfrSSM6DwrXKHzkvIw.text: I'm torn between a 3 and 4, but I'll go with 3 because the food is average.   I've been here a few times and the food and drinks have been fine. I would say come here to watch sports, have some drinks, and eat some bar food.   When I've come here, I've ordered really strange combinations - mainly because I've felt like death from lack of sleep, loss of money, and nights of free booze.   That being said, the best thing I've ordered there is the chicken noodle soup. Strange, I know, but it's really tasty and comes with grilled cornbread. The coffee is also good.   I ordered the taco pizza this trip - soggy and lacked flavor. Don't get it. I also got a pb&j during a weird breakfast. The Texas toast isn't toasted and is giant so it doesn't allow for the gooey deliciousness that is a pb&j, plus they use raspberry jelly. It should be grape at any respectable establishment. Slightly kidding.   The wings are pretty good. You can get some of those and not be disappointed. Oh, and the Bloody Mary is also enjoyable.   Shots here are huge if you're looking for drinks. Just huge. Dangerously so. Shooters appear tiny next to a shot, but they're the right size.   The staff is friendly and attentive. It's a fun environment. They've got beer pong and bull riding. You'll need to eat when you're partying and this place is just as good as any other bar you could stumble into.

mKklr4EijMxXmQwlP_NT8w.text: First, the hostess looked plain annoyed when we requested a seat. not a great start. after about a 20 minute wait, we were seated. after getting waters, took more than TEN minutes for our server to come back and take our order...  then, waited THIRTY+ minutes just to get TWO HOT DOGS (which were 'eh' at best).  in summary, the food is B-/ C+ at best, not as good as TGIF or Chilis.  overpriced.  extremely crappy service provided by folks who clearly have no interest in making customers happy.

0OKxkCRf61JDeLbf_uEMFQ.text: Good! Fast service, nice people. 2 pints for only 6 dollars & the pulled pork sandwich was excellent. Nothing fancy but well done!

Werdyyc0-Ym6djQlHs5_qw.text: I had an great experience here! Definitely will be coming back. The food was great and drinks were even better. Heather, our waitress, is definitely the reason I will be coming back! Highly recommend her.

nWrwgiDTXUiPbGJNr0EF9w.text: Eating here now. All of us hate our food. Burger was completely raw. And been waiting for over 45 min

gvM4E6t4-0KzZR8HyNddkA.text: Has a good location. If you're looking to people watch, this is it.  Food - I bought the bbq burger. Great choice! Had pulled pork and onion rings on it. Very filling!  Drinks - Super pricy here. Beers are $8 to $11 [ unless you get pbr]. Hard alcohol drinks are $10 a piece as well.   Downside is that you can get these drinks named "the yard". They're super expensive for "3ft" of "booze". It's a giant slushy and it's missing the alcohol. They're loaded with sugar so expect gut rot about halfway through it.

TZHWoDdXvq3lRLMkkEqMCw.text: The food was great this time. Everybody loved what they ordered. Unfortunately, the service was absolutely terrible and everyone was irritated!  The waiter took quite a while to come over to our table to take our orders and ask if we wanted any drinks. Once we placed our orders, we never saw him again for about 15-20 minutes. He brought the food out and walked away quickly. None of us had any utensils and we all wanted refills on our water/drink orders.   We had to hunt down someone else to go get us some utensils and asked if the waiter could come back to refill the drinks. It took him FOR-EV-ERRRR.   We never saw him again after that for a good 20 minutes or so. Once he came back to clear the table we asked for the check and he said he would bring it right over. Nope. Another 15-20 minutes pass and my boyfriend had gotten so fed up with waiting he went over to the hostess stand to tell them how long we had been waiting and that we wanted the check so we could pay and leave. Someone went to get the waiter and he finally brought over the check.   I like this place because the food is good, prices are good, the atmosphere is fun, and it's a good location, but when service is this bad it really makes us unlikely to go back again.

xI-XMWWUxAgIicBEU2F6sg.text: Love this place great food and drink. Our server Heather was so sweet and nice. We had a good time. Heather made us so comfortable.

pnKPb-nBhNGTAvE6Ar7u4g.text: Ummmm, the Appleby's of the Las Vegas Strip!  Seriously though, I'm not sure why we ended up here, we were dazed and confused and stumbled into this place.  The food is over-priced and not that great.  I mean that's Vegas for you, but typically you can get good over-priced food.  This place is definitely more for bachelor parties and people out on the town wasted.  They specialize in beverage bowls that are super expensive and very big.  The food is just underwhelming and made me feel like I could have gotten it at any chili's, Appleby's or other chain restaurant for 25% less $. The only entertaining part is watch idiots ride the mechanical bull, but that's really not that fun unless you are drunk and the people riding are drunk too, plus then the food would taste better.  This was a bad start to our dining experiences, luckily it got better.

jtprKNChdZ9D-S2BXUytiA.text: I got what I ordered. A quesadilla. By that I mean no guacamole or sour cream or even salsa. Took a bite grabbed my beer and left. The two stars I am leaving are for the Asian dude that played country music very well. I don't like neo-country music but he played guitar very well and sounded like Garth Brooks. Weird.

DvmtOWeTdkAyUKcHqv1uXQ.text: We came here the first night of our stay at 3 in the morning. Service was great, I wish I remember our server name because he was awesome, really nice guy (it was July 31). We sat outside even though it was hotter outside they have misting machines all around to keep it cool. The food came out pretty quick and it was delicious, we ordered a mix of breakfast and regular food and it was all good. We liked the food so much we came back the next day with a larger group and sat outside again. It was busier and we got a different server this time. The food took a long time to come out, and I got an egg sandwich which must have been cooked first because it was cold and everyone else's was good. I didn't complain about it because I was too hungry, another person also complained the chicken was very bland. Other than that the food was good. The Doritos crusted Mac and cheese was amazing! The tator tots were also delicious.

MNgXfP4oNSio-Uu2qok-QA.text: This was our first stop in Vegas after a long flight from Texas. We arrived around breakfast time and we decided to try PBR Rock Bar & Grill. They had great choices for breakfast. We decided to start drinks early since it was my birthday. Alex, our bartender was very accommodating. I would recommend this place to everyone that's looking for a quick bite and nice morning drinks! ASK FOR ALEX

bzPPPC5n-5rCLihpOcoZ_w.text: This was our second time here this weekend. It's convenient to our room and the first time was good.  This time not so much. First we waited forever for our food. The table next to us (same size party-5) ordered about 10 minutes after us but got their food first and FINISHED before we even got our food. I asked for status and was told "it's coming". Umm...When!? Maybe about another 10 minutes we got our food.  We had to ask for water refills. Our food was gross! The Mac and cheese Doritos sides is tasteless. Watery noodles with crushed Doritos on top. Doesn't even taste like Mac and cheese.  My hubby's eggs were over cooked and his toast was burnt.  Nasty! We didn't even eat it.  Mind you. The place wasn't even busy. Horrible! We will NEVER come back!

FOZGEeagfjyany59PNxiBQ.text: This review is based solely on service.  If I could I would give this place 0 stars based on service. Got sat, took someone about 10 minutes to greet us, in which we gave our food and drink order. After that I went to the restroom and when I came back, we didn't even have waters! And let me tell you, this place was SLOW. On a Tuesday night I expect you to be more attentive to your table. I didn't even bother to stay, I left to eat somewhere else.

ROkTJtNGg4Nrc-J-fE_r4A.text: A large part of any place for me is the staff. I just wrote a review about how unfriendly the staff are at one place. This one place caused me to go back to the PBR on my 7th trip to Las Vegas.I keep coming back here because the staff are so friendly. They make everyone feel like a regular. They are very respectful and always nice to talk to. Oh, and the food is great to! Pizza!

3VToWwnIlJJe4YECQoPqAg.text: Love the two for one offer for drinks. We had the Caribbean Sunset. It was super sweet and good. It tastes like a Mai Tai. If you like sweet drinks this one is for you!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caribbean Sunset
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink menu
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink menu

BKdrFiPPIpzjD-V8FNh-Mg.text: **This review is for an event hosted at this bar** When I first reached out to group res for PBR the communication was mediocre, but at least constant. After about two weeks the communication became horrible. It would take me 3 or 4 emails for Regina to reply to me. When I would finally call she'd have no idea what I was talking about and it was a huge mess. When I finally got her to send over the CC authorization form she told me the prices went up. It took another two weeks for her to get back to me saying she'd honor the pricing I was sent. All the way up to the day before the event I was trying (sending multiple of the same email even from different emails) to contact her.   The actual bar wasn't bad. Our day of contact/manager was Megan and she wasn't overly friendly nor was she rude. The only times I saw her was when we first went in and when she brought over the remainder of the balance. We had it from 7:30 to 9:30 and until 9 it wasn't very lively, everyone was sitting around and all of a sudden the lights went down and they started playing Rap/Hip Hop and it became PACKED. They opened the door from the main entry area and when we went to the bathroom the guy wasn't going to let us back in. He said our party was over and we needed to go get a stamp. He was rather rude about it. We had two bartenders; one was amazing! She never let my cup go empty and her attitude was great.

mEAQeXtf4eTNRnQQ3eWOUA.text: After landing in Vegas from NY and checking in at Planet Hollywood my first stop was here at Rock Bar. It was late on a Wednesday night, my bartender/waitress was badass! She made my arrival here definitely welcome and was quite genuine. The service was beyond excellent. The drinks were on point and the drink specials were a steal for Vegas. The food hit the spot! Try the wings! Rock Bar will definitely be a Vegas tradition for me from now on. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Don&#39;t tell &#39;em, don&#39;t tell &#39;em. You ain&#39;t eatin&#39;, you ain&#39;t eatin&#39;.&#34; Best!!!

P11FKBb2RWtBqgLNZyDEMg.text: Great place to watch sporting events.  Lots of TV's.  Lots of drink.  Lots of good food.  The bloody Mary was really good!  Little on the pricey side.

b-hIPZOghYZqjf8gNKcIuA.text: So, it is Las Vegas and a eight hour flight will make you want to eat a dead horse. So, we stayed at the Planet Hollywood and wanted to get a quick meal to eat and were desperate, so we gave PBR a chance. The service was ok, the waitress was not knowledgeable of the menu or drinks. The food, again this is just a tourist trap and very gimmicky, but the food was very standard and not high quality. So, if you are looking for a very basic overpriced quick meal and this is your last resort stop here.
