Also,$12 for an awful Bloody Mary that was the color of strawberries and mostly ice. My friend had an equally horrible grilled cheese with processed cheese. Would never return.

zMCt6NZIbYBaXE8NGqwb8w.text: We ate here during the holidays while vacationing in Vegas for a week. The food was great, but the kids menu was pretty expensive! It's a neat place with a live band and mechanical bull. The wait staff was did a great job and overall we would eat here again.

7f9jDvtcJX3MqwyRkl5eeg.text: Fun place, the beer is not bad. I'm not a fan of PBR but when it's on tap,cold,keep pouring them,its that good. FOOD size is plenty I went for the Mac and cheese w/bacon our guest had ribs,sausages, somekind beef and more beer. Yup would hang out here again.

FhgtweuFUtsK8-Zuqu1wbg.text: A group of four of us ate here on 02/03/18, the food was good and the prices were very reasonable BUT the service was horrible!  We waited almost an hour for our meal.  We were never asked if we want another drink or anything else and when we were ready to leave our server was nowhere to be found.  We walked up to the bar to pay for our meals and were told that we had to give it to our server (who disappeared).

tc8sFTY3qcG2PO7mp5NxiA.text: Great place for all day breakfast and bloody Mary! Reasonable prices and good food. Right across fro. Cosmo and heated patio. Come eat. There's no one here! ;)

iLUzlkME9TpqoAEoyVCxYg.text: Wrong boneless wings order never saw our waiter, and took 20 minutes to get our check

UR2qN0iFrD0yfalnSjTcRA.text: Would never return.  Not vegetarian friendly and the food was disgusting. Fiance sent his back to the kitchen and we never got a replacement. Slow service, disgusting food, bad environment, high cost.

CwDq57a0zQmRJ2tekBs17Q.text: Great place for a pulled pork sandwich or some ribs. Food came quickly and was hot and plentiful. Service was great. Lots of large screen tv's and basically we sat at a picnic bench.

R_tPqeM6SKHMg2rh4SSHAA.text: Wow pretty cool spot, staying we were staying at planet Hollywood & were hungry for lunch glad we stopped in great food cool vibe our frys were burnt but they brought us new ones so all good...

6bF3KgxEftY9-cCnAup8Xw.text: Hungry in vegas, this place had no wait time so we decided to check it out. We ordered Rib Eye's but the waiter recommended getting a special that was not on the menu yet which included three pieces of 3 oz steaks. To be honest the steaks tasted funny and wasn't cooked the way I asked it to be cooked. Although the waiter did offer to get it re done, it had already taken 30 minutes to get the food and didn't want to wait another 30 minutes. The artichoke dip was good, I probably will not be back to this restaurant, maybe there was a reason why their was no wait time at this restaurant.

t78wWwBz_x_gmtA5dlS6zw.text: They were pretty busy when we arrived and we were quoted a 30 min wait which really ended up being 15mins...so good there. The menu looked decent, lots of chili features... but average sports bar food.   Once seated and greeted we ordered two shots and two beers. The shots came in sticky glasses and one of the beers had a floater in it. Thankfully, our server was nice enough to switch my beer out for a new one.   I ended up ordering a PBR Burger with french fries and my boyfriend ordered chicken fingers. After seeing the chicken fingers, I kind of regretted getting a burger. The burger was vooked as requested, but it just wasn't what I was desiring. The chicken fingers appeared to be panko breaded. My boyfriend also got the Doritos mac and cheese which really was just average mac and cheese with crunched Doritos on top... don't let your curiosity get the best of you here...the mac and cheese is not all that great.   Honestly, the best part of my meal was the french fries. They were so crunchy and golden, just like I prefer them. If it weren't for the french fries and the exceptional service, I likely would have given this place lower stars. So thank you Bronson for your excellent service and patience with my family...and PBR do NOT change your french fries!!  *2017 Yelp Review Challenge: 1/100*

rGcXoOVRXbfuAPeHet0NMg.text: Nicely located attached to Planet Hollywood. Came in at dinner time and was seating immediately. Good for me probably not so good for them but it was a Thursday night. Place was clean, service was good, and food was good. Typical franchise experience. I got the jerk burger. Nice and spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-AxqNo9oTH05j57Myq519g.text: Great place to eat and have a few cold drinks. Very helpful staff. Friendly atmosphere.

jXm_oWw3QmcIOgpnVf0Kbg.text: I stopped by to get a glass of wine. I literally sit at the bar for an hour and nobody came up to me. So I went to the bar and had to grab my own drink. It was pretty expensive. 11 dollars for a glass of house wine. The glass wasn't properly cleaned either. They will never get my business ever again.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Artgo7PKt_sZSGBYpk6Z3g.text: This was horrible! There is not a nice or diplomatic way to put it. So disappointed it is unreal. First, we ordered show tickets through LasVegas.com and the dinner package included the tickets to the PBR Rock Bar and Grill. We were able to walk right up and be seated right away. Great, looks good. Then the hostess gives us this "special" menu. Limited menu is what it should say. I mean...you get no choice for an appetizer...really it was not even an appetizer, it was the house salad...just a plain green salad. No choice of salad dressing. Just that is that and no substitutions. Mind you, the PBR Rock Bar and Grill has a pretty decent sized menu. I had looked it up online and was wanting the California Chicken Sandwich all day! Nope, not gonna happen. The entree consisted of 5 choices. Two of them were salads, macaroni and cheese, vegetable fajitas (who wants that!) and then ribs. So pretty much the only decent choice was ribs! Why not cut out the salad and dessert and just let someone order what they want to eat. Seriously...the salad and dessert were not wanted and wouldn't have been ordered. We sat there looking at our pathetic menu for 25 minutes waiting for someone to even acknowledge that we were there. Seriously, 25 minutes and for an already irritated person, this was like an hour. Our waiter finally showed up. We ordered our drinks...a beer and a soda as well as the food for dinner and the dessert, they had us order it all at once. I ordered Mac and Cheese and other half ordered ribs. Drinks took another 15 minutes and mine was diet...I did not order diet. Nasty. Seriously waited another 20 minutes to tell the waiter that it was the incorrect soda. The bus boy brought salads. Green salad with a couple croutons and pieces of radishes. Ranch was the dressing served...Gross. I was so hungry, ate mine. Other half does not like ranch dressing so he didn't even eat his. Another 25-30 minutes and our food comes out. The ribs looked decent, but it was just like 4 ribs covered in BBQ sauce on a piece of bread?? Side of regular mac and cheese with it. Mine was the PBR mac and cheese. NASTY! It was disgusting. Cold and watery. I cannot believe they serve this to people. Just horrible. I ate a few bites and watched my other half finish his ribs. I mean, this was bad, not good in any way. I couldn't even complain because the waiter didnt come back. If you are going to serve of a minimal menu then at least make the food good. Seriously. This was a joke. How do you mess up Mac and cheese. Then there was a dessert that came with dinner. You got a choice of strawberry shortcake or root beer float. I wanted neither, but when we ordered our food we had to place our dessert order as well. Weird! Annoyed to say the very least. So we just said one of each when we ordered. (Mind you, I would not have ordered any of these options if I had been able to order off the regular menu...none of these...not one!) Strawberry shortcake was a cold, hard, non iced donut with whipped cream and some strawberries. Not good... It was not restaurant quality. It was, yeah I got some left over four day old plain Krispy Kremes and a can of whipped cream...grrrr. No, never mind. Four day old Krispy Kremes would probably still taste good. Grrrrr. Then his float was just a scoop of ice cream and a bottle of root beer with it on the side. Not prepared. Just a glass, scoop inside and a bottle served with it. This whole night was terrible. I honestly have not had such a bad experience in a restaurant in years. The food was bad, service was bad, the place was not full, so there was just no excuse. It was just ridiculous all the way around. Over an hour of waiting for horrible bar food. The only thing that saved this night was that the show we went to was great. This place I would avoid like the plague! Not a good restaurant at all. The cost of the tickets and the show package should have allowed a decent menu or allow someone to choose from the regular menu and nix the salad and dessert that we didn't want anyway. This was not a deal at all. We would have much rather just bought the show tickets and then bought dinner some where else...McDonald's would have been a thousand times better. This place really didn't deserve any stars but that was not an option for me. My advice to LasVegas.com... There are many other restaurants to choose from for packages. Pfftt..

OlKZauWDXdK2pyCvzjvH8A.text: Really nice casual setting with plenty of friendly staff! I went in with a medium group and was seated by the bar so our server was very close to us constantly checking in and ensuring that we were well taken care of. We split a fish bowl and plenty of appetizers. My favorite was their deep fried pickles! With each receipt, you do receive one free ride on the mechanical bull which is extremely fun and highly recommend doing if it's your first time! Would love to come back once I am in the area again.

su7gaUy8Xlm0BDw0WZrSpg.text: I love coming to PBR when my friends or family are in town. The food never fails to disappoint and neither do their drinks! They do this thing where if you buy a drink or food item, you just show your receipt to the person in charge of the mechanical bull and you get a free ride! When i saw they had jello shots, I was iffy about trying them because most of the time, jello shots are a waste of money because there usually isn't much alcohol in them... that wasn't the case here. They were actually really good and you could even taste the alcohol!

EXW116jRtZ_8ysgH6tkQVw.text: Amanda was the best bartender on the strip!!! Fast service, great smile, great attitude :)

xH63O57Lof-VS6VbcRSF7Q.text: all the music they played was rb.    You have to be kidding me  no rock no country.  Dis appointed

xI3Mu4daaTk57M8uX92Qvg.text: Had a very enjoyable meal. Ordered the tostada nachos with pulled pork and they were absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is so much fun, you can't help but have a good time. Great drink specials, good service. Each booth has its own TV to catch up on sports events and when you're done you can go in the back and ride the mechanical bull or at least enjoy watching other people do it.

cqq7yfdcUxEFxEU9QerfPg.text: Let me start by saying that had I known PBR is the acronym for Professional Bull Riding, we would not have ended up here (that makes me think 'country music' rodeo, etc which I have no interest in whatsoever) - but I'm so glad we did!!!   We were exhausted, didn't care to walk much, & hangry on Sunday night of a holiday weekend when we found ourselves at Miracle Mile. We chose this spot off the directory not wanting greasy fast food but also wanting a decent meal in a casual atmosphere.   We were seated immediately next to the bar area and behind some retail racks which was cool - we could people watch the foot traffic entering Miracle Mile from the strip and also could listen to the DJ & MC while watching the numerous drunk brides-to-be ride the bull as they mimicked riding their man only to be thrown face first from the bull - it was loud but some good entertainment!! And the music wasn't country either, for which I was pleasantly surprised. We also enjoyed watching the DJ pretend he was working hard mixing the music when the pop music playing was just the straight tracks LOL  Our party of 3 ordered ribs, a sandwich, & the ribeye. The food was good but the ribeye, although tasty, was surprisingly a bit tough (probably the worst ribeye had in a long time). We enjoyed the free glasses for ordering a particular size brew and shake - & took advantage leaving with our souvenirs.   Service was good.  I rarely pay so IDK about value of our meal but the shake in souvenir glass was $14.95 O_O. The Nutella shake was good & even came with a full size sprinkled donut adorning the straw, but $14.95?  A lil pricey if you ask me. Oh, & there's only 4 shake flavors, not the long list as displayed on the menu at the front near the hostess (disappointing).  All in all it was a good, entertaining choice & worth the experience.  If we ever go back, we'll just have to step it up and ride that bull ;D

1dM-GzZvW71dC3PYBFyTqA.text: The food is average, the ambiance is too much in your face so to speak and the music very, very loud and you have to yell in order to talk to someone, even the wait staff. We had an entree and it was not memorable. Not bad but not the best either. We went outside to the bar by the mechanical bull, which is far better in the patio. You get to people watch and watch the bull riding without the loud music blaring in your ears or the PBR branding atmosphere in your face in the restaurant.  It is good to visit, but visit for drinks in the bar outside only.

iILiOODMPXCaMbwAFCnRJA.text: Staff very friendly!!! Great food!! Kseniya made great drinks for us. The atmosphere was lively!! We had a great time!!

B46S7m-3iqvyJQVynNQIeQ.text: My first time here and am not disappointed. Their nachos are delicious and so are their Southwestern egg rolls

OtCrJxiGJ1wxRmo7Yq5_QA.text: Went there for my boot of a drink and I got my boot of a drink. Strawberry and sour apple, so sweet and tangy!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HMlTwcNMKs9F9HrKwojOlg.text: Stopped by here with the intentions of having a bloody mary (cause lord knows we all need one of those in the morning in vegas) then moving on to shop. We sat outside at the bar and were immediately greeted by the bartender. Everything was nice and clean and there were quite a few people sitting out there. We started out by ordering a couple of drinks, after looking over the menu we realized they had fried pickles (our favourite) so we went ahead and ordered some of those as well. Service was really quick and all the staff there were super friendly. Food came out and OMG was it good! Some of the best fried pickles. What went from "let's have a drink and go" turned into sitting at the bar for over 3 hours enjoying cocktails and having a good time.  Loved watching all the people trying to ride the bull. Will definitely be coming here again next time we are in vegas. I highly recommend this place!

390DbhsRDqjZ26Ml9Q3c8g.text: We had the best customer service we've ever had! Jerry was so hilarious and kind that we could not leave. We actually came twice in one day because the food and customer service was so great. We're visiting from out of town and felt great Hospitality. The food was delicious the drinks were served quick and cold. That was live music that we really enjoyed. I cannot recommend this place any higher.

WARYPsW12C1VofFYOcpByg.text: Where else can you get breakfast for $5 and a bull with diamond balls?  Fun place,  nice staff

F8umXkI4PI6gTJVI_1eZrg.text: This place was AMAZING. Randomly stumbled upon this place after a long day/night of drinking. Leo! My guy! He was a rockstar!! As a server myself I appreciate honesty and all of his recommendations were perfect! That Jerk burger mouth watering good, the brisket burrito was heaven and my tostados nachos were wayyyyyy better then a lot of places like chevys. Can't wait to come back to Vegas just for this place alone!!

kbUT1iaUgjLAUpRkd6CigA.text: Great location! Outdoor seating is the best, right next to Miracle Mile Shops entrance. Great idea for live music but unfortunately this particular band was too much like karaoke and the lead singer was not that great.  He solicited song from the crowd and a few customers screamed out "Prince" and he said Prince was above his pay level.... then proceed to play Sweet Child of Mine but Guns n' Roses... yet a karaoke classic but did it no justice. The food was disgusting and the service was horrible. This is definitely a place to sit out, drink and sing karaoke favorites with a mediocre band. Maybe if I drank the music would have sounded better and the food would have tasted better and the service wouldn't have mattered.

YdI-iNqhuL-8i8yAIXVMdQ.text: Absolutely loved this place! Staff was courteous and prompt with drinks and food. The food was delicious and presented well, and the drinks were amazing and they don't short you on the alcohol content! Shout out to Meghan and Jennifer being awesome bartenders! Great conversation and information about the sights and fun to be had on the strip. This was my first time in Vegas and I recommend this place to everyone! And amazingly my gf and I managed to get through that whole drink with just 2 of us!!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-iCsCWtele-joTAqR6wSHQ.text: Whoa!  This is a cool bar located near Planet Hollywood  and The Miracle Mile Mall.  Really it's a sports bar with loud rock music, awesome.   Rule #1: come here for craft beer and/or cocktails (because the food is awful)  Rule #2: you have to like loud music blasting 70s - now rock music.   Rule #3: notwithstanding rules 1 and 2, order the fried pickles. Those are awesome!  Since I like rock music, craft beer, fried pickles and have been known to plow a few drinks .. is it any wonder that I came to this bar three times today?!  Try the "8 Seconds" cocktail, but substitute Knob Creek instead of Bullet bourbon . This will give it the kick it needs and oh what the heck, you're in Vegas baby so drink 2 or 5.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ASS_k7HWpdu21WcKUb0Ucw.text: Don't be fooled. This place looks great! It has an awesome patio! What looks like a "great" deal for their happy hour.  Earlier in the day we were approached by a promoter for 2 for 1 drinks. We were actually looking for a place to eat at the time so we decided to try this place. When we sat down the table had a promotional flyer on the table. It was happy hour!! It was great, they half off draft and 2 for 1 drinks too. We all decided to get the 2 for 1 drinks. We also ordered their tailgater special. It was a bunch of appetizers for approx $50. It said it fed 4-6 people. It sounded like a great deal. Here is where it all went downhill.  The food was cold! It tasted good but it seemed to have been sitting for a while before it got to the table. When they arrived it seemed like smaller portions. Half a pretzel? Really!?  Then, the bill arrived and all of a sudden it wasn't 2 for 1 drinks anymore. They FAILED to tell us that on "game day" the drink specials aren't valid. NO WHERE does it say on the promotional flyer any exclusion NOR did the waitress let us know. Shady. Don't waste your time and try a different place, there are so many around.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

44EGr0xlE5rHtwhctb1yzw.text: Our server was great! The food was terrible. Got a strawberry chicken salad, and the chicken was so set and tough. Half size order for $12, such a waste. I literally ate spinach and the strawberries.

h7nsybSyNjWYq6RwsfKuEA.text: We did the dinner and show, so we had a different menu (2 salad choices, 4 entree choices, 2 dessert choices, includes "regular" drink).  Girl goes around taking pictures and offers a free postcard. She pushed a little for us to buy the big pic with frame, but after stressfully haggling with another vendor, I was not in the mood. She seemed miffed when I stuck my ground and just accepted the post card. Whatever.   Rum & Coke: Strong! I think they're generous with the alcohol!   Chopped salad: pretty good. A little on the sour side, but the pepperchinis (sp?) were a nice little surprise.  Beef Brisket: good!  PBR Burger: really good!  Chocolate chip cookie dessert: was not a "chocolate chip" cookie, more of a chocolate cookie; would not classify it as a "generous helping" per the menu description. Cookie could have been a little warmer. Ok.  Water: tasted like tap  Bathroom: clean but smelled like a public bathroom. The stall I went in ran out of toilet paper and one of the paper towel dispensers was empty. A manager just happened to be in there and she took care of everything right away.  Super plus: charging station at the table!  Waiter: Aaron - nice, polite  Overall: good; gotta roll myself out of here bc I'm so stuffed; def a place to come to again.

Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iErRZ3IbNXa1jzCjcPpkyw.text: I do like this place better the Gilley's down the strip.  The service is better and the drink specials during Happy Hour rock!  You also can't beat the music.

wyuKEg4NPxBcLq_A8DCSJg.text: I'll be totally honest, the only reason we came to PBR for a late dinner on our first night in Vegas was for the giant cocktails.  Everything else was just for convenience (if you call walking nearly a mile from the Venetian to Planet Hollywood convenient).  Overall, things were meh at best - it wasn't all that busy but it took a good 15 minutes after we were seated before we even got water, let alone any actual service.   Once we had decided, and someone finally came over to take our order, we ended up with a table full of drink and food.   My boyfriend and I split the 100oz Caribbean Sunset, which we paired with the Bucking Bull Fries, the smoking hot chicken bites, and the Chicken and Waffles.   Overall, everything was good, but nothing really stood out and made our meal memorable.  Not even the large cocktail - and to be honest it was mostly ice and fruit juice.  We had a decent experiance but likely won't be back if next time we are in Vegas.

e6zMI8Oqs8lXPGQovXssRw.text: tried this place bc it looked similar to saddle ranch in LA.  It was good and the portions are big enough to share

Pu3UMnp1D-dEijtlk5I2_w.text: This a frat party bar. They have a mechanical bull which is fun watching people ride but that's about all this place offers. The place is small, awkwardly packed into PH / Miracle Mile, mediocre drinks, and the start point for club crawls. Its only good if youre right in the area, I certainly wouldn't make a special trip for it unless you want to ride the bull.

iMm1cP-T630XT_Is0BJ9Zw.text: Super nice place, good location, excellent prices. They also have a coupom of buy one get one drink on Yelp thats really nice too. Our waitress Jennifer was really polite and helped us with the menu. Really recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks. 22 oz Blue Moon and Strawberry Daiquiri.

xRMqD_xdf1DusLAdBIMdXQ.text: Ate dinner here tonight. Don't get the meatloaf. Wings were ok same as Hooters, Field Salad decent. Drinks were weak. Waitress gave us check without asking if we wanted anything else. I hate when we get premature checks. Waitstaff could make more money for the house and tip. I will always tip 10$ or less if they do this lame practice. But if they treat us right we gladly tip 20%

k0_nGjv4CMhr_X9EonbNJw.text: This was Nice ( is your okay with a loud bar) I enjoyed the food I needed up getting pizza. The wait was nothing. Super friendly staff

STKN5vJt4yhXKDRjN6RtJA.text: Wasn't really a fan when we were there. Needed a place to hydrate and refuel and would say our waitress was great but the food was lacking flavor. Can't even say we were too hung over because that's when we usually devour food lol. Just wished we had chosen something different.  Quick service tho which is a plus.

PlsEMCi1vPS1wBIXpcBsOw.text: A very pleasant surprise on the strip. Right next to Miracle Mile shop entrance. Just wanted a Bloody Mary and ended up with eggs Benedict breakfast that was out of this world. Did I mention this is next to Planet Hollywood also? Met many locals, and party hangover humans who all enjoyed the fun. or bar maid was nothing but funny. She reminded us of Phoebe from "friends" . Honestly, if looking for a decent place to recover in the AM, and have fun at the same time. This is the place. Enjoy!

6HxLhI-mlU-7a3ocrMXJoQ.text: Love PBR Rock Bar! Been to this place a couple times and it's got an awesome atmosphere! Highly recommend the potato skins and artichoke dip! PSA if you plan to get the quesadilla, SHARE! It's huge but oh my gosh is it good!  After your dinner Head next door to ride (or watch) the mechanical bull! So fun! My new hang out on the strip!

8EDCzksT8lfWGJFEQPLG0Q.text: It's good. Breakfast prices are very affordable for Vegas! Also got the LARGE margarita, that will set you back $60. Waited an hour for food. Probably wouldn't come back unless you want to spend 2 hours eating.

XNXKUCCacbXXlD85ptb62w.text: Food was good, but what made this experience great was our server Jerry! He was fantastic and really made my family laugh and have a great time! We loved Jerry!!!!

vQfbAHPgj9co2D91ALSoTg.text: What a successful weekend indeed!  Celebrating with some of my faves and decided to come to PBR Rock Bar on the strip.    It's a Sunday but they're pretty busy, got a booth and was being served by Taylor!  She's super friendly and really sweet!  So we ordered a few dishes to share:  Whiskey Dip (beef brisket dip Sammy) Mac n' Cheese deep dried balls Combo Platter (brisket & ribs)  In addition you could purchase a 33oz Bull Rider or 20oz Bull Fighter (you keep the glass) and the refills are $5.00.  It totally works with the live band and you definitely will not be disappointed.  The food was really flavorful (especially the deep fried tomatoes).  It was a great time with great company and delicious food.  Next time time you're in Vegas stop by and enjoy the (bull) ride!

No one said hi or even acknowledged me after a minute or so so I started time in them.I waited for four minutes before they finally asked can I help you. From the time I walked into the restroom to when I finally got service was 22 minutes. I should've known to walk away. I ordered a salad and chicken pasta. The salad was just iceberg lettuce and the pasta was unrecognizable. I only took a few bites and left.

Also have tons of other 1/2 price drink options and deals on food. We ordered the wings and the pretzel. The portions were massive. I very much enjoyed my pretzel with beer cheese. Wings were alright! HH is 2-6pm. It's a lively place for a bevie!!

pGi8jWg8OZiWA__eH8h9xg.text: There is too many things wrong with the front girls!! There rude and make up rules that are True ... you can't sit and drink unless you eat and even if u try to sit and eat they won't let u sit at a table

KCSVKgQr0UXG3KdjP9jRbw.text: Great Happy Hour Special prices, especially for Vegas! Service was just OK. We got what we asked for but it did not appear that our server enjoyed this job!

u1bPcdT2rgiv0uHWLWXH1A.text: What a great experience! It started with a smile from Mgr. Mike who saw me looking for the Redskin game on the time of TVs in the bar. He cleared a table right near the TV showing the game. Our waitress Saleena was fantastic, attentive, and smiled a lot!  The Mac and Cheese Balls were incredibly fantastic! Yummy! Thanks! I'll be back.

N7KYzU54mguobP0TuGk96A.text: Last night was my first time dining at the rock bar. The service was great form the beginning to the end . Our server was very nice and offered a few great suggestions. The food was amazing and manager (Omar)stopped by a few times to check on the satisfaction of the meal. The outdoor seating is great and we will make sure to go back

RCd6GdOVCeX9jsA77Hmzdw.text: I came here with a group of people who wanted to go here. I haven't been here after it replaced Hawaiian Tropics. They had March Madness on multiple TV's - that's pretty much the only good thing about this place...and oh, the bull too.  The girls that work here seem disinterested in their job and life in general. They have that "FML" look. We grabbed a few drinks here after dinner and watched basketball. The margaritas were ok. I wanted something strawberry so I ordered a strawberry daiquiri which our server told me not to get since it's like "drinking a Slurpee" - we had been drinking and I just want strawberry anything - can I just have whatever I want to drink? I got my daiquiri, it was just as sugary as what I was expecting and I was ok with that.  From the patio area, we moved inside when the mechanical bull caught our attention. Our server may have thought we were trying to take off without paying...by going inside? WTH? That woman had issues.  We were watching and laughing at people riding the bull - guys, girls, a bride, bridesmaids. I've never been on a mechanical bull. Somehow, I ended up riding it myself and surprisingly enough, I stayed on for 20 seconds despite wearing a dress. I had fun and wanted to do it again...until I saw the bruises on my inner thighs. But it's all good.

dhSBy8sG-Nr4Hr7--G8r1A.text: Food is about a strong 3-4. The service however SUCKED. At least the one provided from our waiter did. Won't put him on blast by using his name but it was so bad we wouldn't come back regardless how the food tasted.   One example; we ordered an appetizer. But then our food came out & no appetizer :( so we let our grumpy waiter know since our main course is already out he can cancel the appetizer. His response? Instead of a quick "oh my bad - yeah I'll take it off" he replies back with "you never ordered an appetizer ".... -_- my friend and I just looked at each other and laughed. We were so over it by this point.   The whole time he seemed annoyed & eager to move to the next table, short with his answers, etc. His service gets the place a 1 but the food saved the overall rating.

DqOixEO8IU-3AVUDB5LawA.text: Awesome service! Make sure you sit at the bar where Jake is bartending, great personality and amazing service!

5dOSTpn1b9bCYGnZ2DmzlA.text: Our group really enjoyed lunch here. Delicious fried pickle spear appetizer and AMAZING Brisket Dip. Large, tasty portions. Fun atmosphere with a mechanical bull!!! Our party earned a free ride which was a fun experience. We all would definitely come again.

nLLvFi1OJZVBqI-KEaomsA.text: I like the location and atmosphere - the patio is right on the strip.  The booth seats are too low for the tables though so we sat at a high table.  We had the mac n cheese balls and the $4.99 breakfast which was the BEST value on the strip!  I will go back for that menu item.

NaxAmCcDxAKMkWmSKDDN0g.text: Good bar food. Courtney was awesome. BUT they only had one Maui porter (one can, not one choice) so we had to split it to taste. Friend recommended it. Not available east of Mississippi River. Tasty once it warmed up to porter temp. Too sweet when cold. Evidently PBR was in transition on their menu and their craft beers. "We're out of that" too often. Fun place anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now we&#39;re talkin&#39;!
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ugh. Only had one can. Very good once it warmed up
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken and chips. Good bar food

qH8uPQ4uhWNxCLJ8ikZx6Q.text: The food was excellent, got the 2 for 1 drink special which was amazing. All in all had a great experience except for the fact they didn't have Ketchup, Mustard & hot sauce on our table   But would definitely recommend to a friend

_34AQdkOS3GcOleausTnRw.text: Wow I don't know why I never thought to come in...right at the entrance of Miracle Mile with a great view and awesome food! TVs everywhere to enjoy whichever sport you'd like, and a Bull ride if you dare (don't eat before please!) We ordered:  Caprese salad: The grilled chicken was extremely moist and delicious, and the vegetables were fresh. My only gripe is that it was overdressed, making the salad mix limp and overly soggy.   Sweet potato tots: I don't see this very often, so I just had to try it! Definitely an experience...I think I like sweet potato fries better, but this was a neat way to munch on somethin' sweet--especially since they give you maple syrup on the side!  Firecracker cole slaw: My buddy and I both expected something hot and spicy, but there were poprocks inside the slaw! Interesting concept, though it wasn't to my liking.   Brisket: Yummm...fall apart tender with a good BBQ sauce on top. It wasn't the best brisket I've had, but this isn't exactly a BBQ joint made JUST for BBQ...so it's A-OKAY in my book!  My friends also got chicken and waffles (he DEVOURED it...must've been good) and Doritos Mac N' Cheese, which was also pretty good and unique. Overall, I'd say to grab some grub over here if  you can't figure out what to eat, but want to watch the game. Great American food with plenty of entertainment to give you and your friends a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese salad
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket with Doritos Mac n cheese
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken waffles

0e01BAUS8rhWTYpndExmTA.text: First time here. When we for there we had to wait 20 minutes,even though there were a lot of empty tables, but 20 minutes was not bad.  Service was great, our waiter was excellent ( sorry didn't get his name). We ordered some wings ( the lime/tapatio highly recommend) and burgers. Everything was very delicious expecially the fries. Everything was going great, everyone was happy smiling having a great time when suddenly the people next to us started to get loud. As always I try not to stare or be noisy but my husband was closer and had a better view. Well looks like a female that was waiting was looking at the game when a male that was on that direction started telling her "what are you looking at" confused the girl apologized and said she was looking at the game.  Well I guess it wasn't enough for the male that he started to cuss her out, to the point were she started to cry. Some not sure if it was a waiter or manager went to the male and his party and was talking to them but it was not good enough. The male was still being loud, so the couple left. As the couple was leaving the females male components was trying to tell the hosstage that that party were being very rude. Well the male in the group started to use fowl language to a point that my family and I also had to leave.  I don't think we will be returning not because of the food, food was excellent but because I think that this place didn't do the right thing, they let the wrong person leave and didn't do much to ask the problem causers  to leave.  To me that's not good customer service.

XPSsJWTRRjUgwT4OUvknXg.text: The Rock Bar is a great little spot in Vegas. The food and drinks are ok. The atmosphere is what the whole bar is about.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The flaming tables are a great place to chill.

KjtWg8Qj8laD7Vx5M0KRlA.text: If i could give this place any stars it would be zero. I left my photos which were purchased on a table top outside in the bar area, so when I realized I left them behind, I called to ask if they were put away in a lost and found they told me to "call back in the morning, we're closed" when it was 12:30am and YELP says they close at 2am. What bar closes at 12:30 am in Vegas? Also, our $65 bowl fruit drink was not worth it. I ended up buying 2 Coronas for $18. Probably won't be coming back.

pSUp7f_nVnypDgBjU-80vQ.text: Typical. But typical is not good in Vegas. You have to stand out and be the place you can only find in Vegas. Good location tho.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Vdp5cNTiPlcC_IbhcPIlg.text: Just to give you some perspective, I had to create a yelp account just to write this.  This was my first time in Vegas so I was your typical tourist walking up and down the strip looking for a place to grab a drink. It was 5:00 PM so I was looking for a place to cash in on a happy hour deal and watch some sports.   Since this was a Wednesday night in November there were little options for sporting events. However, the Penguins were playing the Capitals, which if you know anything about hockey you should know that's worth throwing on one of the 50 tvs they have. Instead they had replays of MAC football games and the NFL network on (remember this is a Wednesday).  So ok, they made a mistake. As the only person at the bar I kindly asked them to turn on the hockey game. The sweet bartender said she will find a manager who has permission to do so(which she did). However the manager (who seemed like a real douche) couldn't complete this simple task. Therefore, I was forced to be that guy who asked them to turn on the game three times.   On top of this, their fire alarm came on and everyone on their staff just continued on working. I asked the bartender if we should be concerned and evacuate, in which she replied, "no, this happens all the time".   The game eventually came on and I was already face deep into buy one get one gin & tonics plus happy hour food specials so I stayed. Moral of the story, you can certainly find a better place to get some food and enjoy a drink. They are awarded one star for their kind bartender and cheap deals (compared to other places on the strip).

r50rAZFtgwOuRWw17k_wrQ.text: Food was ok but customer service was lacking. Wanted an inside table because it was a little cold outside so we were seated by the door and every time the door opened the wind would blow around the stuff on our table, not to mention the food getting prematurely cold. Bus boys would kick the door open and leave it open. Spoke to manager Tammy who in the end did nothing  to move us or help us.  Nothing worse than having to wear your coat inside of a restaurant to keep warm when trying to eat your meal. Pretty sad. When you really don't care, this is what happens. Shame on you PBR Rock Bar & Grill

Y_diTXUqYX4SxqvjMmPa1w.text: The food was good. I ordered the tostada nachos with pulled pork. Presentation was fun and the pulled pork was delicious. There was a NBA finals game on, so it was really loud. It wasn't super busy, but it took us about 20 minutes to get seated, for a party of four, and there were plenty of extra tables. The service was HORRIBLE. Our food and check took forever, and they only came over to check our drinks once. It's probably the worst service I've ever had in Vegas.

i_bvYC-FGxOHikLrAW4Oiw.text: You have the funnest bar in Planet Hollywood. Walk outside, see the Strip, take a stroll around Planet Hollywood for ten minutes, and then return to Rock Bar to finish seeing the game. Ladies Night is Thursday. My wife's corporation is going to hold their meetings in Fall at PBR Rock Bar.   National Finals Rodeo is coming up.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eXUeBoiFBeORtuIShASZ0A.text: I'm just gonna throw this out there because I could not find an answer anywhere.. it's $5 to ride the bull but you get a free ride when you dine in or with some "liquid courage." Now on to the review..  We've been here probably 3-4 times, and there's a reason we keep coming back! Good food, fun atmosphere, and we always leave with leftovers! Is it a little pricey? Of course it is, you're in Vegas on the strip! What did you expect?   We had tempura pickles (fried pickles) as an appetizer and they were great! So were the chips that came with it! The buffalo chicken flatbread was great, more than enough for one person! My parents had burgers and they said they were fantastic!  Also, if you do ride the bull, fully expect a nice bruise on your thigh to appear by the next day  but still a fun experience and worth it!

sQYaDolvDt1sPNqmXZJ7IQ.text: First of all, the place is conveniently located. Good music plus the bull riding is very fun to watch.

uPk5OUtrpRzJBMirALWDkQ.text: Rock Bar,Rock star   Omar is on top of it. A True assist to this team!!!  Attention to detail and great service

y4gDy0Lc0NA8OFE-1GG8Lg.text: Came here on Cinco de Mayo. The hostesses were rude, but the crew inside was awesome! Our waitress got us our drinks and we ordered chicken quesadillas for appetizers because they were on sale for the holiday. The quesadillas were excellent.   As the process went on, our waitress started to disappear. She did do a good job though when she was around! The place was busy so I understand. Our entrees came and everyone was happy. I had the BBQ burger and it was perfect! I'll be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hxIqjwBn-9DoxRXmRzTo7Q.text: Excellent service,  super good food , music awesome.. I just love this place.. we were soo hungry at 12am n we cant find any grill bar.. sooo after looking soo long we find this place!!! Its perfect and relax! I don't know why have soo low rate :/

p_uJRX3y1mhXsUbC-YAbdw.text: Food is solid. I got a chicken sandwich  it's was okay best part the French fries!! Very yummy!!! Boyfriend got the blackened chicken Alfredo it's was okay I didn't like it when I tried it

LoF1APMzzK9bhMERKA464Q.text: My girlfriend and I went here for lunch and were very disappointed. The drinks were incredibly strong and poorly made. Unfortunately I don't have anything to comment on the food. After waiting for nearly a half hour, our order was taken. Then after an hour+ we were notified that our order was never placed. Luckily we weren't charged for the drinks, but then again we shouldn't have been because we ended up sending them back. The service was very poor and I can't in good conscience recommend this restaurant to anyone. There are many great restaurants on the Strip that deserve your patronage over this one.

2XsCBC21oFubvMBT3eV5jQ.text: Horrid! We paid for dinner and show through Vegas.com. Upon arrival we were given an alternate menu which had only 3 selections. I thought I was ordering a chicken pasta dish what I actually got was runny shells n cheese that was inedible. And when I told the waiter that I didn't realize I was ordering macaroni and cheese and the menu said chicken he looked at me as if he was stunned and said oh you want chicken. We left. I will never go back and if they are so hard up for money that this is the best they have then run! Don't go. They should be ashamed.

mGfVea6S2F3ICaPYboPW0w.text: Food was decent. Service was awful. We had ordered and gotten our food by the time our waiter finally came back and told my they were out if PBR. What!! It took you a half hour to tell me the beer I ordered to have with my meal is out. Fabulous! I are my food and halfway through I finally get a beer. Would not waste your time. Pick a restaurant girls aren't standing outside waving the menu and asking you to come in.

ejNL79wVdt9aWrmItvyCRw.text: I really wanted to like this place. Prior to my recent trip to Vegas, I had come across quite a bit of information regarding PBR. All of the photos and information made it seem like a fun, interesting place.  A few of us needed a quick bite after a long walk perusing the strip. Of the choices around Miracle Mile, I opted for PBR based on the above. We entered where a sign said "entrance", but had to ask a server if we were to seat ourselves only to be shown the hostess stand opposite of the "entrance" sign. Not a big deal, but a little confusing (saw others do the same as we did).   We were seated outside, and opted to order appetizers as we wanted to get back to our adventures on the strip. I ordered a drink that claimed to have a favorite rum of mine in it, and a side of fries. The drink was good enough, but I'm not sure it contained any alcohol as I certainly could not taste even a hint of the rum. The fries were edible, but I wouldn't care to pay for them again - reminiscent of Burger King fries and were lukewarm at best. Another I was with ordered the Bucking Bull Fries, and was equally displeased, as was the one who ordered the Signature Wings.  The server was pleasant, but she disappeared for a long time halfway through our quick stop (went on break?) -- halfway really being about the time we were ready to leave. Our quick stop turned into being there for almost an hour. A couple of us even left as we waited for the server to return to take payment. (We were told that she claimed to have had most of the tables due to it being really busy and apparently short-handed - the patio was not even half-full and the inside area was maybe half-full -- if that is really busy, then I would hate to see the service when the tables are actually filled).  I also couldn't tolerate the music that was played outside, which seemed to be mostly a hip-hop type - more club-esque than what I'd expect at a "rock bar & grill". The music being played indoors seemed a lot better, and I wish we had been given an option of whether we had wanted a table indoors or out.  The only pro was the people watching, but I would have much preferred doing this as I spent my time enjoying Vegas and not unnecessarily waiting around while being subjected to bad music.  At least I know now to avoid this place on my next trip.

vUpepT4LC9qnA1yMUly7Ww.text: Hit and miss....We go here often, good food and always fun, however the service is not consistent. IF you get the right server, it's great, otherwise, rather frustrating waiting to place an order. Hostesses are poorly trained and not too bright.

vnlYq_USVb2X2M0iw7IAAQ.text: When we went it was like they were very desperate to get us in there. It was dead...and apparently hip-hop night (not rock night). It also wasnt until we left that we discovered there was a WHOLE other section with food and more people, but we were ready to bounce. Drinks were not that cheap and the service was not great in that back little bar. I doubt I will be back. Sorry folks.

xM3gkQPOf5H08nqsFvw7zA.text: Let me just preface this one by saying...most of this review is based on the service not the food!  I would like to say that this place was fun and tasty, but it honestly wasn't.  We went in there around 10 at night and just wanted to something to munch on b/c we had not eaten dinner and no one seemed hungry enough to sit down somewhere and order a late night dinner.  So, the 5 of us decided to order about 4 different appetizers including the fried pickles, potato skins, buffalo wings, and buffalo fingers.    My first experience with fried pickles was a bust and I had high hopes.  There was way too much cornmeal involved.  While I did actually like the buffalo fingers and potato skins...all of that went out the window because of the honest to goodness douchetard waiter we had.  I'd like to say I remember his name, but all I remember was his purposefully lopsided mohawk and his disgustingly rude attitude.  Granted, we came in and just ordered appetizers and my friends had ordered their huge yard drink before we came in.  But was it really necessary for him to tell us how annoyed he was about these things?  He was a jerk and told us he would shoot himself in the head if we wanted to separate our checks at the end of our meal.  And no...he was not joking.

5GVNAXF6WeedtTDljbFjiw.text: From start to finish, the staff at PBR Rock Bar and Grill were pretty awesome. We were there for the beginning of a bachelor party and got set up with Jessica I believe for our server and she did a wonderful job. The portions were pretty darn big and the club sandwich I got was very good. They let the bachelor ride the bull for free as well as another member of our group who was having a birthday. We hit up the beer pong tables and watched a ton of sports. They were able to accommodate our party of 14 which was great. All in all it was a great place to kick off a crazy night in Vegas!

6A0VA6j33iAGaUBW5W3H3w.text: Our first water had something floating I it so we asked for another that one also had something floating in it so we shared one drink ..... Our server was slow. We said we didn't like the Doritos Mac n cheese and he didn't care or say anything and we are currently waiting for our check. As locals we will not return. Our servers name ?? Good question he never told us nor did he ever smile.

Ix_9haEjRHTqrPvEKwRzuA.text: Review is for the bar only.  We came here ONLY because "Fat Tuesdays" at the Miracle Mile Shops was closed for a few hours due to some troubles w/their machines.   What a rip off! We all got the 32 oz slushy drink for $18.( I think someone posted a picture) That thing had about 1 1/2 shots of alcohol (W E A K). I didn't even drink the entire thing, I threw it out and got a refill @ Fat Tuesdays in Cesar's Palace.   Lesson learned.  Accept no imitations, if you want a good slushy drink in Vegas go to FAT TUESDAYS!

MiH0DoGeeCfin5kbQkN9vg.text: Didn't expect much for breakfast but it was amazing! Had the peaches and cream oatmeal and the country scramble. Highly recommend!

bjb-l8Ld4PjCpxwc-5MTyQ.text: Stopped here before a show in PH. We went here because everywhere else seemed too busy for the amount of time we had. I ordered the pulled chicken, which was dry and bland. My friends ordered the pulled pork which was up to par, and the salmon which she said was good but she says everything is good. The fries were the best part of the meal for me and along with reasonably priced beer, was the only saving point for this restaurant. Service was slow and the waitress didn't really seem to care. She apologized for taking 15 minutes to get to our table but then continued to provide mediocre service.

uCzM7nMr16bdhcikGdDQSQ.text: All I have to say is B-E-S-T french fries! Like, literally, the best. I wish I could have some right now, but unfortunately there is no PBR Rock Bar in Boston. Their crunchy slaw is pretty damn good as well, and they have some great drink specials.

1M3EzAIBbpAOfBWPZJjz1w.text: Got comped a bottle of pinnacle and only had to pay for gratuity which was not bad at all. It was ladies night but we were the only ladies in there lol. Music was cool, top 40 and hip hop and drinks at the bar were only a dollar. They have drinking games and stuff there for the guys too btw. Check it out.

Y1bDKyV1BN6pXFDYVR2vtg.text: This review is strictly for the alcohol on the outside of the restaurant.  Got my yardlong slushie drink here... Added an extra shot (which seriously, I think she put a total of 5-6 shots worth of vodka into the drink), and all for about $30.  The slushy flavors were good, and I love that the bartenders were a little heavy handed :P  Only bad thing, they didn't mix the alcohol into the slushy, so my first couple of sips were ALL vodka :)  Which is not necessarily a bad thing.

2d-NYMWltfntoP3euOGWTA.text: Review is for the food only!  In search of a late night snack, we found ourselves at the PBR and somehow convinced ourselves that we needed to get a large portion of the Doritoes Mac & Cheese with a large side of fries.  FANTASTIC DECISION on our part. Back from Vegas + I'm still thinking about that lovin'. I mean, really, Mac + Cheese with crushed Doritoes? You think you can make it at home and all will be well...no. It. may. be. disastrous.  The fries were not out of this world & soggy by the time we got them into our hotel (not even 10 minutes?). The servers weren't particularly attentive which was supremely odd because the bar/grill area was pretty empty (on a Thursday night?!).  I don't plan on returning to try their other menu items as I KNOW I can get cheaper eats around town...but definitely count me in for that Mac & Cheeeesy Cheese. YUM.

l8qL_y0EjegEzPmCu7cZwA.text: We were seated right away.. They asked what we wanted to drink.. (Corona and Sierra mist), took them 10 minutes to get our drinks and it was not even busy.. we were the only table inside that ordered dinner. After, the food came out pretty fast.. Ordered wings and fries. They were pretty good.  Their waiting service sucks though, I had to get up and ask the bartender for a glass of water.  All in all it was okay.

ht5AFcTGagAoKUGBwvkgWg.text: Excellent burgers! Buffalo Chicken pizza YES! Service was great here, if not a bid snobbish. They wanted to try and charge us up the HOOHOO because the football games were on... when we explained we were only eating and then leaving our waitress was a bit put out. Overall though it was a good experience in a great hotel, Planet Hollywood.

tFrgRXUhtgKAQ2ebBZkF_g.text: Sometimes the low yelp rating just doesn't reflex the business. That's how I feel about PBR.  From the outside it just looks like cheesy bar, but the food is pretty good. I went with a group of 6, everyone liked it and it's a great spot to watch a game, which is what we were doing.

aKmzbHSAhsxgQRgtBkGnmQ.text: 2 for 1 drink specials, a great 3 piece live band and a pretty relaxing atmosphere. It was a little piece of heaven on the overwhelming strip for us. Will be coming back the next time we are on vacation here!

Vw6z6146uij8EK-B9E0HqQ.text: This place is A-Ok. It is certainly in a prime area in Las Vegas. The location is right on the strip and is within the Planet Hollywood building.  I love the fact that this bar has an outdoor seating area equipped with misters. It wasn't especially hot the day I was there, but the misters were very refreshing.   Our server was very quick with service and took good care of us. There were lots of TV's to watch football. It was fun to see so many different teams represented.   The menu was a little confusing, but had a lot of options. There are large, fish bowl type drinks, a couple beers on tap, a cider, and bottles. Not a great selection. I know it's a PBR bar but nothing they had really appealed to me. I considered a mixed drink, but all it showed on the menu was their $45 fish bowls. Another comment on the menu, it was grossly sticky and worn down. When it's just a paper menu, it gives a bad first impression that they're used 500,000 times before you get it. I didn't quite understand why there were fries and such included, but then a list of items on the side.   Now for the food. I ordered the fajita's. They came quickly and were delicious. The food tasted fresh and was worth the $15. The only problem was that there were only 4 corn tortillas and enough food for 9 tortillas.   The overall feel of the place was nice, but a little dirty. They could use a little more attention to detail and new menus and this place could easily be 4-5 star rating.

34wSUEUjNoc8Abxa_x1M6g.text: Our service was horrible. Our waiter went missing for 45 minutes and we finally found him flirting with bar tender. The food was decent rather have had McDonald's.

hg_rI7aJ9nQceMqGBXeruw.text: 1 star for the bartender being a thief...... OK we were doing the VEGAS thing so we decided to buy some of those HUGE drinks , 100oz or something like that. We had been Bar hopping for a few hours already and we came across PBR.. Went in and had a few drinks. On our way out one of the girls from our party eye balled the big drink she went up to the Bartender and asked if they were available; Rudely she answer, " If they are there, then we obviously we have them." Really lady, she was asking because you might be out of them, which by the way some other bar was. Anyway that's not the worst of it, we still ended up buying 3 of those things and the Girl from the bar asked if we wanted some extra shots for a few extra dollars, I asked how much alcohol the drink had already and she said " not much maybe like 8%," For me that would be too low but for the 3 girls who bought the drinks they thought it would be ok so we did not pay extra for shots..... Wells Guess what???? The freaking drinks came with no alcohol to begin with, she sold us Virgin Drinks ad alcohol beverages. She is lucky we didn't find this out until we were long gone. Anyways PBR should had reimbursed us for those drinks, but I didn't feel like being an A-hole and getting the girl fired, because in my book that is consider STEALING........ and we tipped her SMH.  2 THUMBS DOWN

6GuVmGPYazSfKJ1fEtjgFQ.text: I made an outdoor reservation but was told there was no room outside. It was a beautiful day and wanted to people watch so I was disappointed about that. Other than that, the service was good. My son and his gf are vegans and they were more than happy to answer questions and ask the chef what they didn't know. Good food and a great music selection -just a little too loud to enjoy conversation.

ikyuWfBs4IZ96af9QWfEIQ.text: If I'd written this review in 2012 or 2014 I'd have said they place was unbeatable, but fast forward to 2017 and this place has really gone downhill. They've changed the menu, no where near as good as it once was. Food is average, drinks are overpriced and service is average at best. I'd give another bar or grill a go before PBR again.

U3wDHY3cg_mTL9XYt1ckag.text: We ordered the boneless buffalo wings and a shrimp and tomato appetizer. The boneless wings were dry, it could be because we were there at midnight, and the shrimp appetizer could have had more shrimp lol. I would give them another chance. The live band was nice and we sat outside which was perfect!

s1_YklIPFJd770Fu0K2Huw.text: We ate here based on location and the cool looking fire pits outside.  I would recommend you use more logical decision making when choosing a place to eat!  The hostesses at the hostess stand inside had no clue.  The first one told us there was no open seating outside.  The second one said she didn't handle outside seating and there was a different hostess outside we needed to see.  We went outside and were seated next to one of the long fire pits, which was nice since it was a little chilly.  Service was pretty bad, we had to flag someone down after 8 minutes or so to get our food ordered.  I ordered the blackened chicken fettucine and the bf ordered the chili cheese dog.    Shortly after we ordered, they had an issue with the fire pits and had to keep lighting and relighting them, leaning over various customers and their tables.  Our food took a little long to come out, but was right when it did.  It was average tasting, nothing worth coming back for.  The blackened chicken fettucine was spicy, as promised by the menu.  The chili dog was huge!  My two cents are to try someplace of which you might have higher expectations.

MJt7VcjkCzEezwxSpNHR0w.text: I usually don't take the time to write a review, but I have no problem making time for this place.   I was traveling from out of town with a group of about 25 people to Las Vegas from Southern California. We visit Vegas twice a year as a group and wanted to change up our normal routines to something different. We were excited to give this place a try. About half of our group arrived early and was greeted at the door by someone with wristbands for $5 drinks and free mechanical bull ride with receipt of your first drink. Awesome right? We thought so... so we all get our wristbands, buy a round of drinks and settle in to this completely empty bar looking forward to the night ahead. After about 10 minutes in the bar changed bartenders, we went up for drinks and the bartender informed us that our wristbands were no good and that it was only for women. No problem, this wasn't going to ruin our night. So one of the girls in the group goes to buy a drink as well as a round for her boyfriend. The bartender notices that she's buying a drink for herself and for one of the men and immediately becomes confrontational with the female. She then proceeds to slam the register drawer shut and toss the pen on to the bar. At this point we request the manager who comes out to try and calm the situation down and explains that there was a mix up and they would not be honoring the wristbands for the men but would honor it for the women.   Moments later, the bartender becomes confrontational with one of the women again and then begins using outrageous and unprofessional language at the group. We obviously at this point decided to leave, so we briefly waited outside in the main hall for the rest of the group to arrive as well as for food that had been ordered. A security guard is then sent to the door and enters the hallway where he says that we will have to move on somewhere else.  I can't even say enough bad things about this place and our experience here. Was literally the worst half hour we have ever had in Las Vegas and I'm still in disbelief at how disrespected a group of 25 paying customers would be treated, especially considering the whole problem was originally stemmed from their own mistake. It's clear to me why this place was empty on a Saturday night in Las Vegas.

gZQ00AWXmhD_HuQRHZO0xw.text: After coming in last year and having a good time to stopping in again and having the worst service ever I've gotta change my rating. Seriously. Service was really bad. The server repeatedly forgot drinks we had ordered and then would disappear for what seemed like forever.   The worst thing was, my food sucked. I ended up scarfing down some of my friends BBQ chicken pizza because my buffalo chicken pizza, that sounded so good, in reality was not. It just tasted hot. Like burn my mouth hot. But no buffalo flavor. Does that make sense? It just wasn't good.   I'd probably still buy the cheap drinks at their bar or counter in PH, but i wouldn't come and eat again. Stick to the drinks! Don't tell me I didn't warn you!

0E3KiXivmKCgBYjqHZPUCA.text: There is no guarantee of tomorrow. It is so important to make the most of each day and night. My dear friend Christie and I made the most of last Friday night when we met her lifelong friends at PBR Rock Bar.     From a local's perspective, driving to PBR Rock Bar is a nightmare. It is not like the Voodoo Lounge or Level 107 Lounge where you pull in from a 4-lane arterial into a well designed parking garage. The local has to maneuver through the mayham of the Strip area traffic. The worst part is maneuvering through the Planet Hollywood/Miracle Mile parking garage. It is a poorly designed parking lot without notice that the motorist is driving the wrong way. Once the local finds the parking spot, it is a walk through the corridors of Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood to reach PBR Rock Bar where the mall touches the Las Vegas Strip. Now, If your vacationing on the Strip, PBR Bar is a short walk off the sidewalk.    PBR Rock Bar is really two different bars under one business. You have the indoor bar and nightclub overlooking the mall and the outdoor bar and nightclub patio overlooking the mid Strip. This is where the high energy is. When you look up you could see the Cosmopolitan tower, when you look straight you see a Las Vegas Strip bordered by Planet Hollywood and the Cosmopolitan. In the near distance the intermittent Bellagio Fountains dance and the Eiffel Tower stands tall. In the near distance, the sidewalks are prime people watching. Looking into the bar, there stands the mechanical bull. The mechanical bull is really a symbol of their business practice. They really take the customer for a ride by charging different prices for the exact beverage. That is bull!  In hindsight I regret not riding the mechanical bull. I think it would of been a lot of fun. In reality, my eyes and attention were on my company. The volume of the music was at a decibel where we could hear one another. Christie and I started out in the indoor bar. When you arrive from the Planet Hollywood parking garage, you enter through the indoor bar. From this angle, the outdoor patio is camouflaged by a wall and dim interior. After Christie's friends called her we'd find our way to the outdoor patio. This is where we'd spend around 3 hours of our lives.      There is an admission price for guys. Even guys who drink girl drinks :-). The admission is $10. But it includes a drink. For the Las Vegas Strip this is a decent deal. The average drink on the Las Vegas Strip is $12. And if I'm not mistaken, a 22 ounce beer upstairs in Twin Peaks is $10. Once your in the bar, a click on the Yelp application illuminates the buy one get one free drink check-in. The average drink is around $12. By the conclusion of the 3 drinks, people ought to be up in Space Mountain-a state of a nice relaxing buzz.      By the time I drank the three drinks, I was up in Space Mountain enjoying a nice relaxing buzz. I enjoyed two Blue Hawaiins and a Bahamas Mama. Supposedly they are girl drinks. But I got to be a man and tell the truth. They were delicious but nothing spectacular. The bartenders didn't even bother to add a maraschino cherry. They came in a plastic cup. They were a delicious route to get to Space Mountain. They taste like fruit punch with alcohol. Now high up in Space Mountain,  I thought I was being funny and managed to drink Christie's Whiskey Neat. I am no connoisseur on whiskey, but it was decent and put me to the summit of Space Mountain. When I brought Christie, a replacement Whiskey Neat I was incognizent to the idea that the bartender charged different prices for the exact drink. I'd end the night with the least expensive beer. It was PBR. Although I was in no state to keep track of the price, I think it was $5.    Now back to Earth and off Space Mountain,  when I reflect on PBR Rock Bar, I see 3 stars. I dislike the inconsistency in price. However, there is a high energy level to the place. Its setting on the Las Vegas Strip in the shadow of the Cosmopolitan Tower and in the sightlines of The Bellagio Fountains and Eiffel Tower is high energy. $25 for a nice buzz is a good deal. Most of all I enjoy the memories of spending three hours here with my friend and her friends.

photos.caption: Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Blue Hawaiin and Bahama Mama. By the time I could take the picture, the whiskey neat was history :-)

kFa4qPMC6KDWLy7LX0kSNA.text: Nothing pisses me off more than sketchy business practices, Daniel, my usual PIC joined me to have some drinks with a childhood friend and his ubercool wife. The first plan was Voodoo, but the cover was stupid. Here, ladies were free & gents paid $10 and received a free drink ticket. There's a Yelp buy one-get one check in offer. Shoulda used it. We were a little confused and didn't realize my friends were in same bar, just on patio overlooking Strip. The view was nice and misters kept things cool. What was not cool was the fact that different barkeeps charged $8-$11 for a whiskey neat. Pisses me off. Had this not occurred, it would be a 3* experience. The company was great, watching fools ride the bull was fun...but the "I'll choose how much to charge" pricing left me feeling taken advantage of. Or, my friends who replaced my disappearing whiskey :) Daniel enjoyed his Girl Drink Drunk Blue Hawaiians and Bahama Mama's. Aside from great times with awesome people, I'll pass on a return visit. Check out this video on YouTube: youtube.com/watch?v=8C4T... Good times!

Photo of PBR Rock Bar & Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good times 6.20.14 The &#34;hidden&#34; patio/Strip view entrance. Come through the black wall from PH/MM shops...

3atTVuV2XlKNAaKL5dfbDQ.text: Had the best drinks for the best deal (BOGO ) and the buffalo chicken burger with sweet potato fries is highly recommended  Made my Vegas experience GREAT ! Two thumbs up

iROiFNTTc4pdpRpxl7KDNw.text: A sports bar atmosphere on the strip! At lunch we all had burgers fries wings and things and of course brews! Haven't had a PBR since my HS party days many years ago when pounders were invented! But it's a sports party bar on the strip with a party menu! Great lunch sit outside watch people walk by and enjoy your lunch! Did I mention it's a sports bar bar atmosphere?enjoy It's Vegas!

g6Rufg47_3AiJKGf5auBXA.text: Great atmosphere with outdoor dining. Came for a late lunch and back again for a cheap breakfast! Food was fantastic!

ffTeFtLmWQE15GkTCNdcgQ.text: The day started out real lame with the hotel losing our reservations and not honoring our conformation number, But I digress. We were starving so we walked into literally te first bar we see and wow  I glad we did.  Rome behind the bar totally turned around our experience. Thanks for the great hospitality brotha. Next time I'm in town I'm coming here for lunch.   We had the pulled pork - amazing. And the chicken strips - amazing.   And drinks before 11
